story:
Community focused Mums making a difference

Over the last three years, we have run birthday parties, hen parties, an end-of-year rugby club celebration, corporate events and more. We've managed with a tiny 40 litre capacity kiln which has served us beautifully.
In the last six months our focus has turned to supporting community organisations. We bring our workshops to nurseries, playgroups, schools, youth groups like Scouts and Girl Guides. In exchange for booking us, 20% of our takings are donated to the group for their own funds.
This has been a very popular concept for us but we have been limited in what we can do by being able to fit just six plates in the kiln at each firing. We can fire the kiln once in 24 hours, so this has become unsustainable for us.

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking for £2000 to buy a significantly larger kiln with the shelves and props needed to be able to fire 40 plates in one firing. This would expand our capacity dramatically and turn a part-time pocket money operation into a viable business, allowing us to support our families.

In exchange, we will make sure you get something for your money. We are using this campaign to encourage supporters to buy our products.
- £3 will get you one of our branded logo badges
- £5 will get you an embossed brooch or magnet of your choice
- £12 will get you a hand or footprint personalised plate or mug
- £20 will be rewarded with a set of six brooches or magnets
- £150 gets a 10 person children's ceramic painting birthday party (lasts two hours) at a venue of your choice
- £250 gets a 10 person adult ceramic painting party (lasts 3-4 hours) at a venue of your choice. Suitable for hen/stag.

The Impact

By having a larger kiln, we would have the capacity to actively look for more bookings. This would allow us to support our families financially, with work we are passionate about.

  • Scotland no longer has any Ceramics degrees in operation. With our larger capacity kiln, we would be able to do more voluntary workshops introducing children & young people to clay. We have worked with Primary 6 classes in Glasgow over the last 3 years doing this with great success.
  • We would be able to take on more community fundraising projects, with groups like Scouts, Guides, Parent & Toddler or suchlike to help them build reserves to use with their members.
  • We could facilitate more parties and workshops, firing up to six times as much in one go.
  • Our environmental impact would be reduced. Yay for lower electricity bills!

Other Ways You Can Help

We need people to know what we're doing:

  • Tweet tweet tweet! Tell your kids, tell your wife... If people know about us, they can back us.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to share us around your social media.

story:
What we are doing

Born out of love for the small city, The Crossing Guide is a glimpse into the culture of small vibrant communities in the Northwest. Each story is a puzzle piece that is only a part of the larger city picture. We feature stores such as outdoors, local art, theatre, city experiences, original tales dreamed up by our talented writers, music, food, and shopping to only name a few. Our finger is constantly on the pulse of the goings-on in Whatcom, Skagit, Island and Snohomish counties and we want to share our findings with you. Think of us as your friend in the Northwest.

Who we are

We are a 100 page glossy magazine with grand personality. Our team is a collection of writers, designers, and locals who share the same goal of expressing what makes our communities great. Located in Bellingham, WA we are in a prime location to reach out to our Canadian neighbors.

Our goal

Right now we are in the process of finalizing the posh personality of the publication. As a small locally owned business, we just need a final push to get us to the end. That’s where you come in.

Your contributions will help fund our printing, distribution, and operational expenses. No matter how big or small of a donation, each dollar will help bring us one step closer to sharing our community culture.

Help us turn our dream of sharing our communities with our Northern neighbors into a reality.

For more information or to keep tabs on what we're up to check us out on the web and follow us on Facebook and Twitter. (links below)

story: Gent d’Alella és una plataforma cívica així que no tenim el suport econòmic o material per la campanya electoral de les eleccions municipals que rebran els partits polítics. Necessitem 6.000 € que utilitzarem per comunicació a través del web i les xarxes socials, per editar la revista que contindrà el programa electoral i fer-la arribar a les 3.700 llars d’Alella, per a produir els cartells electorals i per a organitzar els actes de la campanya.  Qualsevol aportació de 5, 20, 50, 200 euros ens ajudarà.

story: On A Roll is a student run, non-profit food stand with the social mission of bridging the gap between Avenues students and the Hudson Guild students by employing them side-by-side. On A Roll sells classic spring rolls with an innovative twist; the traditional asian contents are replaced by a multiplicity of cuisines and foods: from chicken parmesan to Nutella and banana. On A Roll’s stand would act as a vehicle for engaging the New York City community, a medium with which students can learn transferable real-world skills, and a platform to fund charities in Chelsea. We would use this money to fund all of the pre-opening expenses (a large deep fryer + permits) and our operating expenses for the first day (ingredients + commissary kitchen space + equipment rental).

story:
Support the expansion of Ronin's Art and Armor

What is Ronin's Art and Armor (RAA) ?

RAA is a small, home-based studio focusing on creating high end custom cosplay props and armor, as well as teaching local Colorado cosplayers and creators new skills and techniques for creating their own pieces

Why do we need your help?

RAA is looking to move from a hobby level to full time commission work, and to do so we need to expand the tools and workstations available to increase production, and reduce costs associated with longer working times. The increased workstations will also be used to hold individual and group classes to educate crafters and cosplayers in the proper techniques for creating with new and different materials.

What we need:

  • Tools for cutting and forming wood, foam, fiberglass, urethane etc.
  • Workbenches for building and class spaces
  • Specialty tools like a 3D printer, foundry, and a vacuforming table
  • Laptop/tablet for design, research, reference, and bookkeeping
  • Camera equipment for documenting builds, and streaming educational videos 
What will you get as a supporter? (just a few of the perks available)
  • $5+ My personal gratitude!
  • $25 A custom Ronin's Art and Armor T-shirt!
  • $100 A pair of free classes!* ($200 value, *materials cost may apply)
  • $500 A medium to large size prop!*
  • $1000 A large prop or set of light armor
  • $2500 Medium prop and armor set

What does this do for our community?

The Colorado cosplay community is one of the larger groups in the nation, but our access to high end builders and costume construction education is rather limited. Sure there are plenty of sewing classes, and anyone can watch a youtube video, but there's a distinct lack of hands on experiences for people wanting to learn how to work with advanced materials like fiberglass, silicone, urethanes, and high end paints. 

A few testimonials from my clients and students:

  • "Erik helped me make my Mega Man costume, and free handed the templates for all parts of the armor. It's made of EVA foam and coated with fiberglass, and then smoothed out before painted with a quality, metallic color! The armor is very light and easy to wear, and it looks incredibly realistic. For the Mega Buster, LEDs were inserted on the inside with functional buttons so I have the ability to turn them on when I want. This costume always makes people turn heads, and I don't have to worry about it falling apart or damaging the armor from wear... you can bet I will be commissioning Erik in the future for more armor and weapons!"   -Bluebot Cosplay


  • "Erik's work really can speak for itself. I have commissioned him for 3 pieces that have all been so glorious. He kept me updated with work in progress photos and it was so fun to see his methods. His attention to the finishing details really made me appreciate how much he loves each work he does."            -Lunara


  • "I've been ordering from Erik for a few years now, & I have to say that his work is top quality! Very rarely you will find an artist that produces amazing work at a generally affordable price, Erik is certainly one of those artists. The accuracy and attention to detail that is put into each prop is beyond exceptional. If you want something done right, get it done here!" -Dylan


  • “Erik is one of the most talented prop makers and artisans I’ve had the pleasure to get to know. He brings his years of experience with many different materials and projects to each new item he crafts. He makes sure that every aspect of the prop suits your measurements and your needs. He remained in touch with me throughout the process of making my KLK scissor blade with both progress updates on his page and messages to make sure I knew what was happening each step of the way. He actually personally delivered my prop to me at the convention to make sure I had it. My prop is screen-accurate, one-of-a-kind and impressively well made – and that is what distinguishes Erik’s work, in my opinion. The scissor blade he made for me remains to this day one of my favorite things in my possession – and a great conversation starter to boot.” -Hsing


  • "Erik is patient and funny, a great combination for learning how to craft! He encourages problem solving and has a tip or ten for every tool you chance to use. In short, I would highly recommend him to anyone wanting to learn how to make a solid, dependable, and durable prop." -Kaai in Cosplay



Photos provided by Laluneimages, WeNeals Photography and Retouching, and Cocorecchio Photography

story:
About the Mirabel Speed Skating Club

Founded in 2009 the Mirabel Speed Skating Club needs your help! We are a non-profit organization that allows kids from 5 and over to practice their favorite sport in a fun, respectful and motivating atmosphere. Every year, 20 young athletes with Olympic dreams in the back of their put all their energy in becoming better, faster skaters.

Helping Young Athletes 

Since we are a non-profit organization, our reality is that we need support from generous donators, and motivated parents in order to end the season without losing money. Coaches salaries, skating equipment upgrades and security equipment are our main expenses. 

This current campaign is to help us upgrade our current security equipment that is outdated and in pretty bad shape. We want to ensure the security of our skaters and this is why we are asking for your help! Each protection mattress costs over $400(+taxes) and we need 36 of them. For a total investment of $14 400 CAD. Something we unfortunately can't afford without your help.

There isn't much we can offer in return, but our eternal gratitude. 

In the name of our 20 young skaters, a big THANK YOU!

______________________________________________________

À propos du Club de Patinage de Vitesse de Mirabel

Fondé en 2009, le club de patinage de vitesse de Mirabel à besoin de votre aide! Nous sommes un organisme à but non-lucratif qui permet à des jeunes de 5 ans et plus de pratiquer le merveilleux sport qu'est le patinage de vitesse courte-piste dans un environnement amusant, respectueux et motivant. Chaque année, une vingtaine de patineurs avec des rêves Olympiques investissent leurs énergies à devenir de meilleurs et plus rapides patineurs.

 

Aidez de jeunes athlètes! 

Comme nous sommes un organisme à but non-lucratif, la réalité est que nous besoin de généreux donateurs ainsi que de parents motivés afin de maintenir un certain équilibre budgétaire. Salaires des entraîneurs, inventaire de patins et lames de même que les équipements de sécurité sont les plus importantes dépenses du club. 

Cette campagne a pour but de nous aider à metttre à niveau notre équipement de sécurité. Notre priorité est de donner aux jeunes patineurs un environnement sécuritaire dans lequel évoluer. Malheureusement, notre matériel est désuet et en mauvaise condition. C'est pourquoi nous désirons remplacer les matelas de protection et nous avons besoin de votre aide!

Chaque matelas coûte 400$ + taxes et nous devons faire l'acquisition de 36 matelas. Pour un total de 14 400$ + taxes. Des coûts qui sont évidemment hors de notre budget.

Évidemment, nous ne sommes pas en mesure de vous offrir grand chose en retour, si ce n'est que notre éternelle reconnaissance!

An nom de tous nos patineurs, MERCI!

story:
The money I raise will be used to build two benches, improve a fence and create a history plaque about the lookout area.  

The lookout area exists back in Locust Grove's hiking trails, but the fence is old and lacking a post in the center, and the old bench was thrown down the hill near train tracks. The area is used by many local hikers and also tourists. Locust Grove is a larger part of our community than I realized a I want to help improve it along with earning my Eagle rank in Boy Scouts. We will need a lot of physical and financial support to make this happen. I look forward to this project that will occur in the spring and summer, and again all donations are greatly appreciated, the goal set is only $500 but we need about $1800 to complete the project. We are going to continue raising funds after we meet our goal.

Thank you for your support,

Eric Hawkinson

story:
Short Summary

Remember the feeling you had when you finally finished a project you had made with your own hands? Feeling it, seeing it and then showing it to others? The Cortland Makerspace (nicknamed the STEAM House) seeks to give everyone in the Cortland and surrounding areas the chance to have that feeling.

You may already be familiar with us through our free classes and demonstrations around town, and now we need your help to make our dream of a fully equipped workshop right here in Cortland a reality.

In a series of small mini-campaigns, we hope to begin raising the funds to rent a 1,000 sqft workshop and equip it with tools for everything from woodworking & metal working to 3D printing and fiber arts. Your contribution today will not only get you your own 3D printed object to show off and keep, but will solidify your standing as a supporter of the science, technology, engineering, arts & math fields here in Cortland county. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $500 to purchase a basic 3D printer for the shop. Anything above this will go to a more advanced printer and the materials to run it. In return for your support, you will get

  • $1- A shout out on our Facebook page as a supporter
  • $5- 3D printed gear representing one of the STEAM logos
  • $20- 3D printed Cortland Makes STEAM geared cube
  • $30- The full STEAM logo gear set
  • $40- 3D printed geared cube with your name on it!
  • $50- Custom geared cube & the full STEAM logo gear set
  • $100+ - Custom geared cube, the full STEAM logo gear set & 10 free makerspace visits when the workshop opens.

The Impact

By supporting us, you'll be helping support STEAM education for kids and adults, supporting local entrepreneurs by giving them a place to build their designs, and helping build a community of people in Cortland dedicated to the furtherance of sustainable learning, creating & living.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're not able to make a monetary donation, please share this page on your social media pages and through email with all your friends and family that value education, creativity and sustainability. Approximately every 3 shares equates to an additional $1.5 in donations!

story:
Our Story

In July of 2011, Jon Brence (SMBC Theater) and Charlotte Parker (Cosplayer/Writer) discussed creating a site that would bring together geeks of all walks of life. The goal was to create an online hub that was community driven, with original personal perspective articles, original videos, live broadcasts, and more that engaged the geeks and otaku of the world in thought-provoking discussion.


Since it's launch, Ogeeku.com has amassed a great number of registered active members from around the world and maintains a steady flow of visitors. We have actively produced multiple live broadcasts weekly for the past few months, began an original series, and provided daily content, all out of our own pockets and love for everything geek.


The Impact

Ogeeku.com presents a unique opportunity for geeks and otaku alike to share their thoughts and ideas on a larger scale than before. It opens the possibility for any community member to have their thoughts/creations/broadcasts featured front page of a website, seen by thousands of visitors on a daily basis. The site encourages friendships and family to be formed for those who may not have many people with whom to share their love of anime, manga, or gaming. It has a built in socializing platform, forums, and chat room for continued discussions.


Ultimately, the site has the opportunity to become the ultimate hub for the geek-minded.


What We Need & What You Get

As of right now, Ogeeku is currently funded by donations from community members and the few ads we run on the site. As a result, we are only able to afford a cluster-based server, which may mean occasional downtime or periods of slow load time (depending on the load shared with other websites).


To avoid issues such as the above, we want to first move the site to a dedicated server. 


Secondly, we want to spend more time on the site's design and functionality (incorporating new social integration, custom forums, custom front pages for each user, and cleaner code). Third, we want to upgrade our live broadcasts on Ogeeku Live! to be full HD (1080p), so that we have the best quality feed to feature our hosts/special guests and their playthroughs. And last, but not least, we want to launch an online store, which features unique one-of-a-kind items made by Ogeeku staff and community members.


We have estimated that in combination with our current sources of funding, we will need approximately $3000 to achieve this for the next 6 months. Your donation will go towards all of the above efforts.


Other Ways You Can Help

You can help us in many ways in addition to donating: 


+ Signing up and engaging on the website daily is a huge help to our community. 

+ Sharing our site (Ogeeku.com) and this IndieGoGo with all of your gaming friends, fellow cosplayers, geeks, and anime-lovers helps us spread the word.

+ Once on the site, we always need additional written content, original art/videos, and additional hosts for our broadcasts. If any of those things interest you, please sign up and send an email to jon(at)ogeeku.com.

Our Story
In July of 2011, Jon Brence (SMBC Theater) and Charlotte Parker (Cosplayer/Writer) discussed creating a site that would bring together geeks of all walks of life. The goal was to create an online hub that was community driven, with original personal perspective articles, original videos, live broadcasts, and more that engaged the geeks and otaku of the world in thought-provoking discussion.

Since it's launch, Ogeeku.com has amassed a great number of registered active members from around the world and maintains a steady flow of visitors. We have actively produced multiple live broadcasts weekly for the past few months, began an original series, and provided daily content, all out of our own pockets and love for everything geek.


The Impact
Ogeeku.com presents a unique opportunity for geeks and otaku alike to share their thoughts and ideas on a larger scale than before. To avoid issues such as the above, we want to first move the site to a dedicated server.

And last, but not least, we want to launch an online store, which features unique one-of-a-kind items made by Ogeeku staff and community members.

story:
Short Summary

A non-profit community center for people with disabilities and their families...

Our son was severely injured Afghanistan, suffering numerous physical injuries and severe traumatic brain injury (causing significant cognitive impairment). We've struggled through years of recovery, and will for many more.

What we have discovered these last few years is that people with disabilities need a place where they can go that offers the full spectrum of resources to make their lives better; everything in one place, and that place just for them, their families and caregivers.

The Greybeard Community Center is to be a facility where members can attend exercise programs of all kinds, those directly related to therapy and recovery, as well as general activity programs. They can take classes, both related to navigating through disability issues and general courses. In addition to the classroom, there will be an activity floor, a therapy pool, an exercise room, therapy room, media center, a snack bar, and more.

What We Need & What You Get

We have developed a business plan, designed the facility, and itemized the equipment, materials and supplies lists.

We've detailed the staffing requirements, and will be working with the local community to hire persons with disabilities.

Minimum startup costs required to open the doors are $90,000, with ongoing costs through the first year approximately $23,000 per month.

While many of the clients will be provided services at low- or no-cost, we do calculate non-profit income from memberships, classroom programs, activity floor programs, concession sales, day pass admissions, and miscellaneous purchases. This income stream will offset operating expenses, more so each month until the center is self-supporting.

The funds from this campaign are intended to open the doors, while those from other funding sources (i.e. greybeard publishing), along with the income stream, will keep the doors open through the first year until we are truly self-supporting.

Additional funding beyond the goal would give us more flexibility when we first open the doors. Less funding would give us a bit less to work with initially but we would utilize this campaign's funds along with greybeard publishing's funding support to the best advantage and help those who are most in need.

We strongly encourage contributors and patrons of the Greybeard Community Center to become involved in the ongoing activities of the center, to participate in support roles directly or through one of the websites. A number of professionials in the field of disability support have stated their intentions to assist us and even volunteer their time and expertise.

The Impact

We see a real need for this, and that need is only going to grow. While there are facilities and offices with sincere staff that may offer one service or another, there is no single facility that provides the full spectrum of services, and finding any one service can be difficult.

Our multi-purpose community center is unique in that it serves those living with a disability and, as importantly, their families and caregivers.

We desperately need a place like this. We know this. We have felt it. Hundreds in our community need this place. Our son needs this place. We want this kid to have a place to go. And we want him to get better.

Other Ways You Can Help

Greybeard Publishing is a small publishing house established to support the Greybeard Community Center. 100% of the proceeds from all titles go directly to the fund. We urge everyone to visit the website and consider making a purchase: books, games, merchandize.

Kindle users should also check out the Amazon Author Page. There are a number of titles there, including "Climb the Mountain", the story of our son's struggle to recover from traumatic brain injury, and the reason for all this.

story:
Our Story

On January 12, 2012, Josiah Maskaleris was diagnosed with stage IV colorectal cancer, which has metastasized to the liver. Although this is a devastating diagnosis to receive, we are encouraged that healing is already manifesting in his body.


Josiah is a fun and vibrant individual with a quirky sense of humor. Curious by nature, he is known to ask many questions and is genuinely interested in those with whom he encounters. He is the product of a loving global village, who for 30 years helped to nurture him in Beloved Community. From artists and engineers, taxmen and ascetics, Josiah has learned to be open to new people, places, and experiences. He is committed to building genuine relationships with people in every community he has lived in and now needs you, his community, to help see this crisis through.


The diagnosis has, for the time, taken him out of the community as he rests and allows his body to fight the cancer in his abdomen. Your participation in this campaign will have a great effect on his recovery and will allow him to focus on healing.


The Impact

The goal of this campaign is to alleviate some of the financial burden off of Josiah and his family as he undergoes treatment. The support you provide will help Josiah obtain the treatments and peace of mind that he needs to make a full recovery.


What We Need

Having a family member with a serious diagnosis is a heavy burden to bear. By raising our goal of $15,000 we hope to ease some of the financial strain while Josiah undergoes intense treatment. The funds raised will be used to purchase medical equipment not covered by insurance, payments toward medical and non-medical bills, and travel expenses for consultations and treatments with medical professionals and institutions.


We are encouraged by the outpouring of Love and Support you, our community, have given to Josiah and his family. Your contribution to Josiah's health and well-being is greatly appreciated!


Other Ways You Can Help

Please promote our campaign by linking this page to Facebook, Twitter, other social media outlets, and email. Use the 'SHARE' tools at the top of this page to help you spread the word about Josiah and bring financial support in his time of need. 


Also, we believe in the power of prayer. Sending Josiah healing thoughts and prayers is critical at this time.



[Josiah at work, 2010]


With Great Affection and Appreciation,

The Maskaleris Family

story:
We have cancelled this campaign due to lack of funding.  

While we acknowledge that this was a very aggressive undertaking, with a very aggressive and optimistic goal amount, we have not raised enough at this point in the campaign to justify continued investment of time or capital in the campaign, nor in future fundraising efforts for this project.  And, after several meetings with local government officials and industry experts, we have determined that this project no longer makes sense to pursue.

We want to thank each of our supporters and let you know that we will be issuing refunds to each of you.  Please expect a check at the mailing address you provided when you signed up for your contribution.  Also, please note that if you paid by credit card, your refund will not arrive until after the end of the campaign, due to IndieGoGo's limitations in processing time.  

Thank you again for your support and we hope to see continued success in our community for those who have successfully opened their doors to new business here in town.

Best Regards,

Jamie

story:
4 FEB 2015

Message sent from Dillon Hillier to Contributors

It’s hard to find the right words, but I’ll start by saying thank you. Thank you for being there when I needed your help. 

Some of you I have met, some of you I haven’t, but believe me when I say that all of you have been in my thoughts. Your financial and moral support was a comfort and motivation while I was fighting the Islamic State in Iraq. 

There’s a thousand kilometers of trenches, bunkers and fortifications running along the length of Northern Iraq. It reminds me a lot of pictures in history books of the Western Front in WW1. On one side of this line is the Islamic State. On the other side is the Kurdish Peshmerga forces, who I fought alongside with. 

There’s a small village on the outskirts of Kirkuk in Northern Iraq, called Tal al Ward. In November the Islamic State launched a night attack and overran the Kurdish Peshmerga positions. I was part of the force that was tasked with retaking the village. 

After the battle, I asked my brother to help raise money to buy night vision goggles. Within 48 hours of launching the crowd funding campaign, Canadian’s like you demonstrated their generosity and it became clear that my funding goal would be reached – even surpassed. 

Because of you, I was able to buy night vision goggles, armour plates, medical supplies and other essentials, which greatly assisted my fight against the Islamic State.

I want to let you know, that this gear was put to good use in the way you intended it to be. I can say with certainty that you made a difference. You helped make the world a safer place. 

In late January 2015, I met with Sheik Jaffer (Head of the Kurdish Peshmerga) and was informed that as a result of the increasing role of international special forces operating in the region, all western volunteers were asked to be removed from the front lines and offensive combat operations to ensure operational safety. This was the determining factor in my decision to return home. 

I’m back and safe in Canada now, but the fight against the Islamic State is not over.  That’s why before I left, I gave the gear that I purchased with your contributions, to a Kurdish soldier who I know and trust. Fighting the Islamic State is a matter of life and death for this man and I know he will use the gear effectively. 

Thank you again for your support. 

Dillon Hillier.




Important Update: 16 DEC 2014

We did it!

Thanks to the generosity of Canadians from across the country we met our initial goal!

Dillon, will get Night Vision goggles to continue his fight against the Islamic State. This will give him a huge tactical advantage over the enemy. I cannot wait to share this amazing news with Dillon.

Phase 2:

Lets keep this momentum going.

I believe in this campaign and my brother’s mission so strongly, that I’m setting a stretch goal of $16,400. 

Here's why:

1) After discussions with suppliers, our campaign will be able to purchase additional sets of Night Vision Goggles, below retail price: Cost = $5000

2) We have a full Pallet of donated medical supplies, which we need to ship to Kurdistan: Cost = $500

3) Dillon has requested a Trijicon Advanced Combat Optical Gunsight. This is a high-grade rifle scope which delivers pinpoint accuracy, with adjustments for night and lowlight conditions: Cost $1300

You know what to do: Share this message. Donate. And be the example.



Background to Night Vision Goggle Campaign,

In November 2014, Dillon Hillier, former member of the Canadian Forces and veteran of Afghanistan, travelled to Northern Iraq to fight against the Islamic State. Dillon has fought alongside the Kurdish Peshmerga since his arrival. It took only one week of being "in-country" before Dillon participated in the battle of Tal Al-Ward. During the battle, Dillon used his training to apply military first-aid to a wounded Kurdish fighter, who had been shot in the face by an Islamic State terrorist and then went on to help take a strategic hill that overlooks the village of Tal Al-Ward. The attack drove Islamic State terrorists from their entrenchments and exposed them to punishing Coalition Airstrikes. 

When asked after the battle what he needed to help in his mission, the answer was simple and to the point: "Get me night vision goggles ASAP!" he said.

Islamic State terrorists have an arsenal of advanced American made weaponry, which was abandoned by the Iraqi army. The result is that Kurdish Peshmerga forces are often outgunned by the Islamic State.

So here we are. Dillon needs our help in securing Night Vision Goggles to help even the odds. If successful in our crowd-funding efforts, Dillon will be provided with the ATN ODIN-W Series Thermal Imaging Monocular, which retails for $6999.99. The mount and headset for this device is sold separately and will be purchased at an additional cost. 

This piece of equipment will provide a significant tactical advantage and allow Dillon and his unit to spot Islamic State attacks which often come in the night.  

Dillon is helping those who cannot defend themselves. Now he needs our help.

Be the example. Please donate generously so that Dillon has the tools he needs to fight the Islamic State.


PS. To support Dillon in this need, we are working with established providers who are under current license arrangements for EUC documentation. This ensures that we will be in full compliance with International Laws.

story:
Why we want to develop this app?

Primarily we want to build a platform where users could find exotic food stores, restaurants and share their experience within the community. 

What We Need & What You Get

We already have Android version out which could be found on Google Play however we are planning to make some changes which will make this app more user friendly.

  • Initially we are planning to raise Euros 25,000 so we could continue development of Android, iOS and Web version of this app.
  • If we will find few or single major investor than we could offer equity in the company.
  • We will complete the iOS version we have already started developing iOS app however we need more funds to continue development.


Risks & Challenges

Our business model is strong however there are always risks involve in app development and going viral. 

Other Ways You Can Help

You could always download app and help us to achieve downloading goals.

story:
Hello! We are Timothy and Alorian Haire, the creators of The Fog Walkers graphic comic series and founders of Altered Reality Creative Studios (ARC Studios), and we would like your help in bringing to life another big project that we've spent years dreaming of!

XION: Paradise for Geeks

XION (pronounced Zion) will be a hub for all things geek, gamer, and nerdcore! 

Our mission is to provide the Southwest Georgia area with a centralized hub for all things geeky, such as:

  • Trading Card Games (Magic the Gathering, Yu-Gi-Oh!, Pokemon)
  • Video Games (Call of Duty, Tekken, etc...)
  • Table Top Games (Dungeons & Dragons, Warhammer, Shadow Run)
  • Anime and Manga
  • Comics and Collectibles
  • And lots more!

Xion will also help to create new jobs and entertainment for our area. 

As the popularity of movies and television shows such as The Walking Dead, The Avengers, Dr. Who, Star Trek, Star Wars, etc… continues to grow, people want to keep feeding their fandom through shops like we are proposing.  With the advent of cyber and tabletop gaming and overall geek culture continuing to grow at an exponential rate, easy and affordable access to a centralized place where you can get these services is quickly becoming a necessity.

We want to provide a place with activities that are focused on community socialization and play in a comfortable place.  People of all ages and backgrounds will come to enjoy the unique and innovative environment that Xion will provide and will want to come back-- and bring their friends with them!

We are not just creating repeat customers.  Xion will be growing a fan base of it's own.


What We Need... and What You Get

We need your help in order to make this, a dream that is shared by many, a reality! 

We are trying to reach a goal of $50,000.00.

This money will go towards:

  • First Year's Lease on Building
  • First Year's Utilities
  • Interior Improvements like: shelves, counters, displays, decorum, seating, tables, games, inventory, etc...

That sounds like a lot of money, but it is not as much as you would think. In order to create a place and experience like none other, we will need it all. 

We don't just want to be a comic shop or game store that you walk in and leave immediately after, We want you to have a place to be able to relax and enjoy all the things that make you a fan of whatever geeky thing you might like. Where you can do things like: 

  • Use the high-speed Wi-fi internet for free- without worrying about bandwidth issues!
  • Watch the latest anime! 
  • Game with your friends around a table or on a console without worry. 
  • A safe environment where people can gather and have fun.
  • Events such as tournaments and contests with prizes weekly.
  • Rewards for repeat customers and event goers through our Members XP program where you gain experience points (XP) and Level Up through your participation and purchases giving you discounts, prizes, and access to special events! There will even be Achievements to Unlock at Xion! 


The Rewards

Our online supporter rewards will include:

  • Exclusive Indiegogo only swag from XION, The Fog Walkers, and More!
  • Jump starts for Member XP
  • Temporary and Permanent in-store discounts (So please be sure to check out our rewards list!)

We want you to know that these advanced memberships and rewards will be well worth it. Let me explain how the XP system will work and why it is a good idea to get these bonuses while you can with an advanced membership. Every time you attend an event or make a purchase in the store, you will earn XP and will be able to level up after reaching a threshold. As you level up you will get in-store exclusives like achievements, discounts, freebies, admission to special events, drawings, tournament entries, and even in-store credit. The level of backing that you choose will be the level that you will start at when the shop opens, after the campaign is over everyone else from that point on will start off as a Level 0. This is a chance to get a jump start on earning future rewards once we open. I hope this will encourage you to become a backer and help us create the paradise for geeks that we all want. XION.


We will have a Wall of Fame in Xion that will include a special permanent place exclusively to thank those who back us here! This is will be dedicated to all of you who help make this geek paradise become a reality.

We will also have legendary special guest from across the geek community that will appear at our Grand Opening. As we reach a few check points, we will continue to update and let you know who or what you can expect to be there! Our first special guest(s) will be announced after we reach the $5,000 mark and we will continue to announce more at every $5,000 increment!

If we are unsuccessful in our goal, we will try again and continue to raise the capitol needed to make Xion. The money collected will go into the funding pool. Don't give up on us if we don't make it at first, because we won't give up on you or your fandom! The store will still be opening it will just take longer. We project around March 2015 if we are unsuccessful here. All contributions will still be honored that comes through here! 


The Impact on our Area

I feel like this is something that we geeks and southwest Georgia region, as a community, could use for entertainment and socialization. With the rising prices of gas these days, this would save people money by giving them a local place to go to instead of having to drive for miles to get to anything entertaining. It would also give people an inclination to get out of their houses and meet new people, as well as friends, in a place that is both welcoming and comfortable. We want people to be able to socialize in a place that isn't a social network but a network of fellow enthusiasts in a social environment!

It would go beyond just entertainment.

It would help create new jobs in our area, something that is sorely needed, and in addition, help support our regional economy through taxes that would go back into the county and state. 

We would also do charitable work in the region by having the A.R.C. Studio's Cosplayers dress as everyone's favorite superheros and visit children in local and regional hospitals bringing kids happiness and hope and also appear at charity events giving back to the community. 

The events and tournaments we host could also bring in many out-of-town customers that could in turn equal additional customers and clientele for surrounding businesses in the region.


Risks & Challenges

The risks and challenges involved with starting Xion are:

  • Will there be a demand for the services offered by Xion in the city of Bainbridge or the Southwest GA region?

Yes.  Without driving at the least an hour, and into another state, the services XION has to offers is not available anywhere else in our region, This will also help to support local economic growth and stimulus.

  • Will the popularity of the Geek culture continue to grow, or is it merely a fad? 

As long as comic books and movies are around, there will always be someone looking to further their fandom. We want to be the ones meeting that need.

  • Is there a client base already existing in the area?

Yes. There are many people who are members of clubs at Bainbridge State College that would like to see a shop like ours in the area. They are already driving to shops in Tallahassee, FL and Dothan, AL. We would be able to supply them with a place that is local and keep our regional economy stronger by keeping those tax dollars in our own state and county.

  • Will you still open XION if you do not succeed in reaching your goal?
Yes. We will we are putting $25,000.00 dollars into this project ourselves and will be opening at the latest March of 2015. If we are successful, however, we will be shooting to have our Grand Opening in September 2014! Moving the timeline forward quite a bit and giving you an even better experience and environment than we alone could offer.

We are confident in our past success from using a crowd-funding source to start our creative label ARC Studios (Altered Reality Creative Studios) and comic series (The Fog Walkers) that we had successfully funded. We met our goal to get the first comic finished and have succeeded in creating two more with the revenue we earned. We are now on Issue 3 of The Fog Walkers in print and are currently working on Issue 4!

We also successfully distributed all of our rewards on time to the backers that helped us achieve our goal. 

We cannot do this project without your support and as lofty as our goals may be, I believe we can achieve it!

After all, this is not just our shop, it is a place for customer to come and celebrate what they enjoy and be themselves!


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't help financially, you can help us by getting the word out and spreading it across the social media like wildfire! Facebook, Google+, Twitter, Instagram, etc...

Anyway you can get the word out please do! 

We will also need some help setting up the shop when it is time to do so!
story_txt:

XION (pronounced Zion) will be a hub for all things geek, gamer, and nerdcore! Our mission is to provide the Southwest Georgia area with a centralized hub for all things geeky, such as:
Trading Card Games (Magic the Gathering, Yu-Gi-Oh!, Pokemon)
Video Games (Call of Duty, Tekken, etc...)
Table Top Games (Dungeons & Dragons, Warhammer, Shadow Run)
Anime and Manga
Comics and Collectibles
And lots more!
Xion will also help to create new jobs and entertainment for our area. As the popularity of movies and television shows such as The Walking Dead, The Avengers, Dr. Who, Star Trek, Star Wars, etc… continues to grow, people want to keep feeding their fandom through shops like we are proposing.  With the advent of cyber and tabletop gaming and overall geek culture continuing to grow at an exponential rate, easy and affordable access to a centralized place where you can get these services is quickly becoming a necessity.We want to provide a place with activities that are focused on community socialization and play in a comfortable place.  People of all ages and backgrounds will come to enjoy the unique and innovative environment that Xion will provide and will want to come back-- and bring their friends with them!We are not just creating repeat customers.  Xion will be growing a fan base of it's own.What We Need... and What You GetWe need your help in order to make this, a dream that is shared by many, a reality! We are trying to reach a goal of $50,000.00.This money will go towards:

story:
Support The Super Talented 5yo Maddison Teylor of Maddsterpieces!

Maddison is a very talented, and rather shy 5yo who immerses herself into drawing and painting daily, and not because she doesn't want to clean up her toys. After being told over& over from friends and strangers alike that she "will be an artist when she grows up," she turned to me one day and said: "why do I have to wait until I grow up? I already AM one."
She has been given an opportunity to feature (and sell!) her awesome work (her art, not her toy cleaning abilities, that is) in a very popular upcoming arts and crafts festival in our area, and she is taking it very seriously. She has a ton of beautiful ideas floating around in her (equally beautiful) head, but she doesn't have the money in her cute little piggy bank (which is actually a pony, but I digress) to buy the quality art supplies she needs in order to have those pieces ready to sell at the art festival. She tried to buy some canvases the other day, but the cashier said they don't take pocket lint :(  Oh well, those canvases *were* too big for her to carry anyway. 

                 

What She Needs:

Maddison needs funding with real money, not monopoly dollars- to cover the cost of supplies she will use making even more awesome work, as well as to produce prints of her work and package up these items for customers. However, if you want to send us your monopoly money, she would happily incorporate that into a collage too. 

In total, she needs about $100 to do a whole run of her marvelous prints (plus she needs some new strawberry bubble gum because the puppy ate all of hers AGAIN, but I digress). Indiegogo won't let us ask for less than $500, so that's what we've set the minimum as. With $100, she can at get started using some professional supplies and have something to sell her many adoring fans at the festival. 

    The Impact of Your Donation:

    Maddison is a very sweet and talented kid, and I'm not just saying that because I'm her mother. Her work brings smiles to people's faces, which can be scary because sometimes they have bad breath (I'm looking at you, upstairs neighbor!) It also brings joy to their hearts, and sometimes to their bathroom walls if that's where they choose to display it (cough, KP, cough;).
     It is wonderful to see  her gaining confidence as strangers admire her beautiful work and talk about her excellent choice of color schemes (whatever that means), and to imagine the potential growth she will have as an artist over the coming years as she pursues this passion further (and simultaneously goes through a lot of bubble gum). 
    Her work has recently caught the eye of several noteworthy artists via social media, who were probably just sharing it because it made them feel better about themselves, but still. She apparently has a real chance at getting her work into galleries and doing this professionally- partly because it comes so naturally to her, and partly because she doesn't really give a crap about what people think or what color schemes even mean. She is five after all. She cares more about whether or not she has to brush her teeth at night than she does what people think! 
    Risks & Challenges

    There is always the chance that people won't like Maddison's art. It happens to all artists sometimes. Especially when you have ketchup on your shirt ON PURPOSE and cover yourself in temporary tattoos of smiling poop- this can be completely awkward in social situations. But the best thing about being 5 is that you don't really care what others think about your art because YOU KNOW IT'S AWESOME! YAH! And also, her mom makes some mean cupcakes, which are the best kind of consolation prize.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      If you'd like to help out in other ways, we would LOVE your help! Please share Maddison's campaign with your friends and family members either personally or via social media! You rock! Maddison is also interested in having a mentor or two who is already deeply entrenched in the art world and can help her navigate it, since her mom only knows so much about it. And that's not much at all, it turns out. So if any of you are artists and interested in being her mentor, please reach out to us.

story:
The Ramadan Food Basket program seeks to solve this problem by providing food and water to poor families locally in Kansas during the month of Ramadan. A single basket provides enough food to last the entire month for a family of four ensuring that their nutritional needs will continue to be met — and that their children won’t have to go to bed hungry.

We have more than 30 families that have applied so far for food assistance in the greater Kansas City area and the number is increasing. This Food Basket program is generously supported by Muslims in North America and throughout the world. By adding your support today, you’ll help these Muslim families prepare to break their fasts with the knowledge and peace of mind that they’ll have the ability to do so.


    Other Ways You Can Help

    • We are actively seeking volunteers so please contact us if you can volunteer a few hours a day to market.
    • Be sure to share with everyone you know.

story:
An Odyssey of Smoked Meats

Growing up an Army brat, we traveled.  The scenery changed but our
love of food remained constant.  Of the fare to be had, hams were always sampled every which place we settled in for a meal. From the smokey and rich Black Forest ham, to the lightly sweet and tender French ham; we tried them all.

As an adult on my own I spent time in Alaska. There I had the pleasure of learning to smoke salmon. After spending many hours tending to the smoker with 100's of pounds of fresh beautifully red salmon, the smell was intoxicating.

Returning once more to the lower 48, I discovered ribs. All kinds of those luscious bits of bone-in pleasure: spare ribs, country ribs, baby back ribs. I have loved them all: the dry rubbed and smoked with sauces served on the side, to the sticky, drippy, tear the meat from the bone ribs.

With my heart and stomach here in Milwaukee it’s time to start a new smoked tradition. I want to share the tastes that I have been collecting.  But I am without a
crucial element in my plan. A smoker! Here is where our partnership begins. This
campaign will help me accomplish that. Your contribution will enable me to not
only make hams, bacon and whole hogs; it will also help me to cater parties.
Parties like:

Dia de Los Puercos!


We will buy a smoker, and you will get a party

Donors will be invited to Dia de Los Puercos. To be hosted by the Milwaukee Brewery!! A party I will throw in your honor. We will use the funds to purchase the smoker and the expenses of the party; including a whole hog, locally sourced and organic of course.

Top donors will be given the flavorful and rare cheeks, the succulent tenderloin and the crisp ears. Other top donors can receive a whole slab of bacon. The top donor will receive my rare Christmas ham. A barrel brined and smoked ham!

If we don't reach the goal, the money will be put toward the purchase of the smoker, and we will throw another party. We all still win!

 

Pockets a bit lean?

Even if you can't contribute, please share this campaign. Your time and effort will help further the cause of smoked excellence, and appreciated.

story:
Attention Doggy Fashion Lovers!

Are you tired of shopping the big stores only to find boring items that suit neither you nor your pet’s personalities and styles? Every dog needs a collar, harness and leash…hey! Some needs sweaters, coats and dresses too! Help us expand our urban-chic, unique designs online and into major retail stores so you can get great doggy styles at affordable prices!

Amber holding Kane in our Bubba Dog Collection Hunter Collar

About Kane & Couture

Kane & Couture is a canine lifestyle brand that offers fashionable, functional and affordable products that fit the needs of the modern day dog owner. As a devoted dog owner herself, Amber Lee Forrester found that most of the dog apparel and products on the market were plaid, plain or suburban; if they were cute they weren’t functional, and if they were functional they weren’t cute! Amber founded Kane & Couture with the goal of offering fashion-loving dog owners the products they need, in the colors and styles they like, at price points they can afford. “As an out of the box thinker, I wanted to do something different; something that would stand out. So, I joined my love for fashion and my love dogs and started an urban-chic dog fashion line.”

Jennifer Williams and her dog, Gia in the City Mini Harness and Leash from the Imperial Pup Collection

At Kane & Couture our fresh, unique approach to the canine lifestyle industry separates us from other brands in the business. Dogs are no longer confined to our homes and backyards; they are part of our families and we want to make sure that you and your four-legged family member are living in style!

Kane in Kane & Couture Boyfriend Button Down Shirt

Kane & Couture’s wide assortment of products ranges from simply chic to decadent across four brands. Our selection has expanded over the years to offer not only collars, harnesses, leashes, carriers, beds and apparel, but also pet-themed human products including totes, mugs, phone cases and our Pet and People matching t-shirts! From the value-driven, casual Bubba Dog and sporty Urban Hound Collections, to the lavish yet affordable Imperial Pup line, there is something to suit every pup’s style and budget. Our couture Signature line offers high quality collars, leashes and carriers featuring Italian hardware and Swarovski crystals, made in the US to support American industry.

About Amber

Having all of her eggs in one basket has never been a problem for Amber; long aware that her ambition would take her far beyond the confines of her native city of Detroit, Michigan, she moved to New York in 2000 to attend Fordham University's College of Business Administration.  Over the years, Amber worked in Marketing, PR and Events capacities in radio at New York’s WBLS, with spirits companies such as Pernod Ricard and Diageo and water company, FIJI Water. Since founding Kane & Couture, Amber has gotten married and given birth to a beautiful baby girl; yet, she has never allowed her devotion to either her family or her business slip, even attending the Macy’s Workshop for Minority and Women-Owned Businesses in her ninth month of pregnancy! Amber has expertly juggled family life with the pressures of establishing a new business.

Amber in the December 2013 Ebony Magazine Macy's Workshop Ad

Having spent five years carefully building her company, Amber took a brave step forward for Kane & Couture and, in 2013, auditioned for ABC’s Shark Tank in the hopes of finding an investor to help her to take the company to the next level. Armed with her knowledge of the industry and a passion for her field, Amber convinced Daymond John and Lori Greiner to move forward with Kane & Couture, on the condition that she meets certain goals.


While the exposure brought about by Shark Tank has dramatically increased sales, both online and in stores, we are still working towards our goals and we need your help! Continuing to do business that is limited to mostly independent retailers means that our production costs are higher, designs are more difficult for our customers to find and more expensive to buy when you do find them! Help us to grow and expand our business online and to bigger retail stores so that we can do what we do best – offer fun and fly fashion at low prices and keep the style in you and your doggy’s lifestyle!


Make a Difference!

At Kane & Couture, we know there is more to animal welfare than fashion and we strive to support the many worthwhile animal charities that exist throughout the US. We are committed to supporting at least one charity per month, helping our furry friends by donating products and funds to wonderful causes, including Pet Partners and the Pit's Haven Rescue Center. The larger we grow, the more we can give back and continue to forge strong, beneficial partnerships with animal charities and organizations in order to advocate the wellbeing of the animals we adore.

With your help, Kane & Couture will not only maintain its dedication to fostering a fashionable, functional and affordable lifestyle for modern and stylish dog lovers, but will continue to broaden its horizons by designing new styles, building our team, innovating fresh ideas and taking impressive and progressive strides towards positive growth.

Kane & Couture Rescue T-Shirt

Our Campaign

Our goal is to raise $25,000 for the growth of our company. This funding will go towards product development, production, improving customer service, office space to house our busy team, implementing a digital marketing campaign and exhibiting our products at upcoming tradeshows such as SuperZoo pet industry show and the highly regarded New York Gift Show.


We are offering unique perks to thank you for donations of all sizes. From dazzling collars and apparel, to extravagant haute couture accessories and life long discounts, we want to make you and your pup feel as special as we do when we receive your support! As extra special memento, our perks also include custom portraits of your dog and generous gift cards for kaneandcouture.com to ensure that your pup is posing with confidence!

Kane in Kane & Couture Signature Regal Collar with Front Row Carrier

We will continue working tirelessly to promote Kane & Couture and to achieve our dreams. We’re not afraid of a little (or a lot!) of hard work, but we remain limited without funding. Please help us to reach our potential by sharing our campaign with your dog loving, business supporting friends, on your social media and/or donating what you can and enjoying some of our great perks in return! 

Thanks in advance for your support!

#fundingkc #teamkc #definingdoggystyle

Follow us on IG @kaneandcouture @amberkane
Facebook: The Official Kane & Couture Fan Page
Twitter & Pinterest: @kaneandcouture
story_txt:
Attention
Doggy Fashion Lovers!
Are
you tired of shopping the big stores only to find boring items that suit
neither you nor your pet’s personalities and styles? Every dog needs a collar,
harness and leash…hey! Some needs sweaters, coats and dresses too! Help us
expand our urban-chic, unique designs online and into major retail stores so
you can get great doggy styles at affordable prices!Amber holding Kane in our Bubba Dog Collection Hunter Collar
About Kane & Couture
Kane
& Couture is a canine lifestyle brand that offers fashionable, functional
and affordable products that fit the needs of the modern day dog owner. As a
devoted dog owner herself, Amber Lee Forrester found that most of the dog
apparel and products on the market were plaid, plain or suburban; if they were
cute they weren’t functional, and if they were functional they weren’t cute!
Amber founded Kane & Couture with the goal of offering fashion-loving dog
owners the products they need, in the colors and styles they like, at price
points they can afford. “As an out
of the box thinker, I wanted to do something different; something that would
stand out. So, I joined my love for fashion and my love dogs and started an
urban-chic dog fashion line.”Jennifer Williams and her dog, Gia in the City Mini Harness and Leash from the Imperial Pup CollectionAt Kane & Couture our
fresh, unique approach to the canine lifestyle industry separates us from other
brands in the business. Dogs are no longer confined to our homes and backyards;
they are part of our families and we want to make sure that you and your
four-legged family member are living in style!

Kane in Kane & Couture Boyfriend Button Down ShirtKane & Couture’s wide
assortment of products ranges from simply chic to decadent across four brands.
Our selection has expanded over the years to offer not only collars, harnesses,
leashes, carriers, beds and apparel, but also pet-themed human products
including totes, mugs, phone cases and our Pet and People matching t-shirts!
From the value-driven, casual Bubba Dog and sporty Urban Hound Collections, to
the lavish yet affordable Imperial Pup line, there is something to suit every
pup’s style and budget. Our couture Signature line offers high quality collars,
leashes and carriers featuring Italian hardware and Swarovski crystals, made in
the US to support American industry.

About Amber
Having
all of her eggs in one basket has never been a problem for Amber; long aware
that her ambition would take her far beyond the confines of her native city of
Detroit, Michigan, she moved to New York in 2000 to attend Fordham University's
College of Business Administration.  Over the years, Amber worked in
Marketing, PR and Events capacities in radio at New York’s WBLS, with spirits companies
such as Pernod Ricard and Diageo and water company, FIJI Water. Since founding
Kane & Couture, Amber has gotten married and given birth to a beautiful
baby girl; yet, she has never allowed her devotion to either her family or her
business slip, even attending the Macy’s Workshop for Minority and Women-Owned
Businesses in her ninth month of pregnancy! Amber has expertly juggled family
life with the pressures of establishing a new business. Amber in the December 2013 Ebony Magazine Macy's Workshop Ad
Having
spent five years carefully building her company, Amber took a brave step
forward for Kane & Couture and, in 2013, auditioned for ABC’s Shark Tank in
the hopes of finding an investor to help her to take the company to the next
level. Armed with her knowledge of the industry and a passion for her field,
Amber convinced Daymond John and Lori Greiner to move forward with Kane &
Couture, on the condition that she meets certain goals.

grow and expand our business online and to bigger retail stores so that we can
do what we do best – offer fun and fly fashion at low prices and keep the style
in you and your doggy’s lifestyle!

a Difference!

know there is more to animal welfare than fashion and we strive to support the
many worthwhile animal charities that exist throughout the US. We are committed
to supporting at least one charity per month, helping our furry friends by
donating products and funds to wonderful causes, including Pet Partners and the
Pit's Haven Rescue Center. The larger we grow, the more we can give back and
continue to forge strong, beneficial partnerships with animal charities and organizations
in order to advocate the wellbeing of the animals we adore.
With your help, Kane &
Couture will not only maintain its dedication to fostering a fashionable,
functional and affordable lifestyle for modern and stylish dog lovers, but will

fresh ideas and taking impressive and progressive strides towards positive
growth.Kane & Couture Rescue T-Shirt

for the growth of our company. This funding will go towards product

to thank you for donations of all sizes. From dazzling collars and apparel, to

story:
We are in contact with several highly vulnerable brothers and sisters on our list, fleeing homophobia/transphobia extreme violences in their country; your donations will be used wisely.

Our first refugee is about to arrive from Uganda, our brother Hakim "Black" (it is not his real name, but a pseudo), is highly vulnerable (he went through kidnapping, torture and horrible violent treatments), in a country where now homosexuality is a crime and he could not complain to anyone; he is arriving in South Africa early June 2014 inch'Allah.



WHAT

Our project is to build the first international, Inclusive, self-sustainable Muslims’ center (an inclusive mosque, a refugees’ shelter & a progressive imam-es training institute) in South Africa – called CALEM Rumi’s Isiphephelo[1]. The motto of this center is to promote empowerment, learning, sharing and freedom. It will provide refuge for healing from persecution trauma, welcome and train vulnerable individuals, in order to participate to their emancipation, especially LGBT from a Muslim background, with a priority for those coming from Middle East and Africa, thrown out of their home and/or community and/or country because of their sexual orientation; but also welcoming and training HIV positive individuals and women from a Muslim background, in need of support[2], discriminated because of their HIV status or gender identity[3].


WHO

CALEM is a confederation of LGBTQIA[4], Euro-African or Muslim organizations, which works for human rights and toward sexual and gender diversity within Islam, defending the most vulnerable individuals amongst us. CALEM is a secular, progressive and nonpolitical organization, free from any political party, financial sponsor, from any kind of ideology and not submitted to any kind of absolute religious authority. Our aim is to sustain - in their empowerment and liberation process - Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual or Transgender individuals that are Muslims or come from a Muslim background. CALEM in Arabic, is the tool we use to acquire knowledge and write Destiny. Knowledge and cooperation are the tools we shall use to make us free[5].


WHY

There is no proper progressive and inclusive Muslim training center in the world, offering a refuge for healing, a beacon for Muslims in Diaspora around the world as well as local Muslims seeking spiritual community. These stigmatization and intersectional discrimination push for instance LGBT teenagers to commit suicide in some countries more than ten times more than average heterosexual teenagers[6]. Women and minorities’ sexuality is still the biggest taboo for a majority of Muslims’ diaspora; plus serophobia towards HIV positive individuals - is an “aggravating circumstance”[7], and some religious authorities still considered until recently that HIV/AIDS is a punishment from God because of their sexuality[8].


WHEN

Grand opening planned for the 17th of May 2014, international day against homophobia and transphobia[9].


MORE

The proposed activities of this CALEM Rumi’s Isiphephelo are equally about elaborating and sharing an inclusive, progressive, and democratic ethos of citizenship within African Muslim communities and challenging the marginalization and physical victimization of Muslim LGBT people, women, and HIV positive individuals through outreach, dialogue and civic education. To name a few things: not talking about transphobia in general, more particularly when transgender individuals from Muslim background dies they are generally cursed by their community and family, and no place want to welcome their partner and friends for a last farewell and rites. Not talking about homophobic, misogynistic and anti-Semitic sermons of some imams, more particularly when queer Muslims visit Islamic or cultural conservative and exclusive Muslim centers, they often report to us they have been stigmatized because they wear too flashy cloths, earrings or because they are too effeminate, according to the Muslim communities’ heteronormative standards.

Our intention is also to provide a bigger microphone to progressive Muslim voices through the media and in community engagement. To accomplish these goals, the CALEM Rumi’s Isiphephelo will offer seminars, conferences, media events, political commentary, and personal empowerment within a marginalized sector of society that, should all the allies who do in fact share a common oppressor – patriarchal Islam – come together, will be far stronger than they knew possible and tip the balance of the dynamics of immigration and refugees flow, religious and cultural difference within Islam, and even cultural and gender diversity within Muslim communities. We need to accomplish these goals because if we do nothing today, we could be assured that in twenty years we will have the same problems with Muslim youth especially concerning anti-Semitism, misogynistic behaviors, homophobic and transphobic attitudes, low self-esteem, violence; and perhaps the situation will be even worse than it is today.

According to our expertise, we do not believe that citizens from a Muslim background are conservative per nature, nor are they progressive; the majority of them follow what comes from scholars performing in cultural and Islamic centers, organizations and mosques. Thus, we have to provide a louder voice and more visible platform for the progressive scholars and committed citizens from a Muslim background to extend their positive influence, and fight back the negative influence of the most conservative amongst our communities. We will create both a physical refuge for dozens of people to engage with per year, but this is also a new center of thought.  The CALEM Rumi’s Isiphephelo will be a first in the region that can speak directly to the African and Middle Eastern Muslim experience as well as the experience of Muslims in Diasporas.  The effects of the center – education, empowerment of progressive leaders and imam-es, engagement of allies and adversaries – reaches well beyond South Africa, to shift the conversation of minorities in the Muslim context from one of oppressor-oppressed to one of philosophically divergent bodies within Islam, discussing what building a new community based on equality and justice looks like.

All the information about this project online - http://www.calem.eu/CALEM%20RUMIs%20Isiphephelo...


WHAT WE NEED

Some refugees could not wait anymore, facing sometimes like in Uganda death penalty in their country; and even if the Refuge should not be functionnal before mid June, we need to welcome them and help them, finalize the Refuge proper building and furnitures... Please help them, your donations here in South Africa mean a lot and shall be properly used to shelter these refugees.

Do not hesitate to give a few dollars or euros, and to spread the word around you about our initiative so others could help us :) <3


PS: you could also donate online through our French PAYPAL account - https://www.paypal.com/fr/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_f...


[1]It is a Zulu world meaning “Refuge, shelter, salvation”; Rumi was a famous was a 13th-century Persian poet, jurist, theologian, and Sufi mystic, very close to his fellow dervish Shamse Tabrizi. Rumi is a figure of openness and progressiveness for many inclusive Muslims around the world.

[2] Learn more about the procedure to get asylum in South Africa in chapter 7. FAQ of our online presentation.

[3] Learn more in the chapter 2. Online project presentation – Why a shelter and training center in South Africa.

[4] Lesbian, gay, bisexual, transsexual, queer, intersexual, asexual; learn more in Annex 1 of our online presentation.

[5] Learn more in chapter 1. Introduction – what is CALEM; also in chapter 7. Center’s Council of founders & Advisory board; also in Annex 1. CALEM of our online presentation.

[6] See for instance the French National Institute in charge of public health 2004 report; see also the study from Theuninck AC (2000). « The Traumatic Impact of Minority Stressors on Males Self-Identified as Homosexual or Bisexual ». Master's Dissertation, University of the Witwatersrand, Johannesburg – available online.

[7] AIDES is one of the biggest organization fighting against HIV in Europe.

[8] See the report from the Christian AIDS South African organization; and chapter 3. Detailed description of our onlinepresentation.

[9] Learn more about that in chapter 5. Schedule of activities; also in chapter 8. Project timeline of our online presentation.

story:
Our Story

Hello!

We are Adam and Davis, owners of crown flora studio.  We started crown flora studio six years ago and worked out of our home studio to make unique bags, accessories and floral arrangements.  We traveled to craft shows and flea markets across Toronto and from Ottawa to Montreal to sell our work.  On Dec. 23, 2012, we opened our first shop in the Parkdale area of Toronto.

We started off with an ironing board, a desk, some vintage crates and two chairs.  Our stock was minimal back then but we had enough to sell once the doors opened.   As the months went by and more plants and bags started to fill the shop it wasn't as scary as we thought to have a brick and mortar store.  Our little shop in Parkdale became a place for plant lovers and supporters of handmade products.

As we expanded our products and added workshops, custom work and floral arrangements for events, we realized we could no longer do as much as we wanted to in our small space.  We had big plans and wanted to share it with everyone who became a part of our story.  We planted a seed with crown flora and needed to nurture it and let it grow.  Crown flora has bloomed and is ready to grow.


The Perks

We've enlisted our amazing crew of creative friends to offer unique perks in addition to our own list of items for you to experience.  Here are some of the perks and workshops available for this campaign:

dinosaur planter

These cute quirky dinosaur planters are sure to liven up any space.  Great for patio parties or a child's bedroom.  These multi coloured dinosaur planters are a great addition to your crown flora plant collection.  All planters come planted and made out of plastic for durability.


bookhou planter

Special perk alert!  Be sure to make this Bookhou printed plant holder an addition to your home.  Group them together or maybe one in your office.  This adds colour and some green to your space.  

the bucket bag


This bucket bag will sure to be one of your staples for everyday or travel.  Made with waxed canvas and leather this bag can go from cross body to handle at anytime.  Be sure to grab one!


ultimate event space

Do you have a celebration coming up?  We will open up our unique space  for your private event. Pick a date for this year and celebrate with your friends and family.  Crown Flora Studio will provide floral decor, up to 3 centrepieces and 2 large arrangements. 

the camper bag

The Camper bag has been the newest bag from our collection.  Take this little yet versatile bag on your travels.  The detachable straps allows you to use it as travel bag for toiletries and more.  Be sure to pick this one up in Charcoal Grey this summer!

kid icarus Ontario poster

Discover Ontario with this poster from our friends at Kid Icarus in Kensington Market.

crywolf limited print

Commemorate our campaign with this limited collaboration print made by Crywolf in their studio at 91 Ossington Ave. 

flower crown workshop

Get ready to be surrounded with the most amazing flowers in this fun workshop.  Planning a wedding or want to enjoy your pretty flower crown?  Be sure to join us in this fun workshop.


classic terrarium workshop

Join us for this classic workshop that we've been running since the start of our business.  You will get to make 2 types of terrariums in our new space.

Your initials in Gold

Get this lovely leather pouch monogrammed with your initials in gold!  Great for a night in the city or travelling abroad.

(PLEASE MAKE SURE YOU MESSAGE ME WITH YOUR INITIALS AS THERE IS NO FIELD TO ADD IT)  THANK YOU :)

shibori workshop

Join Arounna from Bookhou for this workshop using different resist techniques like tying, sewing and clamping to create a pattern on their scarves.  All materials are included.  You will receive %10 off the shop the day of the workshop.

What We Need 

We need $10,000 for our campaign which we plan to use for renovations in order to offer our loyal clientele a better experience with new products, workshops and retail space.

We will be installing proper lighting so that our space is well lit for workshops and in the retail area.

We will be using a local carpenter to build a custom seating area for workshops. This will double as a work table for production of crown flora products.  Chairs, shelving and storage areas for workshops will be purchased as well.

We will also be getting sewing equipment for our bag and home production as we will be producing new accessories and home products.

In addition to our urban garden department we will be adding a flower shop. We will be purchasing a flower fridge to house our daily flowers for wedding/special events and local flower pick up for the neighbourhood.

The money raised will also go to general renovation items such as painting, shelving and display tables for the retail area.


The Impact

In moving to a larger space we hope that we can continue to grow and make people happy with our vision to be a community business specializing in hand made and creative products.  We want to become a community space for people to learn our craft and see the importance of sustainable and handmade work. We want to create an environment that is unique and special for everyone to be apart of.  We hope that you can contribute and see the growing result.


Other Ways You Can Help

We grew our business from word of mouth and social media.  Share our video, our story or tell all your friends what we are doing at crown flora studio.  Use Instagram, Twitter, Facebook or whatever social media platform you use to get our story across and reach other networks.

We want to THANK YOU -- all of you -- for your support over the past years until now.  Thank you for checking out our campaign and we hope we make our goal with your help!

xo

Adam Mallory and Davis Khounnoraj
