story:
Invest in Women. Improve the World. 

It's that simple. Vital Voices searches the world for emerging women leaders with exceptional visions for change. We partner with them to make their visions a reality. 

Through individualized support, mentorship, leadership training, and network-building, Vital Voices has worked with over 14,000 women leaders in 144 countries to address the world's most pressing issues. These are the women on the frontlines of change working to strengthen democracy, increase economic opportunity, and protect human rights in communities around the world. 

Our International Women's Day Campaign

As the spotlight turns toward the world's women on International Women's Day (March 8th) and throughout the month of March, Vital Voices is calling out to the Indiegogo Community - both women AND men - to invest in our network of women leaders as they pay it forward in their communities. 

Please make a gift today and invest in women's leadership around the world.

Funds raised through the Indiegogo Campaign will support our global network of women leaders and help us find other women leading change in their communities.

How YOU Can Help

  • Make a gift to our International Women's Day Campaign to support women leaders and the change-makers of tomorrow!
  • Join our Campaign Team and encourage your friends and family to invest in women leaders everywhere.
  • Share your story! Tweet us @VitalVoices and tell us why you #InvestInWomen.  
  • Follow our Indiegogo campaign throughout the month and receive updates and new perks...and see the global impact of your gift as you "pay it forward."

Stay tuned for personal stories of women in Vital Voices' global network...

CHECK OUT THE STORY OF PANMELA CASTRO IN THE UPDATES SECTION.

As a young woman interested in art, Panmela Castro was drawn to graffiti and its power to convey a message. Living in the suburbs of Rio de Janeiro as a young woman, Panmela became immersed in the city’s dynamic art scene and began to establish her reputation as a graffiti artist. Also known by her graffiti name, Anarkia, she fully embraces the transformative power of art, using her work to raise awareness about women’s rights and to draw attention to the pervasiveness of gender-based violence.
CHECK OUT THE STORY OF DR. HAWA ABDI IN THE UPDATES SECTION.

In 1983, Dr. Hawa Abdi opened the Rural Health Development Organisation, a one-room clinic near Mogadishu, Somalia on farmland that her family owned, and persuaded nomadic women to let her help deliver their babies. Today, Dr. Hawa provides safety and healthcare to over 90,000 internally displaced persons in her native Somalia. Vital Voices invests in Dr. Hawa as she reinvests in the vibrant community she safeguards every day. 

CHECK OUT THE STORY OF TEP VANNY IN THE UPDATES SECTION.

Tep Vanny is a leader in Cambodia, fighting for land rights in her community for families whose lands have been forcibly and illegally confiscated. Vital Voices invests in Vanny's commitment to justice for all and being a voice of the voiceless.

CHECK OUT THE STORY OF SUNITHA KRISHNAN IN THE UPDATES SECTION.

Sunitha Krishnan is the co-founder of Prajwala(Eternal Flame),a group that rescues women and children from brothels and provides quality education to the children of prostitutes. Vital Voices invests in Sunitha’s commitment to a world free of exploitation.


Vital Voices Campaign PERKS!

story:
Why Gardens?
Because gardens produce healthier food. Only 2% of American children eat enough fruits and vegetables, and 1 in 3 American children born after 2000 is at risk for Type II diabetes. A garden is an introduction to the real, healthy food students and families need access to.

Because gardens can help fix America's nature deficit. With more than 80% of Americans living in cities and suburbs, we need to work harder than ever to teach the values of natural processes.

Because gardens are a living laboratory for education. Not just healthy food—a lesson on what producing healthy food requires. Not just exposure to nature—a way for children to literally harvest the fruits of their labor.

A True Seed Investment 
For as little as $10, you can help a community reap all the benefits a garden has to offer. In just 39 days, we plan to raise $2500 per garden; to feed,  teach, and inspire people in each of these 100 communities. Here are a few things our garden plans to do with your donations:

Our ‘adopted’ school in Durham N.C. focuses on a high level of education for elementary school children despite the odds against success: low state funding, a low average income level for the students’ families, poor teacher wages. Burton Elementary prides itself on giving all the students a solid grounding in three languages besides English – Chinese, French and Spanish – alongside more traditional studies in math, science etc. Geomagic supports Burton Elementary each year through: supplies drives, fundraising, building repair, IT assistance and more.

CHECK OUT THE GALLERY FOR IMAGES & VIDEOS

Look Good, Do Good
With every contribution to our garden, donors will receive organic, ethical perks from PACT. Our socks, undies, and t-shirts are produced to high standards of sustainability, with the comfiest organic materials we can find. You'll be giving out of the goodness of your heart, and in return you'll get PACT goodies. It's a win-win situation.

story:
Hello,

    My name is Ahmad Masoor Simmons.  This is my second time trying to do this. I haven't had much success with indiegogo. However, I am not a quiter so I am trying again. 

   It has been little over a full year since I have seen my children. I have two boys who after a seperation were taken back to the states. I remained in Brazil to chase the dream of trying to build a reality of culture and a natural lifestyle for my children. Unfrotunately it has taken a very long time to get it going.  And even though it is picking up momentum now I can not bare the pain of being away from my children any longer.  

  How I got to this point?  I made a decision a long time ago after having lived in the US that I would dedicate my life to helping people especially children around the world.  I started here in Brazil with an unregistered non-profit charity called Guerreiros da Luz. For thirten years I planned and thaught of how to make this thing work. For 3 years I had it running.  I have help a number of kids through many tough situatons.  However, my original plans included my children. after a rough split with my ex-wife I lost my kids and they were taken back to the states.  Now after a year of not see them I am beyond the point of reason.  I am desperately asking for help and doing all things possible to get back to them.  I am working, but between paying rent and eating I am not able to save enough to ensure that I will be able to travel.  

    I am not asking for alot from any one individual.  If you all can help with a little it will end up being enough.  I am able to save up a little bit of money so I will be able to make up the difference if I do not get all I need from here. Or, if someone has a way to get a discounted flight that would also help. 

    There are no special perks this time because I have nothing to give. I can only offer my gratitude to you for helping me. And I believe that when I am ale to hold my kids in my arms they will be thankful that you helped as well. Please if you can help, me do so.  I also understand that things are hard all over the place so if you are strapped and can not help at all I understand.  Please at least pray for this to happen and send up positive energy for me.

 

I greatly appreciate your time.

 

Thank you.

 

Ahmad M. Simmons

story:
Bring A Great Chase To Your City!

The video you just watched is only a small portion of the fun and excitement that is known as A Great Chase - and we want to bring it to your city so you can experience it too!

A Great Chase is an adventurous and fun activity that challenges teams to solve clues and compete to finish the race first.  It was started in Las Vegas in 2012 by my husband and I because we wanted to be on An Amazing Race (the TV show) and thought, "Since we can't participate, lets create a local version and other people might want to particpate as well".

Boy were we right!  We have had a tremendous turnout since we launched and we have expanded to San Diego.  We even do special charity events in one-off cities.  What we hear at every event from the Chasers is, "BRING A GREAT CHASE TO OUR CITY!"

We think it's time the rest of the USA and even a few other countries get to experience all of the fun A Great Chase offers - and that is where you come in!

What It Will Take:

Expanding is expensive and A Great Chase is more of a fun activity than a big business right now.  So we need $23,000 to bring A Great Chase to 10 cities.  This money is $3,000 in legal fees and then $2,000 per city for: Finding staff, setting up the course, finding people/businesses to partner with and launching the event.  Our ultimate goal is 25 US cities and 10 international destinations for vacationers. (It even sounds super fun as I type that out : )

A full list of cities is available on our website at www.agreatchase.com (Click on FRANCHISE tab) but here are a few we are targeting:

Miami   -  New York   -  Washington D.C.   -   Los Angeles   -  Phoenix  -   Dallas

Houston  -   Atlanta   -  Philadelphia  -   Chicago   -  New Orleans and more....

If we don't reach the full $23,000, it means A Great Chase will be in less cities.  If we exceed the $23,000 it means A Great Chase will be in more cities!

Our goal is to make A Great Chase a permanent attraction in each of these cities and not a one time event.

Your contribution can not only bring A Great Chase to your city as a permanent activity but your contribution can register you for A Great Chase in a city near you!  So don't miss out on all the fun. (Or you can give it to someone as a gift - they will love you for it  : )

This isn't an idea ....IT'S REALITY!  People love doing A Great Chase and give tons of feedback on our Facebook page.

Making A Difference

A Great Chase is a fun activity and I don't want to act like we are "saving the world" BUT it has had a much bigger impact than my husband and I originally envisioned.  First, it has allowed all of the Chasers at each event to interact and meet new friends.  That may not sound like much but in a world of Social Media, TV and Video games...regular interaction and socialization with real human beings is often missing.  This event has allowed father/son teams to bond, husband/wife teams to get closer and co-workers to build relationships.

In addition we have been able to donate 25 entries to the Ronald McDonald House in Las Vegas to support their charity!!

We have also partnered with Hui O'wanie in Hawaii to raise $2,000 for the charity in a January Hawaii based Great Chase!!

We didn't realize when we started that charities would be so interested in partnering with A Great Chase to raise money but we are more than happy to provide a fun way to raise money for a great cause.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't able to contribute because money is tight believe us when we say, "We understand".  But if you still like A Great Chase, you can help us by:

1.) Telling people to support our campaign

2.) You can let us know that you want A Great Chase to come to your city by visiting the website and sending us an email. 

3.) You can like us on Facebook and follow us on Twitter. 

Every bit helps and we appreciate all of your support!!!

We hope to see you in your city soon - for A Great Chase!

story:
Dear Friend,

When Tea Party Nation first started, we had a simple idea.  We wanted to create a organization that would be entirely funded by advertising revenue.  I hoped that by funding it that way, it would free up your money to spend on candidates.

Things don’t always work out the way we want them to and we have never been able to generate the revenues we needed or wanted for our activism.

Because of this, I am pleased to announce the creation of Tea Party Nation Action, our new non-profit arm.

Why Tea Party Nation Action?

We learned when we did the First National Tea Party Convention that there was a huge need within our movement to bring activists together.  There was and still is much we need to learn about how to be effective activists. There is even more we need to do.

Over the next few months, Tea Party Nation Action will be announcing a series of events that will help to bring conservative activists together in ways we have not been brought together in the past.  We will also work to help train and organize conservatives so we can be as effective as the liberals have been in the past..

There is a reason we always say we do more with less than any other Tea Party Group out there.  We have run Tea Party Nation for the last four years on a shoestring budget, and yet managed to accomplish many of our objectives.

The Tea Party movement is incredible because it has changed the course of American politics.  Unfortunately, while we have become a force to be reckoned with, we have not been nearly as successful as we need to be.  That is why we are creating Tea Party Nation Action.

We need your help in funding our new non-profit and getting it off the ground.  Today we need your generous contribution of $25, $50, $100, $250 or more to help us.

2014 can be like 2010 again.  We must make that happen.  Tea Party Nation Action is a group that is going to help make that happen.

In order for us to launch Tea Party Nation Action, we need to raise $10,000 by September 6th.  Help us turn the tide for America!

Please join us!

In Liberty,

Judson Phillips

PS, Today we need your generous contribution of $25, $50, $100, $250 or more to help us.
story_txt:
Dear Friend,
When Tea Party Nation first started, we had a simple
idea.  We wanted to create a organization
that would be entirely funded by advertising revenue.  I hoped that by funding it that way, it would free up your
money to spend on candidates.
Things don’t always work out the way we want them to and we
have never been able to generate the revenues we needed or wanted for our
activism.
Because of this, I am pleased to announce the creation of
Tea Party Nation Action, our new non-profit arm.
Why Tea Party Nation Action?
We learned when we did the First National Tea Party
Convention that there was a huge need within our movement to bring activists
together.  There was and still is
much we need to learn about how to be effective activists. There is even more
we need to do. 
Over the next few months, Tea Party Nation Action will be
announcing a series of events that will help to bring conservative activists
together in ways we have not been brought together in the past.  We will also work to help train and
organize conservatives so we can be as effective as the liberals have been in
the past..
There is a reason we always say we do more with less than
any other Tea Party Group out there. 
We have run Tea Party Nation for the last four years on a shoestring
budget, and yet managed to accomplish many of our objectives.
The Tea Party movement is incredible because it has changed
the course of American politics. 
Unfortunately, while we have become a force to be reckoned with, we have
not been nearly as successful as we need to be.  That is why we are creating Tea Party Nation Action.
We need your help in funding our new non-profit and getting
it off the ground.  Today we need
your generous contribution of $25, $50, $100, $250 or more to help us.
2014 can be like 2010 again.  We must make that happen.  Tea Party Nation Action is a group that is going to help
make that happen.
In order for us to launch Tea Party Nation Action, we need
to raise $10,000 by September 6th.  Help us turn the tide for America!
Please join us!
In Liberty,
Judson Phillips 
PS, Today we need your generous contribution of $25, $50,
$100, $250 or more to help us.

story:
Short Summary

GMO Labeling Massachusetts is a  group of dedicated citizens working to defend our right to know what is in our food. Our strategy and our goal is the same; democracy. We will use the ballot initiative process to make GMO labeling required by law for all food sold in MA. We will use your support to set the exciting precedent of crowd funding legislative efforts that protect and inform everyone. Although this campaign is currently Massachusetts focused, a victory here will have dramatic affects on the national "right to know" movement. 

All funds raised will be used to collect the 70,000 signatures required to ensure our place on the ballot.

Genetically  Modified Organisms (GMOs) are plants or animals created through the process of genetic engineering. This experimental technology forces DNA  from one species into a different species. The resulting GMOs are unstable combinations of plant, animal, bacterial and viral genes that would not occur in nature and have unknown long term health consequences. According to the Grocery Manufactures Association, nearly 80% of processed foods contain GMOs.

We believe GMO's need to be labeled because:

1. We have the right to know what is in our food. Period.

2. There have been no long term studies on the health effects of GMOs. Until we label GMOs, true independent research will be nearly impossible. Labeling will enable us to exercise our right to make precautionary choices.

3. GMOs spread uncontrollably and threaten sustainable agriculture practices.

4. GMOs are used to enable crops to be saturated in chemical herbicides that inhibit nutrient uptake.

5. GMOs could possibly be related to the recent explosion in food allergies and other public health concerns. Only labeling will enable researchers to definitively inform the public about GMO effects on environmental and public health.

6. Nearly 50 countries require labels on GMOs, and many also have severe restrictions of bans against GMO food production or sale. We deserve the same level of protection and information as citizens in other nations.

Your support will be the difference in protecting our food supply.  Contributions will help our grassroots campaign send a powerful message to the biotechnology industry, one of the most politically influential industry's in the world. Through a successful ballot initiative, we will not only unify a resounding democratic voice that will be heard across the country, but we will also achieve a victory that will make labeling in other states and even nationally  nearly inevitable. For example, Connecticut has already passed a GMO labeling law that will only go into effect when a neighboring state also passes a GMO labeling law.

Massachusetts is an ideal state for this effort. The state is small enough for a grass roots effort to really grab hold, the people are well informed and open to new ideas, and the organic food movement is well established. 

If you would like to learn more about GMOs a great movie to look into is Genetic Roulette, available on youtube. A great website to visit is http://justlabelit.org/

What We Need & What You Get

We need funds to hire volunteer coordinators and signature gatherers to ensure that we get the required 70,000 signatures required by the December 4 deadline. All additional funds raised will go towards the infrastructure of a successful campaign including:

Voter education, outreach, and strategic advertising

Administrative staff to coordinate the campaign

Legal, financial, media and political consulting as needed

Logistical expenses

What you get? Legislative experience! (and with it, the enormous satisfaction of participating in our democracy through more than your vote.

The Impact

Currently, 37 states are pursuing mandatory labeling legislation. Even if you don't live in Massachusetts, please consider the national impact of a victory here. Not only will other state's labeling campaigns be significantly emboldened, and there existing laws enabled, but there are several financial, logistical and legal reasons to expect that national food processors will soon change all of their packaging even if only one state requires it. 

We welcome the debate with folks who believe GMOs are safe and/or beneficial. But we believe labeling is beyond debate. Labeling isn't a ban on these foods, it is simply a protection of our freedom to choose.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you would like to contribute in ways other than through a donation think about these ideas:

1. Spread the word to your network to support this indiegogo campaign

2. If you live in, near or are visiting Massachusetts, consider volunteering to collect signatures or do voter education.

3. Post any news about the campaign to your social media network

4. Inform yourself on the subject

5. Boycott GMOs. Because they are not labeled, the only way to boycott GMOs is to buy from companies who voluntarily label their products as non-GMO or to by USDA organic certified foods.

For more information or to volunteer visit: at http://gmolabelmass.org/ and be sure to like us on facebook and spread the word at www.facebook.com/gmolabelMA


"You never change things by fighting against the existing reality. To change something, build a new model that makes the existing model obsolete." - Buckminster Fuller

story:
Things Liz Makes wants to expand their offerings!

Things Liz Makes is a Utah-based small business that is run by work at home mom Liz Beckwith. I've been a professional fiber artist for over 2 years now, and providing a high quality, well-made product has been my priority from day one.

I currently specialize in spinning fibers, handspun and hand dyed yarns, but I can make a whole lot more than that! I want to open two new lines within the established Things Liz Makes brand. The first line, TLM Bags, will be comprised of project bags that are marketed directly to spinners and are unique, functional, durable and attractive. The second line, TLM Baby, will have lots of cute and functional handmade baby gear that is made with natural parenting in mind. Some items that will be available include cloth diapering accessories, hand knit soakers, teething pads for baby wearing wraps and more.

In order to supply the best possible product, I need to start with the best quality materials. For the bags line, this includes:

  • High quality fabrics that will hold up to wear and tear
  • Top quality threads and structure pieces
  • A new sewing machine that can handle a high volume of projects

For the baby line, this means great fabrics that are made using environmentally friendly processes and natural fibers, but that can also hold up to the heavy use they will get from baby. For contributing to the cause, you will be among the first people to get your hands on these awesome products!

The ideas that sparked this campaign were based on a need that I was unable to find an existing answer to.

I'm a spinner, and I have not been able to find a project bag that was functional and could protect my spindle. After all, spindles get expensive! This need sparked a brainstorming session in which I designed a bag that will be fashionable and functional for the spindle spinner. This bag will have a structured build that will prevent damage to the user's spindle, as well as a roomy fiber compartment and a zip pocket for notions.

Another need that I've experienced lately is a need for natural parenting accessories. My third child was born in March, and I've been exploring natural parenting options like cloth diapering and baby wearing. There are loads of shops that create great baby goodies, but there are things that I just haven't been able to find. One item that sparked my interest in creating natural parenting accessories was teething pads. So far, they are only available for soft structured carriers and not for woven wraps or slings. While the fabrics used to make these carriers are not damaged by baby drool, in my experience they tend to wick moisture onto the wearer's clothes, which is kind of unpleasant! I've worked up a design for a teething pad that absorbs baby drool, prevents it from transferring to the wrap or your clothes, and is removable even while you're wearing baby.

These ideas sparked more ideas, and I've been working furiously to make all these great things I have in my head. I need your help to share these things with the world!

UPDATE! I have been workign furiously on getting the spindler's project bag idea just right, and I think I've worked out the final version of the bag! It's in production as we speak, and I will continue posting pictures in the update tab. Be sure to check the update tab for more information on where the project is!

story:
I'm not the type to usually ask for help.  But this time, I need it.  Desperately.

My husband lost his job almost 4 months ago.  His father had cancer, my husband took time off of work to help him.  He couldn't get the leave paperwork signed by his doctor, and in turn, lost his job.  Due to careful planning, we were able to last this long, and we thought one of us would find a job before now.  I HAD one, but I had to quit due to my health... I quit it over a month ago, and I'm still recovering from injuries.  Though I wasn't there long enough for them to even think about Workman's comp.

So here's what we're looking at:

We have rent due next month.  We have our car insurance being taken out at the end of THIS month, and we haven't even had the money to pay our utility bill.  Benefits haven't come in yet, and if they do on time, it still won't be enough to keep a roof over our heads.

We're exhausting all avenues.  But we just have to face facts: This time next month, we'll be homeless.  With a 1 year old.  (The picture is an older photo of me and him).

Our families are broke and can't help out.  They're struggling to make ends meet as it is.

I'm really trying to do what I can.  But it just won't be enough.

So here's what I'm willing to offer:

I realize people don't like to just give money away.  I have my own business, and I'm willing to give product in return for donations.

So make your donation and pick something from my website:

http://celestial-earth.weebly.com

OR, I can do a Tarot, Rune, Pendulum or Oracle reading in return for a donation.  Just e-mail me at:

daughterofsekhmet@gmail.com

Please, whatever you can do will help.

story:
Hi, I’m John Seed of the Rainforest Information Centre. I’ve been working for the conservation of nature since 1979. I’ve noticed that wherever rainforests are disappearing, one of the engines of the destruction is invariably unsustainable agriculture.

This has meant that we’ve often had a permaculture component to  our campaign strategies and over the years have developed incredible respect for this system. Last year we found out about Chikukwa where permaculture has naturalized itself and in 22 years, moved a community of 7000 people from hunger and malnutrition to abundance. I coauthored an article about this with Australian academic Terry Leahy who has been conducting research on food security projects in Africa since 2003 and regards the Chikukwa project as the most successful he has encountered and the best model he has seen that would likely succeed in  other parts of Africa.

Last year  we raised $2000 for a pilot “train the trainer” programme  to prepare the Chikukwa community to host a group of about  20 farmers from elsewhere in Zimbabwe. Following the successful conclusion of this training  we asked them  to prepare us a proposal  and budget and are now raising $13,000 so that farmers from the poor community of Murehwa can travel to Chikukwa and be housed, fed and trained for 2 weeks in the permaculture skills that have allowed Chikukwa to thrive.

I’ll start the ball rolling with a $3000 donation and am setting up two crowdfunding sites, this one to try and raise $7000 on indiegogo (with tax deductibility for US$ donations through our longtime US partners the Earthways Foundation) and another to try and raise $3000 on www.gofundme.com/3wckl0 that will do the same for Aussie donations.

Please make a contribution if you can and also let people know by sharing this campaign via indiegogo’s share tools.

If you found the 6 minute video clip inspiring, please check out the 20-minute version.

story:
Stupid for Smarts

Hi. I'm Wallace. And I've been inspired to get off my butt and do something to help. And the people of Haiti need help. My girlfriend, Kathryn Ward, is an official representative of a ministry in Mole Saint Nicolas, Haiti. A man by the name of Pastor Kenan runs several schools and helps provide food and clothing for the improvished orphans in the area. 

So we'll be doing a little bit of photography. You donate $10. You get to decide whatever terribly embarassing, weird, or whatever photo I take. If its within the law and common human decency, I'll do it. I do something stupid for your money and the children of Haiti can get an education. Stupid for Smarts. Get it now? :D 

What We Need & What You Get

Here the plan:

  • You donate $10. If you don't have $10 but still want to donate, that's fantastic. Thank you so so much. But $10 is the minimum for a photo. If you want to donate more, that's also fantastic. Either way, you're doing something to help.
  • You leave your picture request in the donation. It can be anything. Want me to dress up like a woman? Good. I have great legs. Want me to dress up like Hulk Hogan and play basketball? Done. 

    You're only limited by your imagination. And the law. And maybe common human deceny. But mainly your imagination. I'll work to the best of my ability to accomadate whatever you come up with!
     
  • You visit our Facebook page at www.facebook.com/StupidForSmarts and see your picture get posted
  • Share the photo all over the place and tell your friends that you helped better an improvished child's life while getting this wicked cool shot. 
  • If you donate $20, you can get 2. $30 gets 3 and so on and so forth. 

If you can't donate, please share this with your friends and family. Post it on Facebook, tweet it, write the link down on paper and send it via carrier pigeon.

Any and all help is welcome.

story:
Hi everyone,

For those of you who don't know me, I'm a friend of Cate. I met Cate when she was in Paris and straight away understood how great she was, since then we have become really close friends.

As you all know Cate has been through a lot lately, for those who don't know Cate has had a series of 6 surgeries since last Spring to deal with health issues, culminating in her recent double mastectomy weeks ago for breast cancer, that her insurance company wasn't covering. She still has months of procedures ahead including another major surgery already in Feb, plus all the pain and hassles that go with body-part reconstruction after essentially amputating. And now her insurance has just switched her policy to a really bad one because she fought them all last year and wrote a bill for new healthcare legislation for women that now is with the Senate in California so other women would not go through what she has had to. But what Cate gets from this effort is that in 2014 they are calling her "non-compliant", making her pay twice as much for almost no coverage and her doctors are all dropping network care anyway. American healthcare is in critical trouble as we all know but for some one like Cate who is caught in a horrible situation in the middle of this bad time in the US, it is really important to be able to keep going while the govt and congress work through their issues. Many people can wait it out but Cate can't. We need her healthy and in one piece as fast as possible so she can get back to normal life, back to work on her business which was growing before this all hit, and back to being the strong advocate she is for women's health and breast cancer.

She had to sell her house to finance part of this and was also helped by some family. but unfortunately this is still not enough as she still miss money for the last months of her operations, and can't work at the moment (and hasn't been able to for months) following a freak car accident that was not even her fault in the middle of all this- and also has its own set of expenses and issues. Also Cate hates to ask for help.

But having seen my Uncle move in America and need collective help to pay for his American surgery as it is not covered the way it is in France or UK, I thought it would be a good idea to collect some money to help Cate pay for her last operations and for her to have a decent life during these tough times when she really can't do anything she could normally. I don't want to share this on social networks as I know Cate would not like it (so please don't post anywhere public!) But I hoped by maybe doing this back-channel we could help her keep going through this incredibly bad time with continued push-back and frustrations from her insurance company.

If you can donate and/ or help spread this with direct messages or email that would be great. Considering she already sold her house I doubt we can raise enough to cover everything, but anything we can do to help her cover some expenses would be helping a lot already. I don't want to embarrass Cate with this but I also do not want to sit by passively and watch everything she has worked for continue to fall away because of a really broken system she was born under and is trying to change.

Just so you know I contacted Cate for her paypal account and all money will go straight to her paypal, you can obviously ask her, as you don't know me and I wouldnt myself give any money to someone I don't know.

Thanks in advance for helping me spread the word, this is really important for Cate, and even if you can't donate a lot, don't hesitate to participate even a bit.
story_txt:
Hi everyone,For those of you who don't know me, I'm a friend of Cate. I met Cate when she was in Paris and straight away understood how great she was, since then we have become really close friends.
As you all know Cate has been through a lot lately,
for those who don't know Cate has had a series of 6 surgeries since last 
Spring to deal with health issues, culminating in her recent double mastectomy weeks ago for breast cancer, that her insurance company wasn't 
covering. She still has months of procedures ahead including another major surgery already in Feb, plus all the pain and hassles that go with 
body-part reconstruction after essentially amputating. And now her insurance has just switched her policy to a really bad one because she fought them all last year and wrote a bill for new healthcare legislation for women that now is with the Senate in California so other women would not go through what she has had to. But what Cate gets from this effort is that in 2014 they are calling her "non-compliant", making her pay twice as much for almost no coverage and her doctors are all dropping network care anyway. American healthcare is in critical trouble as we all know but for some one like Cate who is caught in a horrible situation in the middle of this bad time in the US, it is really important to be able to keep going while the govt and congress work through their issues. Many people can wait it out but Cate can't. We need her healthy and in one piece as fast as possible so she can get back to normal life, back to work on her business which was growing before this all hit, and back to being the strong advocate she is for women's health and breast cancer.She had to sell her house to finance part of this and was also helped by
 some family. but unfortunately this is still not enough as she still 
miss money for the last months of her operations, and can't work at the 
moment (and hasn't been able to for months) following a freak car 
accident that was not even her fault in the middle of all this- and also
 has its own set of expenses and issues.

Also Cate hates to ask for help. But having seen my Uncle move in 
America and need collective help to pay for his American surgery as it 
is not covered the way it is in France or UK, I thought it would be a 
good idea to collect some money to help Cate pay for her last operations
 and for her to have a decent life during these tough times when she 
really can't do anything she could normally. 

I don't want to share this on social networks as I know Cate would not 
like it (so please don't post anywhere public!) But I hoped by maybe 
doing this back-channel we could help her keep going through this 
incredibly bad time with continued push-back and frustrations from her 
insurance company.  If you can donate and/ or help spread this with 
direct messages or email that would be great. Considering she already 
sold her house I doubt we can raise enough to cover everything, but 
anything we can do to help her cover some expenses would be helping a 
lot already. I don't want to embarrass Cate with this but I also do not want to sit by passively and watch everything she has worked for continue to fall away because of a really broken system she was born under and is trying to change.Just so you know I contacted Cate for her paypal account and all money will go straight to her paypal, you can obviously ask her, as you don't know me and I wouldnt myself give any money to someone I don't know. Thanks in advance for helping me spread the word, this is really important for Cate, and even if you can't donate a lot, don't hesitate to participate even a bit.

story:
The “All Things Nigerian Expo” is the first shopping and lifestyle event of its kind in the greater US area, featuring purely made in Nigeria products. The Expo will represent a day of ethnic and cultural immersion for visitors with an open market array of varied products ranging from our Food section with Nigerian popular food like Suya (Nigerian style barbequed meat), to our Fun section featuring amongst other things a book signing by Nigerian author Ugo Agada-Uyah with her debut book in the victims series Omezue, The Complete Achiever and of course, the Fashion section, which fully showcases our fashion culture ranging from ready to wear clothing, jewellery, bags, shoes all done with our local fabrics and raw materials and culminates with the ATN fashion show. 


All Things Nigerian Expo has a mission to create a platform for Nigerian designers, artists, musicians and the like to come together and uplift and support one another. Donating to this cause will enable us keep this event free for the public that will come out and support local and international Nigerian merchants and designers. 

***Donors will be presented with cool swag bags filled with goodies from all participating vendors such as T-shirts, cosmetics, gift certificates, etc. Donors of $250 or more could claim a custom piece of jewelry from sponsor, Nigerian jewelry maker Verche L'Art cessoire.

Why is it important?

Unlike in the past, Nigeria is in the news today for the right reasons. This includes the influx of direct foreign investments from around the world. With over a hundred and sixty million people, Nigerian consumption market attracts investments daily from diversified business disciplines. 

In the same vein, Nigerians have been able to create and develop various brands which have attained global demand and appreciable commercial success. Some of Nigeria's success stories come from the entertainment industry of movie (Nollywood), music, and fashion. But apart from the aforementioned, there are lots of other endeavors where Nigerian made goods and services have excelled.

We aim to provide a platform for forward looking, dynamic upwardly mobile, indigenous manufacturers of products with a global view to bring them to the US market and the Diaspora as a whole.


In addition to just providing Nigerian merchants with a platform to sell their merchandise, we are adding value by helping a Nigerian youth pay for school!!! The ATN Expo Scholarship Fund sets out to change a Nigerian child's life through education.
We are partnering with a local school in Abuja to present an opportunity for at least one child every year we hold our event. 

Other Ways You Can Help....

Can't make a monetary contribution? That's fine! Help us spread the word! Like our page on Facebook and Instagram @all_things_naija. Tell your friends and family to come out and indulge in true Nigerian Culture on May 26, 2014 in Silver Spring, MD at Veterans Plaza. Please Visit us at www.AllThingsNaija.com

story:
Crowdfunding campaign ended

The crowdfunding campaign have now reached its deadline.


Thanks to all of you, we have raised more than $8000.
We're extremely grateful for that and we're going to do everything in our power to deliver the very best product for you all.


What is TweakStyle?

TweakStyle is an upcoming code editor for web designers and web developers, focused on frontend development.

Why TweakStyle?

Today, the usual web design workflow is heavility split. We use dozen of tools that do not interact. We lose a lot of time, switching between windows, searching for what we want to change and using inadequate tools. Most code editors and IDEs are made for coding and for coding only, but web design is much more than just coding. Web design is about combining, adjusting, testing.

As a result TweakStyle breaks with standard code editors and introduces some unique features thought for web design packed with an unmatched user-friendly interface.

What are our guidelines?

We’re building a software to be used intensively everyday by demanding people. Usefulness, quality and user experience are permanent concerns. We want to break with all those fusty tools and bring UX, usability, ergonomic design, intuitiveness and ease of use in code editors. Features should be accessible when we need it, at the right place and in an intuitive way.

Features

The video above presents only a few of the features TweakStyle offers and there are a lot more coming.

 

Here’s an extract of features currently being developed

 

And an extract of the ideas we have for the future

Why a crowdfunding campaign?

We have a lot of ideas and our feature pipe is growing each day, but we lack the resources to develop them. At our current development rate, We’re confident in being able to deliver the Core of TweakStyle by the end of the year but the Core is only the start of what we want to achieve.

We’ve created a crowdfunding campaign because we would like to deliver more, sooner and more surely.

The more funds we’ll raise the sooner TweakStyle will reach its full potential.

The best part: your perks

 

What folks are saying

FAQ

The campaign is set to “Flexible funding”, what does this mean?

It means that funds will go to TweakStyle even is the target is not reached and perks will be delivered no matter what.

 

What will happen if the target is not reached?

If the $50000 target is not reached, we won’t be able to hire more developers. As a result, we’ll continue the development of TweakStyle at our current pace. It will be possible to deliver TweakStyle on time but I may not have the extra time to implement all we would like to deliver.

In a nutshell, the risk is small in contributing to the campaign and the more funds we’ll raise the better TweakStyle will be.

 

On which platform(s) TweakStyle will be available?

TweakStyle will be available for Mac OS X, Windows and Linux.

 

What is the licensing model of TweakStyle?

TweakStyle license is per user. With one license you’ll be able to run it on several computers and several Operating systems.

 

What will be the price of TweakStyle after its release?

The price of the license after the release will be $99 per user. So you can save up to $64 by contributing to the crowdfunding campaign.

 

Will the updates be free? For how long?

Updates will be free, lifetime, including major ones.


Is there a beta version to try it out?

No, TweakStyle is not ready to distribute yet, even as a beta/trial. It will be shipped first to our early adopters in June.

 

Are you French?

Yes, we are. How did you find out? Is my accent that strong? :)

Thank you very much for your support.

Sincerely yours,
Félicien FRANCOIS
CEO and main developer @ TweakStyle

story:
Short Summary

Hi My name is Chuck. With me is my assistant  Yorkie named Bear

Pinetree is a  family owned business and we have been in business for 22 years.  I am a veteran that had a dream and formed the company to live the dream.  We started in our garage. We do business in the data storage field and this project will help  the company grow .The business will provide a service to small and medium companies  and retain jobs for 7 team members and the assistant buddies .

 We have delivered products and repair service to 63 different countries.  We also have provided services to customers in all the major cities in the USA.

This fund will buy equipment and software to facilitate and store the data.  The need for this service has been expressed by small businesses that need a plan to recover from a disaster in a timely fashion.

The fiber network that we have installed will shorten the time to recover from a disaster by having all the data needed available quickly.   Part of this service will also offer the small and medium users, that have long term storage data needs,the facility to store the data 

 Your contribution  will be most appreciated  to make the future good.

What We Need & What You Get

The amount of funding requested is $200,000   The equipment will be high speed data processors with  high speed fiber interfaces.  The software will be proven software.  The security will be tested  to ensure safe data transmission and storage.  The marketing will be done with local businesses .   The sales will be done over the internet and direct calls locally.  The  fixed cost of the facility will be shared with the existing company business.  Team member costs will be minimized by time sharing with the existing activity.  The company will provide this service at a price that a small business can afford and will use by keeping the cost down. The municipal owned fiber ring will be used. The method of transfer will be high speed internet for the update.  The initial transfer of data will be done using mass media and courier service to move the data to the recovery center and back to the customer. 

Every contributor will get a recognition note in addition to the award for the level of contribution.

We will be a company in on the fiber ring to offer local cloud storage with a high speed internet connection.  This will provide the user with quick access to their data when needed.  The data will be archived in a tape library to provide storage of data that needs to be kept for more than 5 years. The power to keep the date is small since the tape is stored until needed.   The service can be  scaled to use the  funds  available.

The Impact

Your help will provide services focused on small business.  These companies provide 80% of the jobs.  This will give this market segment equal access to their data in a timely fashion. You are contributing to a project that is dedicated to providing these  businesses disaster recovery.    You will be able to know that your help gave support to the people in small businesses. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We would ask you to share this opportunity with anyone with a business that needs to keep records for more than 5 years   Our service will be able to provide data storage for 20 years or more. 

Please use Indiegogo when you have an opportunity to share tools and information.

story:
We're Bringing Yoga and Mindfulness to Teens...

...Wouldn't you like to join us?

Collaborating with Lauren Taylor, floral designer at Wild at Heart, California, content marketing firm ROOT will be presenting how to build the perfect spring bouquet in Laguna Beach, California.  All proceeds benefit UP, a 501(c)(3) pilot program bringing mindfulness and yoga to teens. 

Hosted by saltfineart, we'll be sending you off with more than just flowers. Our amazing donors have given us the opportunity to raffle off a goodie basket valued at over $1,000.  

Can't Join Us?

You can still contribute, even if you're not in town. Here's how: 

  • Make a contribution; we'll love you for anything you can give (heck, we'll love you even if you can't!). 
  • Help spread the word about our cause. Think about how meditation and mindfulness has enriched your life. IndieGoGo has a share button just for that.

And that’s all there is to it.

 More questions? Please email me at letstalkroot [at] gmail [dot] com. 

xx - Amber Materna, founder of ROOT

story:
NeighborCulture seeks to use food waste diversion from neighborhood households to reduce the cost for compost for urban farming ventures that it manages. This allows an earlier profit to be achieved while employing more people. These profits will be shared in a cooperative style through discounts being made available to those neighbors who contribute food waste and time. Some of the profits will also be directed towards neighborhood improvement projects such as shade trees to make the neighborhood more walkable. The bottom line is this solution builds on itself through one investment as a continuous flow of free food waste equals more capital for urban farming. These urban farms then serve as sources for neighborhood development in economic, social, and environmental wellbeing.

The urban farms that NeighborCulture constructs and manages will not only be low cost, but also have a low footprint. Bringing decades of combined experience in earth-friendly agriculture techniques such as permaculture, the urban farms will require minimal inputs and maintenance. The transport used for diverting food waste will be bike carts; reducing the need for fossil fuel and cutting contributions to greenhouse gas emissions. The pilot program will take place in the Mitchell Park neighborhood in Tempe just west of Mill Ave; a neighborhood that is home to a community garden that cannot meet demand and many enthusiastic neighbors that I've worked closely with. Being so close to ASU's Tempe Campus will give NeighborCulture visibility and a good source of help from students concerned with food system sustainability and hungering for real world experience.

NeighborCulture measures its success in how quickly a neighborhood can take ownership for and manage its neighborhood's urban farm program. It will provide educational training opportunities to further this end and foster innovation among neighborhood residents. We already have land and labor available.  We just need your help to get a good boost to expand operations.  If you cannot donate money please send us any information and resources that you believe can help.

story: !

Short Summary

 

Hello, my name is Elizabete Saukas (I'm the one in the purple t-shirt, in the photo above), Brazilian, married and living in Michigan, U.S.A. My heart beats for the Orphans and I'm in love with this cause, I'm a volunteer at Orfanato Evangélico (Evangelical Orphanage) - a christian orphanage situated in the city of Feira de Santana, BA, Brazil (close to my hometown).
 
The purpose of this little fund raising campaign is to bless the children with a beautiful party and a fun filled day, and some much needed food donations. The idea is to basically be a gift to the institution for the benefit of the children, bringing lots of smiles to their faces, through fun games, yummy food, balloons, trampolines, music and pictures (yeah, they love pictures). There is not much joy being raised in an Orphanage, and I'd just like to bring a little happiness to the neediest of the needy.

 What We Need & What They get

Foreseen date of event: December 15th 2012.

Where are your donations going?

Party "Feast for the orphans" (food for a party, decoration, photos, amusement, toy rentals): $ 850.00

Extra costs (extra fund and fees): $ 150.00

Funds for food donation: $ 500.00
Total: $ 1500.00
 
The extra fund is the amount reserved for unlikely, but possible, overbudget scenarios. In case it doesn't happen, all the money will be directed to food donation. The fees it covers are: currency conversion and Indiegogo fees.
 
If the entire goal is not achieved or surpassed, the funds will become food donations.
 
F.Y.I. : I'll be doing this while I am on vacation visiting my Family and Friends
Don't worry, I'm buying my own round trip ticket! :-)

The Outreach

Why do i care with the orphans in Brazil?

In Scriptures, we are instructed to care for the Poor, the Widowed and the Orphaned....I choose to attend to the least able of these.

According to the Brazilian government rules and regulations, a child is allowed to stay in the institution for an initial period of 2 years. During that time efforts are made to get the child adopted locally. Once that time has expired, the child is up for International adoption and in some cases efforts are made to get the child back with his/her biological Mother, or an extended family member.

If all these efforts fail, the child is allowed to stay until their 18th birthday and then they are turned loose onto the streets wether they are ready or not. The institution does everything within it's power to prepare these young adults with whatever training they can so that they may have some skills before they are forced to provide for themselves. The sad part is, many of them turn to a life of crime, drugs and prostitution.

The sucess of this campaign will be the achievement of one of my dreams. A dream to bring just a little joy and love to these young orphans. Little ones, who by no fault of their own most often suffer pain and loss for a life time.
There is little joy in an orphanage. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can also support this campaign, sharing it with your friends and loved ones. 

More informations:

The evangelical orphanage is aware about this campaign and support it.

Do you have more questions? Contact me - elizabethsaukas@yahoo.com

The evangelical orphanage page in the facebook: https://www.facebook.com/orfanatoevangelico1

The evangelical orphanage website (in construction): http://www.orfanatoevangelico.org

Orphanage e-mail: orfanato@terra.com.br

 

Please help if you can,

Bless You and THANK YOU!

Sincerely,

Elizabete Saukas

My heart beats for the Orphans and I'm in love with this cause, I'm a volunteer at Orfanato Evangélico (Evangelical Orphanage) - a christian orphanage situated in the city of Feira de Santana, BA, Brazil (close to my hometown).
 
The purpose of this little fund raising campaign is to bless the children with a beautiful party and a fun filled day, and some much needed food donations. The idea is to basically be a gift to the institution for the benefit of the children, bringing lots of smiles to their faces, through fun games, yummy food, balloons, trampolines, music and pictures (yeah, they love pictures). There is not much joy being raised in an Orphanage, and I'd just like to bring a little happiness to the neediest of the needy.

 What We Need & What They get
Foreseen date of event: December 15th 2012.

Where are your donations going?
Party "Feast for the orphans" (food for a party, decoration, photos, amusement, toy rentals): $ 850.00
Extra costs (extra fund and fees): $ 150.00
Funds for food donation: $ 500.00Total: $ 1500.00
 

The extra fund is the amount reserved for unlikely, but possible, overbudget scenarios. In case it doesn't happen, all the money will be directed to food donation. The fees it covers are: currency conversion and Indiegogo fees.
 
If the entire goal is not achieved or surpassed, the funds will become food donations.
 


F.Y.I. : I'll be doing this while I am on vacation visiting my Family and Friends
Don't worry, I'm buying my own round trip ticket! :-)


The Outreach
Why do i care with the orphans in Brazil?
In Scriptures, we are instructed to care for the Poor, the Widowed and the Orphaned....I choose to attend to the least able of these.
According to the Brazilian government rules and regulations, a child is allowed to stay in the institution for an initial period of 2 years. During that time efforts are made to get the child adopted locally. Once that time has expired, the child is up for International adoption and in some cases efforts are made to get the child back with his/her biological Mother, or an extended family member.
If all these efforts fail, the child is allowed to stay until their 18th birthday and then they are turned loose onto the streets wether they are ready or not. The institution does everything within it's power to prepare these young adults with whatever training they can so that they may have some skills before they are forced to provide for themselves. The sad part is, many of them turn to a life of crime, drugs and prostitution.
The sucess of this campaign will be the achievement of one of my dreams. A dream to bring just a little joy and love to these young orphans. Little ones, who by no fault of their own most often suffer pain and loss for a life time.
There is little joy in an orphanage. 
 


Other Ways You Can Help
You can also support this campaign, sharing it with your friends and loved ones. 
More informations:
The evangelical orphanage is aware about this campaign and support it.
Do you have more questions? Contact me - elizabethsaukas@yahoo.com
The evangelical orphanage page in the facebook: https://www.facebook.com/orfanatoevangelico1
The evangelical orphanage website (in construction): http://www.orfanatoevangelico.org
Orphanage e-mail: orfanato@terra.com.br

 
Please help if you can,
Bless You and THANK YOU!
Sincerely,
Elizabete Saukas

story:
Together we can feed 4,050 families

Hi! We're Beehive Cheese, a small family creamery in Northern Utah best known for our Barely Buzzed. In 2005 we opened our doors, and we've been making award-winning artisan cheese ever since.

Our new STRETCH GOAL is $36,000 to produce SIX batches of Promontory, our base cheddar. All 8,100 pounds of Promontory will be donated to the Utah Food Bank and has the potential to feed 4,050 families.

Your donation will allow us to feed families in need. It will help support our dairy partner and keep our cheesemaking team employed.   

 

 

Due to the cost of milk and labor, we don’t have the cash on hand to produce the cheese we'd like to donate. That’s why we need your help. Beehive Cheese will take zero profit from the batches of cheese donated to the Utah Food Bank.

If we raise more than our goal, we plan on continuing to use those funds to make as much cheese as possible to keep the donations going strong.

The Need

Since March we’ve done all we can do to support the community through in kind donations of about 2,600 pounds of cheese to the Lantern House, Catholic Community Services, and the Utah Food Bank. That food was distributed to about 1,000 homeless individuals and roughly 500 families. At this point, we’ve run out of cheese in our coolers to donate and still fill customer orders. 

Our community is facing depression-era levels of unemployment, with 1 in 7 workers out of job needing cash and food assistance. Food Banks are in desperate need. They’ve seen a major increase in families seeking assistance. These families need nutrient dense, versatile foods to get by. 

With retail and food service demand down, Beehive is only producing at a fourth of our capacity. Our vats are open and ready to produce cheese for the community.  
 


700 pounds of cheese went to the Utah Food Bank in April
 

Media Coverage

Today Show
Cheese to the Rescue by Janet Fletcher
Utah Cheesemaker Helps Families on KSL-TV
Beehive Cheese to Feed 1,350 Families in Deli Market News

 

Why are you calling it Project Promontory?

Two reasons.

One, our base cheddar is called Promontory. It’s named after a famous Utah landmark, Promontory Point, where the railroads connected 150 years ago.

Two, a Promontory is a high point of land jutting out of a large body of water. It’s the safest place to be when you’re surrounded by the rising tide of uncertainty. We believe if we all work together, we can hold each other up as high as possible and stay safe. 
 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute, please consider sharing our Indiegogo campaign link on your socials. Your help spreading the word means the world to us.

story:
My name is Charleen Caabay, Chef/Owner of Kainbigan. Kainbigan serves Filipino Comfort Food in Oakland, CA. I created Kainbigan back in 2007, and that's when I realized that there was a need for Filipino food in my community. In Tagalog, the word kain means "to eat" and the word kaibigan means "friend". Where there is good food, there is always good company.  I've always had a passion for cooking since as young as my teen years and up until now.  I have been fortunate enough to share my culinary skills by catering many different special events, parties, and venues. Introducing Filipino food to new taste buds in my town, and bringing traditional flavors back into the scene continues to be my passion.

I wanted to focus my culinary specialty on Filipino food because of the lack of it in the city that I live in, Oakland, CA.  As diverse and cultured as this city is, there is scarce access to Filipino Food.  Though lumpia and pancit are popular choices in the Filipino food culture, I wanted to introduce other Filipino favorites to the community such as adobos, turon and sinigang to name a few.  As a 2nd generation Filipino, I feel that Filipino food has become more and more Americanized.  I want to bring back traditional comfort Filipino food to my generation and community.

In doing this campaign I am asking for your support to my dream and help to get Kainbigan up and running. Your donation will help greatly towards this goal.  By donating you are helping me fund kitchen equipment, furniture, construction expenses to bring the restaurant to code, permit expenses and a variety of small miscellaneous expenses.  In return I promise to cook the best Filipino food in the East Bay for you to enjoy.


What Kainbigan Needs


Kitchen Equipment:

  • 6 Burner Stove
  • Charbroiler
  • Griddle
  • Fryer
  • Cold Drink Cabinet
  • Refrigerator (Single door)
  • Freezer (Single door)
  • Worktables
  • Stainless steel shelves 
  • 3 Compartment sink
  • Miscellaneous cookware


Total: $23,000


Construction Needed (per Alameda Health Department):

  •  3 Compartment sink must be moved out from under the exhaust hood, this will require the move of the Produce/Prep sink to the other side of the kitchen
  • Where the wall and floor tiling meet must be flush to the floor. Replacing tile in kitchen area and bathroom is required.
  • Mop sink must be replaced to a floor sink where drain is direct plumbing
  • Exhaust Hood cleaning and repair


Total: $18,000


Furniture & Lighting Fixtures

  • Tables and Seating
  • Floor mats
  • Lighting
  • Window Treatments

Total: $6,000

Permits, Licenses & Operating Insurance

Total:  $3000

 

Your Donation Impact

By helping me raise the funds to open Kainbigan, you will not only be supporting my dream, but also supporting

  • Awareness of Filipino food
  • Community growth
  • Small business
  • Women owned businesses
  • Locally grown food

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I realize not every one will be able to help out by making a donation, but that doesn't mean you can't support my fundraising effort!  Here is what you can do to help:

Help me get the word out about my campaign!  Tell your friends, tell your family, tell the person on the street that you're passing by about my fundraising efforts.

If you have eaten my food and loved it please spread the word and let folks know I am in the process of opening my own space where you can get my yummy food every day!

Share my indiegogo campaign on your social media as many times as you feel comfortable

Visit me when the restaurant opens and let me cook up some good Filipino food for you

Thank you in advance for any help you can give me to reach my funding goal and to make my dream a reality!

Charleen Caabay
Owner/Chef
Kainbigan

story:
Hi, 

My name is Amber. I am a single mother with two beautiful boys.  My passion is motorcycles.  I Love to ride them, work on them and anything involving them.  I am an MMI (motorcycle mechanics institute) Kawasaki certified graduate.  Last October I had a terrible motorcycle accident that ended my mechanic career.  

While out of work I decided to take my passion in another direction and open up a Female only motorcycle gear store selling helmets, jackets, gloves, accessories and more.  Right now it is only online until I can purchase inventory and secure a storefront.  Not long ago I had an opportunity to be in a motorcycle shop where I could work and work on getting inventory for my store.  As well as a possible storefront in the shop.  Like most things to good to be true that fell through. The gentleman only offered to hire me simply to try and date me.  When that didn't work I was left high and dry being owed over $400 for hours worked and behind on my bills. Not only that he tried to steal my ideas.  

This is no sob story.  This is my dream and my passion.  I have an event on September 28 that I NEED inventory for.  Any donations received will go to purchase inventory and renew my website.  

My website is:  www.MotoGirlmc.com

story:
A little history…

Congo Square is an actual place in New Orleans. This sacred ground was first used by the Houma People and by slaves in the region as a place to enjoy a day of freedom. Africans used it as a place to maintain their true status as free people of Africa. Indigenous peoples and Europeans often joined in the celebration. Music, abolitionist organization, food, and dance were intertwined to enjoy this one-day-a-week festival. 

Today, in Ithaca,

Congo Square Market (or CSM) is a multicultural community that provides affordable Jamaican, Cuban, Ethiopian and soul food, farm produce and local goods, as well as free healthcare services and entertainment: music, visual art and speakers. Volunteers from Southside Community Center, Rainbow Healing Center, Youth Farm Project, TC Cornell Cooperative Extension's Whole Community Project, Rocky Acres Community Farm, Cayuga Medical Center, and Ithaca Health Alliance help put the market together. 

The Market's goals are to encourage and build community, personal health, and a stronger economic base on Ithaca's south side. The market will be open every Friday from 4-8pm from June 5 to September 4, 2015 at the park next to Southside Community Center, located at 305 S. Plain St. in Ithaca, New York!


Why We Need Your Support

Donating today will guarantee that Congo Square Market will:

  1. Provide stipends for 5 youth of color and fund their projects
  2. Compensate well-known entertainers (like Thousands of One, Travis Knapp, the Rapid River Boys, visual artists, live solo musicians, DJs, bands, dancers) who will perform for the community
  3. Compensate cultural speakers like Jake Edwards from the nearby Onondaga Nation
  4. Provide a weekly display of fresh fruits and vegetables
  5. Provide 4 health permits for start-up vendors
  6. Raise awareness about the market!!!

By contributing, you not only enable the entertainment, but also the great atmosphere and experience that ensues. You are essentially the catalyst of a multitude of salubrious Friday nights at the Ithaca Southside Community Center!


What the Market Offers to the Community

The Congo Square Market offers entrepreneurship opportunities for approximately 15 local market vendors of color per summer. The Market’s financial assistance to vendors has proven crucial in enabling young farmers and cooks from underrepresented communities to develop and sustain their own businesses. 

The Market also sponsors paid apprenticeship opportunities for 5 youth of color to receive one-on-one guidance and setup and take down the Market.

CSM hosts healthcare practitioners from the Ithaca Health Alliance and Cayuga Medical Center who provide free health services at the Market to community members. 

CSM also plans to host theme nights featuring Black History in Tompkins County, an Open Mic Night, Women’s Empowerment, and a Health and Wellness day in collaboration with a Bike Clinic held by Recycle Ithaca’s Bikes (RIBS). CSM will also have a table with low-cost books and reading materials, with an emphasis on Black cultural and political heritage.

Throughout the summer the market grows into a collective beyond a predictable nature- vendors of all different kinds join and add to the communal vibe. The market has been operating strong in this way for 8 years. The impact is real and vital- the only way to fight endless winters and grandiose setbacks is to come together.

Email congosquareentertainment@gmail.com for booking inquiries and artist suggestions! 


What’s In It For You?

We will reward you for donating! Look under: "Select a perk"!!


How Else Can You Help?

Spread the word! Send people to this campaign by using the Indiegogo share tools, and follow us on Facebook- www.facebook.com/CongoSquareIthaca!!

Thank you so much for hearing our story. We hope to see you on a beautiful Friday in Ithaca.

Best wishes,

The CSM Team
