story:
We are overwhelmed with gratitude to all who have contributed so far. We've reached our stated public goal of $10,500 and we are excited about the possibility of reaching our stretch goal, which would allow us to make even more needed improvements.

Our new goal is $20,000 and the additional funding will go to unforeseen costs not in our original plan for the campaign. Improvements that the Odyssey Bookshop could really benefit from, but weren't a priority until we met our first goal. Some of the things we would love to add:  

  • conversion and training for staff while we upgrade to our new point of sale and inventory system.
  • other point of sale equipment we may need like scanners, cash drawers, credit card terminals, receipt printers, and displays.
  •   new hardware and software not included in the original upgrade. 


Who We Are & What We Need

The Odyssey Bookshop of South Hadley, MA is a locally owned independent bookshop committed to offering a quality selection of affordable new, bargain, and gently read books, as well as gifts and educational items for customers of all ages and backgrounds. We are passionate about the written word and seek to share our love of reading to help create and sustain a community of lifelong readers. We strive to provide a hospitable and nurturing environment to encourage the healthy exchange of ideas by hosting numerous readings, book groups, and panel presentations. We are committed to engaging with the many diverse peoples and organizations of our community, particularly in the Pioneer Valley of Western Massachusetts, but also on a national and international scale, to work towards the goals of a knowledgeable public and a peaceful and environmentally sustainable planet.

Please help the Odyssey continue to provide top-notch customer service through upgraded computer systems. Our technology—in-store sales system; computer network, and even our public wireless system—is aging. Much of our hardware is more than ten years old and we’ve been limping along for some time. It’s time to upgrade and we need your help!

Here’s what we hope to do:

·  Purchase and install our first real file server to help us organize, store and secure our critical information. This will allow us to work more efficiently, collaborate on projects and improve communications.

·  Update and renovate our point-of-sale system. We have held off upgrading software because our hardware--some in its teenage years--cannot support the newer system. We need to replace hardware and update software. This will improve our service, while guarding our customers against expanding security threats such as identity theft.

·  Upgrade our internal public wireless systems to make them faster and more secure. This will improve staff productivity and be a convenience for our customers.

What YOU Get

$5—Charlotte’s Web: A shout-out on the Odyssey’s social media pages telling our over 6,600 followers just how great you are! Just like when Charlotte announced to the world that Wilbur was “Radiant!” “Terrific!” and “Some Pig.”

$10—Postcards From the Edge: A handwritten thank-you note from an Odyssey staff member!

$22—Catch-22: An original Odyssey tote bag to catch all your favorite books!

$30—The Sun Also Rises: A high quality Odyssey ceramic mug. Use it to drink your morning coffee, or whatever your favorite beverage might be.

$40—The Rime of the Ancient Mariner: “Water, water everywhere, but not a drop to drink” is a phrase you WON’T be saying with this stainless steel Odyssey water bottle!


$50—The Emperor’s New Clothes: Dress yourself up with the latest in Odyssey fashion—one of our signature t-shirts! We have assorted shirts with our logo and your contribution guarantees a shirt, however we cannot guarantee sizes. If you have a size preference, please state so in the comments field or direct message us! T-shirts are first come, first served up to 50.


$100—Frankenstein: An “unnatural” combination of the previous perks: tote bag, t-shirt, and a mug or water bottle. Combination variations are based on availability.

$100—One Hundred Years of Solitude: Free admission to any one event; includes one book and a spot at the beginning of the signing line.

$100—Babette’s Feast: Book Lover’s Sunday Brunch—September 20, 2015—11:00 am

Join us for a gourmet lakeside brunch with stunning views in a contemporary, light-filled home! Chef Susan Knightly and friends prepare a farm fresh brunch with vegetarian options, from local ingredients. The $100 contribution includes a seat for one guest, there is limited space for 24 guests.

$200—The Great Gatsby: Free admission to any two events; includes one book at each event and a spot at the beginning of each signing line.

$250—Empire Falls: Share a meal with Pulitzer-prize winning author, Richard Russo! Summer of 2016 we’ll host Richard Russo for his new novel, Everybody’s Fool—a sequel to his acclaimed novel Nobody’s Fool. We have space for eight lucky contributors to join him for dinner before the event! Your donation includes your meal, a copy of Russo’s newest novel, and great conversation with a famous author! The dinner will take place in the summer of 2016, official date to be announced.

$400—Beloved: Free admission to any five events; includes one book at both events and a spot at the beginning of each signing line.

$1,000—Moby Dick: A one-year membership in our Signed First Editions Club. Each month you will get a signed first printing of a newly published book. We have a well-qualified team of readers who select books based on literary quality and potential collectibility. Each month’s selection will be signed and sent to you with a protective dust jacket cover.

Shipping is complimentary within the United States; any international shipping will carry an additional charge of $5.00. All perks are fully transferable. Share the gift of the Odyssey with your friends and loved ones!


The Impact

By contributing to our campaign you’re giving the Odyssey Bookshop a leg up in the world of bookselling. With more efficient inventory and point-of-sale systems and newer hardware to run them on we can compete more effectively with the big box stores and online retailers.

If you can’t contribute, that doesn’t mean you can’t help. Help us get the word out and make some noise about the Odyssey Bookshop’s campaign! Use the Indiegogo sharing tools to email your friends, tweet our cause on Twitter, or share our page on Facebook! We appreciate all your support.
story_txt:
We
 are overwhelmed with gratitude to all who have contributed so far.  
We've reached our stated public goal of $10,500 and we are excited about
 the possibility  of reaching our stretch goal, which would allow us to 
make even more  needed improvements.Our new goal is $20,000
 and the additional funding will go to unforeseen costs not in our 
original plan for the campaign. Improvements that the Odyssey Bookshop 
could really benefit from, but weren't a priority until we met our first
 goal. Some of the things we would love to add:  

conversion and training for staff while we upgrade to our new point of sale and inventory system.
other point of sale equipment we may need like scanners, cash drawers, credit card terminals, receipt printers, and displays.
  new hardware and software not included in the original upgrade.  
Who We Are &
What We Need

The
Odyssey Bookshop of South Hadley, MA is a locally owned independent bookshop
committed to offering a quality selection of affordable new, bargain, and gently
read books, as well as gifts and educational items for customers of all ages
and backgrounds. We are passionate about the written word and seek to share our
love of reading to help create and sustain a community of lifelong readers. We
strive to provide a hospitable and nurturing environment to encourage the
healthy exchange of ideas by hosting numerous readings, book groups, and panel
presentations. We are committed to engaging with the many diverse peoples and
organizations of our community, particularly in the Pioneer Valley of Western
Massachusetts, but also on a national and international scale, to work towards
the goals of a knowledgeable public and a peaceful and environmentally
sustainable planet.Please help the Odyssey
continue to provide top-notch customer service through upgraded computer
systems. Our technology—in-store sales system; computer network, and even our
public wireless system—is aging. Much of our hardware is more than ten years
old and we’ve been limping along for some time. It’s time to upgrade and we
need your help!
Here’s what we hope to do:
· 
Purchase and install our first real file server to help
us organize, store and secure our critical information. This will allow us to
work more efficiently, collaborate on projects and improve communications. 
· 
Update and renovate our point-of-sale system. We have
held off upgrading software because our hardware--some in its teenage
years--cannot support the newer system. We need to replace hardware and update
software. This will improve our service, while guarding our customers against
expanding security threats such as identity theft.
· 
Upgrade our internal public wireless systems to make them
faster and more secure. This will improve staff productivity and be a
convenience for our customers. 

What YOU Get
$5—Charlotte’s Web: A
shout-out on the Odyssey’s social media pages telling our over 6,600 followers
just how great you are! Just like when Charlotte announced to the world that
Wilbur was “Radiant!” “Terrific!” and “Some Pig.”
$10—Postcards From the Edge:
A handwritten thank-you note from an Odyssey staff member!
$22—Catch-22: An
original Odyssey tote bag to catch all your favorite books!$30—The Sun Also Rises: A
high quality Odyssey ceramic mug. Use it to drink your morning coffee, or
whatever your favorite beverage might be.
$40—The Rime of the Ancient
Mariner: “Water, water everywhere, but not a drop to drink” is a phrase you
WON’T be saying with this stainless steel Odyssey water bottle! 
$50—The Emperor’s New
Clothes: Dress yourself up with the latest in Odyssey fashion—one of our
signature t-shirts! We have assorted shirts with our logo and your contribution
guarantees a shirt, however we cannot guarantee sizes. If you have a size
preference, please state so in the comments field or direct message us!
T-shirts are first come, first served up to 50. 
$100—Frankenstein: An
“unnatural” combination of the previous perks: tote bag, t-shirt, and a mug or
water bottle. Combination variations are based on availability.
$100—One Hundred Years of
Solitude: Free admission to any one event; includes one book and a spot at
the beginning of the signing line.
$100—Babette’s Feast: Book
Lover’s Sunday Brunch—September 20, 2015—11:00 am
Join us for a gourmet lakeside
brunch with stunning views in a contemporary, light-filled home! Chef Susan
Knightly and friends prepare a farm fresh brunch with vegetarian options, from
local ingredients. The $100 contribution includes a seat for one guest, there
is limited space for 24 guests.
$200—The Great Gatsby: Free admission to any two
events; includes one book at each event and a spot at the beginning of each
signing line.
$250—Empire Falls: Share a meal with
Pulitzer-prize winning author, Richard Russo! Summer of 2016 we’ll host Richard
Russo for his new novel, Everybody’s Fool—a sequel to his acclaimed
novel Nobody’s Fool. We have space for eight lucky contributors to join
him for dinner before the event! Your donation includes your meal, a copy of
Russo’s newest novel, and great conversation with a famous author! The dinner
will take place in the summer of 2016, official date to be announced. 
$400—Beloved: Free admission to any five events;
includes one book at both events and a spot at the beginning of each signing
line.
$1,000—Moby Dick: A one-year membership in our Signed First Editions Club. Each
month you will get a signed first printing of a newly published book. We have a
well-qualified team of readers who select books based on literary quality and
potential collectibility. Each month’s selection will be signed and sent to you
with a protective dust jacket cover. 
Shipping is complimentary
within the United States; any international shipping will carry an additional
charge of $5.00. All perks are fully transferable. Share the gift of the
Odyssey with your friends and loved ones!
The Impact
By contributing to our campaign
you’re giving the Odyssey Bookshop a leg up in the world of bookselling. With
more efficient inventory and point-of-sale systems and newer hardware to run
them on we can compete more effectively with the big box stores and online retailers.

If
you can’t contribute, that doesn’t mean you can’t help. Help us get the word
out and make some noise about the Odyssey Bookshop’s campaign! Use the
Indiegogo sharing tools to email your friends, tweet our cause on Twitter, or
share our page on Facebook! We appreciate all your support.

story:
MEET
GOLDFUSION

THE ABSOLUTE BEST PERFORMING ACTIVEWEAR TO EVER HIT THE MARKET.

Introducing GoldFusion technology by Rhone, a revolutionary application that decreases drying time, increases odor fighting capabilities and adds durability to our already best in class products. GoldFusion begins at the fabric level by infusing premium materials with gold nanoparticles which remain 99% effective after 100 washes, 3x longer than the industry standard. What does this mean for you? Drying times that are 3x faster and anti-odor protection ​for over 100 washes. And yes, it's non toxic and completely environmentally friendly.

WHO'S TALKING
ABOUT RHONE
Our Past Products Are Industry Leaders -
And This New Line Will Be Even Better
 
"Move over Lululemon, Rhone is about to take over
the men's activewear market."
-Forbes Magazine
 
THE BENEFITS
 

GoldFusion is a proprietary application that can be applied to fabrics to enhance its performance attributes. Below are examples of how GoldFusion supercharges performance apparel.

 
BEST IN CLASS
 

Fabric technology applied to custom fabrics to further boost performance
 
LOW BRANDING
 

Sophisticated and low branded approach to be appropriate for any setting.
THE PIECES
 

GoldFusion is applied to three of the industry's best fabrics to create the ultimate performance apparel. Choose which pieces below appeal to you most and shop them in the perks section.

Merino wool is a naturally wicking and anti-odor fabric. Pairing that with performance boosting benefits of GoldFusion technology creates an ultra-quick wicking, anti-odor powerhouse of a shirt that has the feel of a natural fiber and the performance of a synthetic. The Captain Merino Tee leads where others follow. Sold in black and gray.

A brand new performance fabric, the Delta uses your sweat to cool you while magically not weighing you down like cotton. Combined with GoldFusion properties such as anti-odor, this is one of the ultimate pieces for those who sweat heavily or live in hot environments.

Developed specifically for our indiegogo supporters, the Phase is a brand-new, multi-sport short built with power mesh ventilation panels, DWR for water resistance, and a GoldFusion liner that wicks sweat, dries quick, and is anti-odor. We added two side pockets, one with a media pocket to keep your phone safe, and a zippered back pocket. From travel to trails to training, the Phase short is made for what's next. Sold in Black.

Designed after our best-selling Sequoia 1/4 zip pullover, the Sequoia Air 1/4 zip pullover combines style with performance. Delta fabric infused GoldFusion technology creates a 1/4 zip that wicks moisture, fights odor and protects you from the sun. This is the perfect pullover for a Spring or Fall round of golf or to pack away for multi-day travel or hikes.

These days towels go from the gym, to the mat, to the court and back again. The problem is they haven't evolved much from those scratchy, white health club towels of the past. Enter the world's greatest gym towel. Made from a soft and durable blend of bamboo and cotton fibers, this towel can absorb up to three times its weight in water and exhibits natural anti-microbial properties. Plus, we treated it with our patented anti-odor technology so things stay fresh in your gym bag.

365-DAY
SATISFACTION GUARANTEE
 

We've been delivering quality products with return rates well below industry average for 2 years. However, we're so confident in this new technology that we are offering our most flexible return policy ever. For 365-days after shipment, indiegogo backers can return their product(s) for their money back (if it is unworn) or exchange it for any equal valued item on our website if it has been worn. We want your first experience with Rhone to be a great one.

WHAT OUR USERS
HAVE SAID ABOUT US
 

"Love the unique style. Most of all, love how the shirt does not retain any odor." - Sung P.

"I ordered these for my son for Christmas and he is loving the shirts. He had previously been using the Lululemon Silverscent Technology shirts and was quite impressed by Rhone's products during his workouts. The Rhone shirts had no odor after they dried out and have a nice comfortable feel when he works out, so it's safe to say he will be making other orders from Rhone in the future!" - Marcia K.

"I'm a true Rhone believer now!" - Roy C.

HOW IT WORKS
 
1
 
SPHERICAL NANOPARTICLES
 

Perfectly spherical nanoparticles are formed. A Nanometer is one-billionth of one meter. At this scale, nanoparticles exhibit beneficial properties that do not exist at other sizes and are being used in electronics, medicines, and other industries. We're applying this new technology to premium fabrics.
2
 
ECO-SAFE
 

A non-toxic, non-ionic, 100%-stable water based solution is formed from these nanoparticles. The solution is so eco-safe that you can drink it.
3
 
APPLICATION
 

A 100-horsepower compressor "mists" the water based solution onto the fabric before it is cut and sewn, making sure the solution covers the entire garment. This process creates virtually zero emissions and nothing is released into the environment.
4
 
PRODUCTION
 

The fabrics are then transferred to our factory for cutting and sewing and the final product is produced.
DOES IT WORK
 

Nanotechnology is changing the way we live and GoldFusion is the next application of that. GoldFusion is the best performing fabric application on the market. But don't take our word for it, let the guys with PHDs and lab coats show you...

DRY TIMES INCREASE AFTER THE SAME FABRIC IS TREATED BY UP TO 3X

Water has a surface tension, which our technology breaks, making it harder for water to bind to the fabric and easier to be wicked away. The above video shows an example of dry times between GoldFusion treated and untreated.

 
COOLING BENEFIT
 

Tests show that GoldFusion treated fabric dries up to 3x faster than the same non-treated fabric.
 
ODOR FIGHTING
 

Fabric samples were infected then measured at contact time and then again after 24 hours. By the 24 hour mark (even after 100 washes on the fabric), the fabric showed virtually a 100% reduction.
 
ENVIRONMENTALLY FRIENDLY
 

As shown in our lab testing, after 10 washes there was virtually zero emissions. The below graph shows how that compares to the competition.
WHY
 

Most of the clothing brands on the market feign innovation with cool colors, huge logos and cheap venting designs. These technological "advances" are holding you back from performing at your best. GoldFusion ensures that your clothing stands up to the rigors needed to accomplish your fitness and health goals.

In a world of competition, there's no cutting corners. Rhone uses the most innovative materials and advanced technology available. For the GoldFusion launch, Rhone has partnered with PolarTec to further enhance their best-in-class performance fabrics. GoldFusion is applied directly to these fabrics to create performance capabilities never seen before. Each backer will have a choice of which fabric to purchase in the rewards section.

WHAT YOU GET
 

The styles are unique to this campaign and may one day be revered like an old pair of Jordan sneakers. This is the opportune time to get first access to our greatest clothing line to-date at a rare discounted price.

WHAT WE NEED
 

We have industry leading shorts designed, tested and highly reviewed from the past 3 years in business, but now we need to update their technology. This is where you come in. To bring this technology to market and to purchase the machinery needed to treat the clothing we are raising $35,000. Help us get there by pre-ordering some new gear.

TIMELINE
 
OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP - REFERRALS
 
Perhaps you have a friend who is particularly smelly or is in need of some new performance gear. Perhaps you need to drop a not-so-subtle hint to your boyfriend or husband to clean up his act? If so, share this page with him or the world through social media. Help make this world a better smelling and better performing place to live.
MEET THE TEAM
 

Over the past 2+ years we have built a team of 20 committed to making the best quality activewear on the market. From mothers and fathers to recent graduates, our team acts more like family than co-workers. Passionate about our pursuits, critically constructive and endlessly collaborative. Above all, we aim to achieve more together than we ever could apart. The best product requires the best people and that's what we are building.
FAQ
 
1. What are my payment options?

Indiegogo accepts any major credit card or PayPal.

2. Since this is a preorder, when should I expect delivery?

Once we get a handle on demand, we can initiate the purchase orders and begin manufacturing. We expect to deliver your chosen package in April of 2017.

3. What if I want Rhone now?

We currently offer a full line of top-rated gear at Rhone.com. For the duration of this campaign, we’re also happy to offer 10% off our line using the discount code "indiegogo."

4. Do you have a size chart?
5. Can I cancel my order?

You can cancel your order before the indiegogo campaign is over through the indiegogo platform.

6. Are there any notifications for special promotions.

To get access to our promotions, please sign up for our newsletter at the bottom of https://www.rhone.com

7. What are shipping costs?

Shipping is free on orders over $75

8. Is there a return policy?

We are so confident in our GoldFusion product that we are offering the indiegogo community an extension of our normal return policy. For 365-days, you can return the product for your money back (if it is unworn) or exchange it for an equal valued item on our website if it has been worn.

9. Is there an International shipping policy?

We are not currently shipping internationally.

10. How do I track my order?

Tracking information is sent out upon placement of the order.

11. Can I buy a gift card?

Rhone offers a couple of gift cards with the following prices ($50, $100, $150, $200, $250, $500). These can be found here https://www.rhone.com/products/giftcard and cannot be used for the indiegogo campaign.

12. Does Rhone offer a catalogue?

Rhone has seasonal catalogues that are available.

13. Is there clothing for children?

Unfortunately, at this time Rhone does not provide apparel for children.

13. Is there clothing for women?

Unfortunately, at this time Rhone does not provide apparel for women.

14. Is there a store that I can go to for Rhone apparel?

The Rhone product is available in Bloomingdales nationwide. Rhone can also be found in every REI, Paragon sports, Darien Sport Shop, Nordstrom Direct and every Equinox location.

Visit us at Rhone.com

story:
READ OUR PRESS RELEASE IN THE "UPDATES" SECTION:

LOCAL CHICAGO MAN SEEKS $20,000 IN CROWD FUNDING
FOR TAPAS FOOD TRUCK & SOCIAL RESTAURANT START-UP

Chef Javier Haro Brings Tapas-on-Wheels and Jobs to Chicago

 

 

Pay $15 Online or At The Door

FREE Event Registration: http://bythehorns.getshortlist.com/

 

PAY IT FORWARD

 If You Can't Contribute or Attend the Event. Forward Link to At Least 10 Friends  www.indiegogo.com/crowdfunding

 

Special Thanks to SHORTLIST for being a proud sponsor. http://getshortlist.com/ 

               

 

My Story

 

My name is Javier Haro and this is my campaign and entrepreneurial vision is to raise startup capital for Ba Ba Bulli & SocialMediaRestaurants.com

 

You might be asking why Crowdfunding two businesses? It’s simple. Our local economy needs it and lending institutions don’t’ want to take a chance on start-ups, who ironically are the job creators of our country! I have decided to “Take the Recession by the Horns” and stimulate the local economy and create jobs. As a tapas aficionado, entrepreneur, and social media junkie I saw many new exciting opportunities in social media and the technology space for the restaurant community here in Chicago. Closing my restaurant HARO in 2008 and struggling to find a job, I had to reinvent myself. I decided to create my own job and a few others to help my fellow struggling Chicagoans!

 

Ba Ba Bulli will be one of the first Spanish/Mexican mobile food truck that I would consider the better part of what is known as the peaceful  “The Third Revolution”( www.madridfusionmex.com ). Spain and Mexico coming together to share and contribute to tourism and new culinary innovations and art that began in 2010 to celebrate the fusion of pre-Hispanic and Spanish cuisines that gave rise to Mexican food.  As a Spanish tapas aficionado for the past 5 years and of Mexican descent, this new revolution was one that I wanted to participate in!  The name Ba Ba Bulli was inspired by forward-thinker Feran Adria better known as “El Bulli” ( www.elBulli.com ), the “Running of the Bulls” or encierro in Pamplona, Spain  and over drinking a nice glass of vintage tempranillo wine with the label “Ba Ba Bulle” a few years back.  I was also motivated by the twitter social media success of west coast food truck KOGI ( www.kogibbq.com ) and their Korean fusion Mexican tacos. This lead to my culinary creation of the first the Spanish fusion Mexican “Bullrrito”. Other culinary contributions to the food truck will be to incorporate charcuterie, artisan cheeses, variety of chillie pepper salsas, and for the first time in Chicago artisan Galician seafood!

 

 

My second business is SocialMediaRestaurants.com. The vision is to be the leader in sales and social intelligence of over 300,000 independent restaurant operators. Our Social CRM and proprietary technology will help new and existing companies to increase sales productivity, brand awareness, and velocity for companies looking to advertise or sell their product or services to the decision makers in the restaurant market. I’ve been very fortunate to have conversations and peak the interest of some great companies such as Groupon, Yelp, OpenTable, GrubHub, SproutSocial, and many others. In a day of new technology and social networks SocialMediaRestaurants.com will close the gap by bridging the tech space with the restaurant industry.  

 

Where You Come In

As we all know cash flow is tight when starting a new business.  Our current economy makes acquiring startup capital even more difficult if not impossible.  Using my savings I have already paid for deposits on the truck, creating video, logo and website fees, virtual office, laptops, and interns.  The 20,000 will be broken down as follow

Ba Ba Bulli

Payoff of Food Truck         4,500

Truck Wrap                         2,000

Legal                                   1, 000

Equipment/Supplies          2,000

Permits/License                     600

Insurance                             2,400

 

Est.Total:                           12, 500

 

SocialMediaRestaurants.com

 

Virtual Office (ITA)                1200

Interns/Freelancers               1000

Consulting Fees                    5300

 

Est. Total                                7500

 

Total :                                    20,000

 

The Impact

Your financial assistance will help me tremendously in the following ways:

 

Ba Ba Bulli

1.     Launch Ba Ba Bulli mobile truck and catering services

2.     Marketing and social media campaigns

3.     Create 3-6 new jobs

4.     Become new clients to over half a dozen food industry vendors & suppliers

 

SocialMediaRestaurants.com

5.     Consult with IT programmers, information systems

6.     Pay for office space (Illinois Technology Association)

7.     Stipend interns

8.     Hire Project Freelancers

9.     Develop Research and Development team

10.Position for Venture Capitalist and Angel Investors

 

Other Ways You can Help

If you can’t support us financially, you can help us get the word out to your family and friends on your social networks such as Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn.

 

You can also send your boss or co-workers an email or tell a business in your local community help support the campaign.

 

As entrepreneurs we have a pledge to help each other as entrepreneurs.     www.buildastrongeramerica.com
story_txt:
READ OUR PRESS RELEASE IN THE "UPDATES" SECTION:
LOCAL CHICAGO MAN SEEKS $20,000 IN CROWD FUNDING FOR TAPAS FOOD TRUCK & SOCIAL RESTAURANT START-UP
Chef Javier Haro Brings Tapas-on-Wheels and Jobs to Chicago
 
 
Pay $15 Online or At The Door 
FREE Event Registration: http://bythehorns.getshortlist.com/
 
PAY IT FORWARD
 If You Can't Contribute or Attend the Event. Forward Link to At Least 10 Friends  www.indiegogo.com/crowdfunding 
 

Special Thanks to SHORTLIST for being a proud sponsor. http://getshortlist.com/ 
               
 
My Story
 
My name is Javier Haro and this is my campaign and entrepreneurial vision is to raise startup capital for Ba Ba Bulli & SocialMediaRestaurants.com 
 
You might be asking why Crowdfunding two businesses? It’s simple. Our local economy needs it and lending institutions don’t’ want to take a chance on start-ups, who ironically are the job creators of our country! I have decided to “Take the Recession by the Horns” and stimulate the local economy and create jobs. As a tapas aficionado, entrepreneur, and social media junkie I saw many new exciting opportunities in social media and the technology space for the restaurant community here in Chicago. Closing my restaurant HARO in 2008 and struggling to find a job, I had to reinvent myself. I decided to create my own job and a few others to help my fellow struggling Chicagoans! 
 
Ba Ba Bulli will be one of the first Spanish/Mexican mobile food truck that I would consider the better part of what is known as the peaceful  “The Third Revolution”( www.madridfusionmex.com ). Spain and Mexico coming together to share and contribute to tourism and new culinary innovations and art that began in 2010 to celebrate the fusion of pre-Hispanic and Spanish cuisines that gave rise to Mexican food.  As a Spanish tapas aficionado for the past 5 years and of Mexican descent, this new revolution was one that I wanted to participate in!  The name Ba Ba Bulli was inspired by forward-thinker Feran Adria better known as “El Bulli” ( www.elBulli.com ), the “Running of the Bulls” or encierro in Pamplona, Spain  and over drinking a nice glass of vintage tempranillo wine with the label “Ba Ba Bulle” a few years back.  I was also motivated by the twitter social media success of west coast food truck KOGI ( www.kogibbq.com ) and their Korean fusion Mexican tacos. This lead to my culinary creation of the first the Spanish fusion Mexican “Bullrrito”. Other culinary contributions to the food truck will be to incorporate charcuterie, artisan cheeses, variety of chillie pepper salsas, and for the first time in Chicago artisan Galician seafood! 
 
 
My second business is SocialMediaRestaurants.com. The vision is to be the leader in sales and social intelligence of over 300,000 independent restaurant operators. Our Social CRM and proprietary technology will help new and existing companies to increase sales productivity, brand awareness, and velocity for companies looking to advertise or sell their product or services to the decision makers in the restaurant market. I’ve been very fortunate to have conversations and peak the interest of some great companies such as Groupon, Yelp, OpenTable, GrubHub, SproutSocial, and many others. In a day of new technology and social networks SocialMediaRestaurants.com will close the gap by bridging the tech space with the restaurant industry.  
 
Where You Come In
As we all know cash flow is tight when starting a new business.  Our current economy makes acquiring startup capital even more difficult if not impossible.  Using my savings I have already paid for deposits on the truck, creating video, logo and website fees, virtual office, laptops, and interns.  The 20,000 will be broken down as follow
Ba Ba Bulli
Payoff of Food Truck         4,500
Truck Wrap                         2,000
Legal                                   1, 000
Equipment/Supplies          2,000
Permits/License                     600
Insurance                             2,400
 
Est.Total:                           12, 500
 
SocialMediaRestaurants.com
 
Virtual Office (ITA)                1200
Interns/Freelancers               1000
Consulting Fees                    5300
 
Est. Total                                7500
 
Total :                                    20,000
 
The Impact
Your financial assistance will help me tremendously in the following ways:
 
Ba Ba Bulli
1.     Launch Ba Ba Bulli mobile truck and catering services
2.     Marketing and social media campaigns
3.     Create 3-6 new jobs
4.     Become new clients to over half a dozen food industry vendors & suppliers
 
SocialMediaRestaurants.com

6.     Pay for office space (Illinois Technology Association)
7.     Stipend interns 
8.     Hire Project Freelancers
9.     Develop Research and Development team

You can also send your boss or co-workers an email or tell a business in your local community help support the campaign. 
 
As entrepreneurs we have a pledge to help each other as entrepreneurs.     www.buildastrongeramerica.com

story:
Our Story

We are a group of students and teachers dedicated to helping children with autism and other special needs in Tanzania, Africa. In 2008 Dr. Marilyn Kaff, a special education professor from Kansas State University, went on her first trip to Tanzania. Her goal was to help improve special education and teacher training at the Sebastion Kolowa University College. During that time she traveled to a number of villages and small communities where schools were being set up to help youth with severe disabilities including autism. What she discovered there inspired her to give of her time and talents. But her trip was limited, and she knew she needed to come back. Since that time she has returned each year with teams of volunteer students from Kansas State University to help identify autistic children, and then to train the local teachers and parents how to teach them. 


Our fundraising goals are two fold. This year we will have 8 new student volunteers coming with us. We want to help them raise some of the funds needed to get to Tanzania. Total trip costs are around $4000 per person. If enough funds are raised, we anticipate offering partial scholarships to help each volunteer get to Tanzania. Our other fundraising goal is start a new series of Sustainability Projects. Please see the Impact section below for details. All told the funds will help us to make a substantial difference in the lives of these children and their families. Funds will be split  between helping volunteers get to Tanzania, and starting Sustainability Projects.


The Impact

1) Specialized Service: All of the volunteers are students and faculty with education, psychology, or occupational therapy backgrounds. The more people we can send to Tanzania each year the more training and one on one aid we can give. This training has a multiplier effect. Not only will the volunteers work with dozens of children directly, but they will also have a chance to train teachers and parents who can then use these specialized skills to help the lives of the children in Tanzania. The schools we will be working with this year serve dozens of students with autism or other severe cognitive/ physical impairments. 


2) Sustainability Projects: Each year that Dr. Kaff has traveled to Tanzania with her volunteers they have purchased and donated hundreds of dollars of teaching supplies. This has always come out of their own personal funds. This year we want to do more than just bring supplies. We want to improve the lives of students and their families. Here's what we have planned:


a. Repairing two existing schools:

Two small school buildings in Lushoto, Tanzania need roofs repaired and windows replaced. They also need to have extensive work done to replace the outdoor latrines. Estimated costs are between $2500- $3000 to do all this. Local contractors will be hired to do the work, benefiting the local economy.


b. Creating a Literacy Foundation

Reading materials and supplies are limited and out of touch for most of the schools. As Dr. Kaff puts it, "People are taught to read words, but not to understand the meaning of what they read." That's because there are no books native to their culture or relevant to their country. 

We want to work with the local community and artisans in the area to help create a series of books and stories that students can read and listen to. This year we will be accompanied by a video producer from Kansas State University who will be helping us record their stories so that they can be used to create audio/ visual/ and print media. This will not only benefit the children and local communities, but will become an incredible living history for Tanzanians (think StoryCorps). This will be a monumental project, but one that we believe will benefit the community and country. 


c. Community Gardens

We want to help the local schools and Lushoto community set up a garden that would give the children and families a source of fresh food, work, and sustainable income. The involvement of local community leaders and schools will be pivotal to making this a long lasting success, but we feel with the right resources we can set the groundwork for an amazing community building project.


What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise $25,000 for this campaign. We know there are many other charitable ways you could be spending your money right now, but here is what makes our campaign stand out. We have been to Tanzania 4 times! We are not starting something totally new. We are adding to the great service that is already in place. We have already built the framework to pick up each year and add more of our support to people who really need it. In the words of one of our volunteers, "...people should get involved in this project, because we have planted a seed, and we just need help making it grow. So far, Dr. Kaff and her student volunteers have been able to teach and train dozens of teachers from Sebastian Kolowa University College in Tanzania, as well work one on one with many many students with autism and other special needs. Imagine the help they could give with these added sustainability projects.

Funds raised will be used to start our Sustainability Projects this summer, as well as provide partial scholarships to help our volunteers get to Tanzania. 

THE PERKS!

This is how we say thank you for your support. You are welcome to give anonymously, but we encourage you to keep your perks as a keep sake of all the good you are doing for the children in Tanzania.


PERK 1

$15  Limited Edition PostCard


PERK 2

$35 Hand made necklace from Tanzania.


PERK 3

$35 Documentary DVD "Stories from Tanzania"


PERK 4

$50 "Humanity Looks Good on You" T-shirt (plus a limited edition postcard)


PERK 5

$100 Get them all! (T-shirt, Documentary DVD, hand-made necklace, postcard)


PERK 5

$250 Movie Credit (You or your business will be credited in our documentary)


PERK 5

$500 Friends for LIFE (Every PERK mentioned above plus a lot of love)



Other Ways You Can Help

Donations of any size will help, but if you can't give funds, please give us a boost with a little bit of your online presence. Like this video and share it with your friends. Please pass the word onto your family and friends via Facebook and twitter about our campaign.

story:
Our Story


What's your passion? Mine?...food! Natural, clean, and delicious. Supper Sack is a combined meal planning and grocery delivery service.

Supper Sack plans your meals a week at a time, gathering hand selected ingredients from the best providers, and delivering them with accompanying recipes to your door. Our focus is on delivering organic, local and traceable products.


This brilliant new concept of merging the meal planning and grocery delivery service has become a huge success in my home country of Sweden, starting with a single company in 2007. Now there are close to 30 companies in Sweden that help Swedes cook well-balanced, tasty, fun weeknight meals. 


How it all started...

My husband, Erik, and I lived in Stockholm, Sweden between 2007-2009. During that time the first meal planning/grocery delivery service had started with this new concept. I had heard about it and had a few co-workers at a previous job that did try it and really liked it. I loved the idea, but didn't think much more about it. One day back in LA while on Facebook, I saw an old friend who wrote:

"I'm so excited, our first bag is coming on Monday!" 


"The bag" consists of ingredients for weeknight dinners with accompanied recipes. 


That's when it hit me... LA... 


I guess my interest in food started early as I did attend a culinary arts program in college. After college my career took of in many different directions, little to do with food. I have always been called a "foodie" and want every meal to be important. With today's rapid, hand held scheduling, it seems like dinner is one of the few times families have together. So let's all enjoy some family time and have dinner...er I mean supper!


So forget about the dreadful feeling of that weeknight question of 'what's for dinner?'. I know. After working all day the last thing you want to do is to come up with what to have for dinner, go to the store, decide between healthy or quick and easy. Right? It's so easy to just pick something up from a restaurant or buying some processed already cooked food... Not anymore! Now you can forget about all of that! Supper Sack will plan and buy all ingredients needed and deliver to you with yummy recipes, every week, every other week or as often as you like. You choose between a delivery that includes ingredients and recipes for 5 suppers for 4 people or 3 suppers for 4 people.


The Impact

Behind Supper Sack is a spirit of revival. Supper used to be such an important time of day and food meant so much more to us than it does for the average busy family now. I like helping people get back to enjoying the traditional evening supper, and I like supporting all the small food producers who are so dedicated to making good food!


For the last year I have spent all my free time outside of a full time job i.e. evenings, nights, and weekends getting Supper Sack ready to launch. I've been working on the concept, forming the business, creating and testing recipes (some great, some a little so-so), researching about farmers, ranches, additives and much more.


Supper Sack's website www.suppersack.com, facebook  and twitter is now up and running and it's time for me to get the word out about this new brilliant concept that can help American families make supper time special again!


To get the word out about this new brilliant concept I need to market, market, market. As we know, start-up and marketing requires funding. 


What We Need & What You Get

Marketing strategy

As with most new businesses the word needs to be spread. Since Supper Sack also is a fairly new concept it is extra important to reach out to as many as possible and inform about this new service.

My initial idea for marketing is to use internet sources. Facebook, Twitter, Google+. Also there is an entire world of food blogs, food swaps here in LA, farmer's markets. Mommy blogs are huge now. I also want to do  actual handout marketing so that I can be out face-to-face and connect with my new customers.

I am doing this campaign to create more marketing material as well as covering some of the start-up costs. 

This is what I have in mind for marketing material:

Ads - blogs, facebook, google

Supper Sack discount - would like to offer a discount of 20% to all customers who orders their first sack in December 2011 or January 2012.

Give away "Sack" - I'm thinking it would be good to give a sack containing 3 or 5 meals to a blogger, writer on a magazine etc. so they can try it and hopefully write a soaring review!

Store front posters - to use in neighborhoods that Supper Sack is serving in

Flyers/post card size - already did a design for post cards and ordered 100 of them. I have them on file and need to order more!

Bags - paper bags for delivery are done, but I would like to order reusable tote bags with the Supper Sack logo that I can hand out for marketing purposes.

T-shirt - marketing clothing for me

Car Magnets - already have one set, but would like a set for my husbands car ;) (he's an musician...wish me luck)

Give aways -thinking of stuff like maybe a paper binder to keep all Supper Sack recipes in? Fun, useful kitchen tools...

Funding = more time... ;)

To cover a big chunk of these costs I am setting my fundraising goal to $5,500. Fingers crossed!


By donating to the Supper Sack campaign YOU will actually be part of the revolution of bringing supper back!


Other Ways You Can Help

Please tell everybody you know or even people you don't know about Supper Sack!

story:
Celebrate Mother's Day by walking with women, for women!

May 7th, 10am-12pm
Dolores Park
9k - 9 laps - one lap for each full decade women have had the right to vote

Our Story

Can you believe that…

  • 100 years ago, women did not have the right to vote.

  • 50 years ago, it was legal to pay women less than men based on their gender alone.

  • Today, women earn 77 cents to each dollar earned by men. African American women earn 68 cents to the dollar, and Latina women earn 58 cents to the dollar.

 

Founded in 1971, the Women’s Building serves as a symbol of women's empowerment and a reminder that our work for equality is not over.

 

The Women’s Building is a woman owned and operated community center located in San Francisco’s dynamic Mission District. We promote the wellbeing of women and girls by working for social justice while simultaneously offering opportunities for individuals to improve their economic security, personal wellbeing, and connection to a broader community that is working for change.

 

We have just finished a strategic plan, developed collaboratively between our board and staff. One of our primary goals is to integrate social justice goals more deeply and pervasively into all our programming – but we need your help!

 

The Women’s Building Board is sponsoring this walk-a-thon to raise funds to support the buildings’ ability to make our strategic plan a reality. We believe that achieving our goals will make a meaningful difference in the community. Come build a better future for women, one step at a time.

 

The Impact

The Women’s Building welcomes over 10,000 visitors each year. The money raised through this walk-a-thon goes directly to support critical programming at the Women’s Building, including cutting-edge ESL classes, free tax prep and an immigrant food pantry. Funds raised here will support us in our goal: to integrate social justice goals more deeply and pervasively into all our programming, providing all participants clear opportunities to engage in social change work themselves.

 

The Women’s Building is uniquely positioned both to support marginalized communities in advocating for themselves and to connect women of all backgrounds through shared experiences. We are a safe space for women to learn, grow, take leadership, and support their community. We are a symbol of women’s empowerment and a reminder that our fight for equality is not over.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $5,500 by June 30th to support the implementation of our strategic plan; the walk-a-thon is one of our fundraising events to meet that goal. All funds go directly to programming and building maintenance to keep our space thriving. If we don’t raise these funds, we will have to postpone the implementation of our plan, resulting in less effective support of the thousands of individual women and 10 women-focused organizations who comprise our immediate community.

 

  • With a donation of $25, you get our smiles and great thankfulness for your generosity

  • With a donation of $50, you receive a beautiful women artisan-made guatemalan craft—purse, cap, scarf – your choice! ($8-15 value)
  • With a donation of $100 or more, you receive the above items and a book detailing the symbols and historical significance of our MaestraPeace mural that wraps around our whole building! ($30 value)
  • With a donation of $150 or more, you receive the above items and a Women’s Building T-shirt! ($50 value)

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • GET YOUR WALK ON

    • Walk with us! Donate $25+ here, and email our walk-a-thon coordinator Linnea Kennedy to rsvp at linneakennedy@gmail.com 
    • Get your friends to donate and walk with you! There’s nothing better than women walking together for women. Share the love!

  • SPREAD THE WORD

    • Bring your mom to the walk-a-thon for Mothers’ day!

    • Email your friends and family about the walk-a-thon

    • Post a link to our fundraising site: www.indiegogo.com/Walk-for-Women on your facebook page.

    • “Like” The Women’s Building on facebook

    • Write about the Women’s Building Walk-a-thon on your blog or submit our story to other “Feel good” sites or news outlets.

    • Post a comment here to encourage us!
story_txt:
Celebrate Mother's Day by walking with women, for women!
May 7th, 10am-12pm
Dolores Park
9k - 9 laps - one lap for each full decade women have had the right to vote
Our
Story

Can
you believe that…

100 years ago, women did not have
     the right to vote.
50 years ago, it was legal to pay
     women less than men based on their gender alone.
Today, women earn 77 cents to each
     dollar earned by men. African American women earn 68 cents to the dollar,
     and Latina women earn 58 cents to the dollar.

 
Founded in 1971,
the Women’s Building serves as a symbol of women's empowerment and a reminder
that our work for equality is not over.
 
The Women’s
Building is a woman owned and operated community center located in San
Francisco’s dynamic Mission District. We promote
the wellbeing of women and girls by working for social justice while
simultaneously offering opportunities for individuals to improve their economic
security, personal wellbeing, and connection to a broader community that is working
for change. 
 
We have just
finished a strategic plan, developed collaboratively between our board and staff. One
of our primary goals is to integrate social justice goals more deeply and
pervasively into all our programming – but we need your help!
 
The Women’s
Building Board is sponsoring this walk-a-thon to raise funds to support the
buildings’ ability to make our strategic plan a reality. We believe that
achieving our goals will make a meaningful difference in the community. Come build a
better future for women, one step at a time.
 
The
Impact
The Women’s
Building welcomes over 10,000 visitors each year. The
money raised through this walk-a-thon goes directly to support critical
programming at the Women’s Building, including cutting-edge ESL classes, free
tax prep and an immigrant food pantry. Funds raised here will support us in
our goal: to integrate social justice goals more deeply and pervasively
into all our programming, providing all participants clear opportunities to
engage in social change work themselves.
 
The Women’s
Building is uniquely positioned both to support marginalized communities in
advocating for themselves and to connect women of all backgrounds through
shared experiences. We are a safe space for women to learn, grow, take
leadership, and support their community. We are a symbol of women’s
empowerment and a reminder that our fight for equality is not over. 
 
What
We Need & What You Get
We
need to raise $5,500 by June 30th to support the implementation of
our strategic plan; the walk-a-thon is one of our fundraising events to meet that goal. All funds go directly to programming and building
maintenance to keep our space thriving. If we don’t raise these funds, we will
have to postpone the implementation of our plan, resulting in less effective
support of the thousands of individual women and 10 women-focused organizations
who comprise our immediate community.
 

With
a donation of $25, you get our smiles and great thankfulness for your generosity



With
a donation of $50, you receive a beautiful women artisan-made guatemalan craft—purse,
cap, scarf – your choice! ($8-15 value)
With
a donation of $100 or more, you receive the above items and a book detailing
the symbols and historical significance of our MaestraPeace mural that wraps
around our whole building! ($30 value)

With
a donation of $150 or more, you receive the above items and a Women’s Building
T-shirt! ($50 value)



 
Other
Ways You Can Help

GET YOUR WALK ON


Walk with us! Donate $25+
      here, and email our walk-a-thon coordinator Linnea Kennedy to rsvp at linneakennedy@gmail.com 

Get your friends to donate
      and walk with you! There’s nothing better than women walking together for
      women. Share the love!

SPREAD THE WORD

Bring your mom to the
      walk-a-thon for Mothers’ day!
Email your friends and
      family about the walk-a-thon

Post a link to our
      fundraising site: www.indiegogo.com/Walk-for-Women on your facebook page. 

“Like” The Women’s Building
      on facebook
Write about the Women’s
      Building Walk-a-thon on your blog or submit our story to other “Feel good”
      sites or news outlets. 
Post a comment here to
      encourage us!

story:
Ugly is Beautiful!

Across the country, ugly produce (or as we like to say, “cosmetically-challenged produce”) is being treated like a second-class citizen.  Every year six billion pounds of fruits and vegetables go to waste on farms across the U.S. just for looking a little different from other produce.  Instead of going to feed people, all that wasted produce is sitting in landfills, where it releases methane gas into the atmosphere.

We think it’s ridiculous that so much delicious produce is going to waste, and so we are setting out to change that.  We’re launching a new venture called Imperfect that gives consumers the chance to buy delicious, wonky-looking produce at a discount.  So instead of going to waste, all those odd-looking fruits and vegetables will be helping Americans eat healthier, at a price they can afford. 

Farmers benefit because they get extra income from produce that previously went to waste.  As a customer, you benefit by getting produce at a much lower cost than you could at a grocery store.  And the environment benefits because of reduced methane emissions.  And in light of the on-going drought in California, we're also proud that every pound of produce we sell prevents the 25-50 gallons of water it takes to grow a pound of produce from being wasted.  

Who We Are

Imperfect is the latest venture launched by Ben Simon and Ben Chesler.  We’ve been passionate about food waste for a long time, always with the same goal in mind:  Keep food from being wasted, and provide it to people instead.

It all started when we launched the Food Recovery Network in 2011 to recover leftover food from campus dining halls.  700,000 pounds of food and 127 colleges later, and we’re moving on to attack food waste at the source.

We’ve teamed up on this project with Ron Clark, who has worked for the California food banks for the last 15 years sourcing ugly produce.  Together, our team has over 25 years of experience fighting food waste, and we’ve been recognized by MTV, NPR, the New York Times, and Forbes 30 Under 30 for our work.

What We Are Doing

Think that what we're doing sounds pretty simple?  Well, that’s because it is!  We work with farmers in California to source their funny-looking produce at discounted prices. We then pass those savings on to consumers, giving you a chance to get quality produce delivered to your door for 30% less than at a grocery store.

When you sign up for our service, you get a box of 10-15 pounds of assorted, seasonal Imperfect-brand produce every week.  Carrots, broccoli, potatoes, plums, onions, oranges – you name it, we've got it!

We’re launching our service in Oakland and Berkeley this summer, so you can start getting affordable fruits and vegetables soon.

What We Need & How You Can Help

We want to provide ugly produce to people in the East Bay (and eventually, all over the country), and with your help, we can be one of the first socially-conscious and environmentally-friendly produce companies in the US.  Even though the concept is simple, we still need some basic infrastructure to make this happen.  The money you donate goes to leasing a refrigerated warehouse to store the produce, and providing the salaries for a delivery and sales team to get the word out and bring you your produce!

As for incentives, we wanted you, the donors, to be the first to taste the beauty of Imperfect-brand produce.  So for those of you in the Bay Area, we have a bunch of cool rewards like 6 months of free produce, and even a dinner party catered by a professional chef showcasing ugly produce.  For our friends and supporters across the country, you can get awesome Imperfect swag to show off to your friends, or even a signed book by our good friend Jonathan Bloom.  


Spread the Word!

Imperfect will be one of the first chances for people on the West Coast to buy ugly, delicious produce.  By spreading the word, you can help us launch and grow our business and bring ugly produce to as many people as possible!

You can Tweet at our project @imperfectfruit #uglyisbeautiful

You can like us on Facebook

And check out our website to stay up-to-date on our plans!

And find some sweet pics of ugly produce on our Instagram @imperfectproduce

Don't forget, you can also use the share tools provided by Indiegogo to help us out as well.

Imperfect Foods, SPC is a social-purpose business and not a non-profit, so unfortunately gifts made are not tax-deductible. 


Note:  Imperfect was selected by the Social Innovation Initiative at Brown University for the Embark Post-Graduate Fellowship, which creates support structures for young entrepreneurs, helps their ventures gain traction, and builds a connected alumni community to support Embark Fellows.

story:
WHAT IS WOUWI ?

Anyone with a pet will answer exactly the same anywhere in the world: he or she is part of our family . No matter who you are, where you live, your race, religion or culture: your pet is part of you, your day, your good times, your habits, your laughter or your bad moments. Your pet is who greets you, listens to you, plays with you and sits next to you.

That is why pets form part of our family. We rejoice when pets are well, enjoyed their company, get angry if they misbehave , we care when they get sick or are sad ... and we are proud of their achievements or just how beautiful they look when we go out for a walk .

Wouwi was created for this reason, with the aim of creating the World’s First Social Network for Pets.

Wouwi is a social network for pets, where your pet is the true center of attention. Create your pet’s profile, upload updates, shares what he or she likes, hobbies, race, age, ..., etc.

Wouwi is an app that allows you to find pets close to you, create groups to go out with, with common interests, common schedules, to ask questions regarding pet food, care ...

Meet pets around the world with whom you can create bonds of friendship, information channels, culture and experiences, and on how pets similar to yours live in other parts of the world.

Make your pet be known internationally!

Wouwi is a "global communications app" which allows you to create and upload pictures, memes, comments, and see how the number of friends grow daily.



WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP ?

Wouwi is already a reality since February 2014. It is a free app that you can download for both Android and iOS . You can help us by downloading the application and registering your pet. You can also talk to your family and friends about Wouwi to start making friends with pets that are near you, as well as other pets in distant places in all countries .

Finally, you can become a supporter to Wouwi and help with your contribution. The funds raised through this campaign will be used to increase marketing activities for Wouwi worldwide, as well as to implement and develop future enhancements and features of the app. We have great ideas to make Wouwi a real and visible face of our beloved pets. In gratitude to you, we have prepared "great perks" for our supporters .


THE APP

Wouwi is designed to be fun and easy app to handle. Still, all your suggestions are welcomed. After many months of work, we founded our company, Terapps, to realize our dream.

We started with beta testing in October 2013 and launched in March 2014. These have been months full of meetings, ideas, contributions and efforts ... and we want to continue doing so!!

1)  Create a profile for your pet



2)  Add a photo to present and tell others bout your pet discuss how (race , character, ..., etc )

3)  Locate other pets close to you ... or look for friends around the world






4)  Request to be friends with other pets according to your preferences

5)  Give affection to those who you think are sweet, friendly or tender

6)  Receive messages from those who want to follow you, hear from you or give you affection

7)  Write comments on photos of your friends or their activities

8)  Update with your activities , ask the others ... interacts with other pets , upload photos of your pet’s day to day activities


9)  You can turn your pet into an expert or advise on services and activities near you

10)  Enjoy Wouwi a much as your pet will!!



WOUWI FOR BUSINESS

In addition to the Wouwi app, we are working on an e-commerce platform to use to benefit our "audience".

This platform is designed in two different phases over time:

-  In June 2015 an e -commerce will open to offer local specific items fir pets

-  In a second phase, users will be able to purchase pet items from Wouwi pet globally, with a special emphasis on items used in certain regions that may be of interest (specific pet food that is not manufactured elsewhere, coats or rare toys for our pets, ... etc). We are currently working on launching a future Wouwi necklace whose main characteristic is to obtain an accurate location information of your pet, in case your pet is lost, which will work in conjunction with the app.

We also want to create the Wouwi Club which will be operational on September 1, 2015. It will be a place where we can feel participants of a large worldwide group and in which our pets will benefit from competitions, exclusive photos, gifts, ..., etc. Each pet will have the opportunity to gain points that will be exchanged for Wouwi products through the e- commerce platform .


WOUWI APP FEATURES

The Wouwi app is already up and running for both Android and iOS . You can download the App from the Apple Store and Google Play.

Current:

- Register your pet and create a profile

- Check other pets that are near you or in more remote regions

- Become a follower and friend of other pets, sending tender messages

- send funny pictures to other pets

Our idea is to improve the app quickly, introducing more features and functionalities:

- Adding filters for better service to our users

- Announcement boards

- In memoriam : Virtual Cemetery for all to see and remember your pet

- Insertion of geopositioning information for services (veterinary, pet hotels , ... etc)

- Functionality to send videos in social network

- Creating joint photo albums for pets that are geographically separated

... And much more !!!!!

story:
We would like to thank everyone who is not indifferent to our project.

Below you will find more information about our team, our aim and the reason we ask you for donations.

Who we are?
We are a group of people, born in Ukraine and currently living here. It has happened that way our country goes through hard times now: exhausting war in the Eastern Ukraine, economic recession, stagnation of business, being close to default.
All these occurrences stated above influence both the daily life of people and diverse spheres, industries and fields of activities. Particularly we are concerned about the current state of our medicine, which facilities and resources are very poor, and this is the case of human lives!
Our team has a strong belief that if someone finds even a smallest way to help and make things different, he should definitely use this possibility. Our aim is to raise funds for reanimobile purchase.

What is reanimobile and Why?
Reanimobile is a type of ambulance car, but much more better equipped.  Due to its technical characteristics reanimobile gives doctors an opportunity to provide urgent medical assistance in case of life-threatening situations that require immediate medical interventions. This means the essential help to the injured is provided already during the transportation to hospital. It is estimated one reanimobile can save 250-300 lives a year.

The aim of this campaign is to buy a modern reanimobile with the following equipment:
- Deffibrilator.
- Artificial lung ventilation and oxygen therapy system.
- Electrocardiography machine.
- Infusion pump.
- Wheel litter.
- Chair for the transportation of the patient in the sitting position.

Please follow the link to see the prototype of the reanimobile we would like to buy:
http://suchen.mobile.de/lkw-inserat/mercedes-benz-sprinter-316-cdi-rtw-klima-euro5-halle-saale/206031364.html?lang=en&pageNumber=1&__lp=4&scopeId=VUT75&sortOption.sortBy=searchNetGrossPrice&makeModelVariant1.searchInFreetext=false&makeModelVariant2.searchInFreetext=false&makeModelVariant3.searchInFreetext=false&vehicleCategory=VanUpTo7500&segment=Truck&minFirstRegistrationDate=2011-01-01&negativeFeatures=EXPORT&grossPrice=false&category=AmbulanceVan&noec=1
We suppose to buy fully equipped car, otherwise equipment will be bought separately.

How and How Much to donate?
To make a donation please click the button below “Contribute now”.
The amount of donation is always up to you: 1, 5, 10 or 100$ it doesn’t matter.
Every donation is a big step towards our common goal.

Profitability and result.
This campaign is non-profit and raises funds for the reanimobile purchase.

In case the required amount isn’t raised in terms of the current campaign, the identic campaign will be created, and all the donations will be transferred on the account of the new campaign until we reach the necessary budget.

The reanimobile will be preferably conveyed to the volunteers operating in the ATO zone.
All the donators will be provided with photo-report of the reanimobile conveyance ceremony.

story:
Francie is an exceptionally thoughtful, generous and wonderful human and we would love to be able to give her something really decent back that she'll benefit from for a long time to come.

It's her birthday on 31st july and we've set this page up to try and unite Francie's friends n fam, so you can contribute as much or as little as you like towards an awesome birthday present... We are aiming to put £500 towards driving lessons and anything over will be put towards a car/insurance.

Let's give our little Don a coming of age to remember!!

Big big love

XxxxxxxXxxxxxXxxxxX

story:
~5/27: LAST DAY FOR CONTRIBUTIONS!~

HAPPY MEMORIAL DAY! What a day to end a campaign... It WOULD be cooler if there was a substantial amount to work with at this point, but I am not going to let it deter me from my dreams!

On that note, I'd like to announce that I am definitely going to open another campaign in the near future!

I plan to take a couple weeks to deliberate with the opinions of some trusted friends and family. Doing everything completely alone this first time around strengthened the perspective that I can do anything by myself as long as I make sure to stay true to my heart.

Enlisting the support of people who have successful businesses and lives will greatly assist me in deciding what to change in order to run my second campaign more successfully...

When one door closes, another always opens!

Thank you:

1 female who gave a 50$ “donation”

1 male who exchanged $20 for an Intuitive Massage Service

Both people who helped out elected to be anonymous, but they deserve a shout out, nonetheless!

Please feel free to get ahold of me through the links here, if you feel like helping me with my new campaign!

 

~HELLO ALL YOU LOVELY PEOPLE~

I’m Melyssa Leigh-Skwarek Stroh, AKA "Mel", AKA The Queen of Ginger and Honey hailing from Grand Rapids, Michigan... I currently live between my mom, Sherry and dad, Dan's houses, with my bed along with my daughter Lily (6), and my brother, Casey (25) at my mom's.

I’m a 31 year old loving mama, daughter, sister, friend, truth seeker and peer; a budding entrepreneur and philanthropist; a performer, writer and artist; a fire walker, energy healer, and random act of a singer; a yoga student/teacher, foodie and all around modern-day-sacred-feminine eco-muse! (And that’s the short list!)

"If you do nothing else: be in love, and be gentle, with YOU."

~Melyssa

The proverbial "tip of the iceberg"... These links take you to information already mentioned above for easy reference, plus more about what fuels my passion, to tide you over:

Websites:

SHESEVERYWHERE.COM

Matrix Energetics' Official Website

TheSnuggery.org: All hearts love a good snuggle.

Crowning Lotus bEARTH Doula

 

Books:

The Field: The Quest for the Secret Force of the Universe by Lynee McTaggart: You may need a dictionary handy for this one, but not much, and it's worth it!

Anatomy of the Spirit by Carolyn Myss: Shows how the 3 major world religions are so similar that they invariably unite us ALL as ONE.

A Whole New Mind: Why Right-Brainers Will Rule the Future by Daniel H. Pink: I'm left-handed, so I use my right brain "easier"... meaning I'm "brain ambidextrous". ALL can be "this way", too. This book says why it's useful and will become necessary, and how to help yourself to become proficient.

Be Here Now by Ram Dass: born Richard Alpert into a wealthy family, collected degrees from Tufts, Wesleyan and Stanford, then became a psychology professor at Harvard. Was fired as a Harvard professor for early experiments with LSD and other hallucinogenic drugs and became a follower of the path of Eastern philosophy.

 

Inspiring:

Amma: a Hindu spiritual leader and guru, who is revered as a saint by her followers. She travels the world giving her blessing through hugs and countless more ways found on her site... She is widely respected for her humanitarian activities and universal spiritual teachings.

DYRDEK DAY: Start at 3:18

Self Inflicted: Part of my colorful past includes severe depression and anxiety (never "officially diagnosed") which sometimes manifested as self-harm. When my story is needed (you can ask curiosity questions, too), it comes out. If you need help, I’m here for you, your family and friends... all feel alone, for any reason.

Ho’oponopono: An ancient Hawaiian technique of forgiveness and reconciliation... Help for these criminally mentally insane souls means potential help for anyone.

“Life's most persistent and urgent question is: what are you doing for others?”   Unknown
