story:
EDIBLE JEWELS 

 

Cakes Come True Bakery is an online bakery. The goal for this business is to go from an online bakery to small sustainable store front in the city of Moreno Valley, California. Also, we want to make it accessible for customers to come at their convenience to either browse, taste, and leer at the confectionary wonderments.

 

SPARKLING ROSETTE CHOCOLATE CAKE 

 

What Dreams May Come...

In California alone there are hundred of bakeries popping up left to right. So you might ask what is going to set Cakes Come True Bakery apart from the rest? Well, for starters we want to open a boutique bakery bar. This is where you can get your dessert paired with drinks and edible jewels. Wether it be a color coordinated drinks and cupcakes or a cupcake filled with ice cream or cakes draped in edible diamonds. Here at this bakery you would be able to get anything your heart desires. If you can dream it then we will build it. Every dessert will have something paired with it and not just icing. There are many delicious deluxe flavors that have been concocted and received rave reviews. Cool right? Just imagine it, you can get an expresso with a side of cupcake, or a strawberry soda with side of lemon meringue petite four. We will pile it up with icing and sprinkles or fill it with ice cream or delicious cream. Whatever your heart desires. This is the kind of project so unique, amazing, and memorable all in one. We want to open a bakery boutique bar and make dessert dreams come true for everyone. Every time we enter the kitchen we get this feeling of euphoric bliss and then we fall in love all over again with these great works of sugar confections. Come and get the same feeling we get when we make confectionary wonderments.

 

 

DESIGNER MINI MOUSE CAKE POPS 

 

Why A Boutique Bakery Bar?

Have you ever seen a boutique bakery bar before? I can definitely say I haven’t. And definitely not in the area of Moreno Valley, California. We want to turn a building into a vintage royal dessert shoppe. It’s going to be a very vibrant, beautiful and elegant.The concept is to have a place like you’ve never seen in the pastry industry. How about a custom edible purse? Or a custom edible shoe. This is what we can bring to you if you help us fund our shop. Remember you eat with your eyes so this place will be perfect for us. This is going to very everybody friendly. We just need help with funding some of this project. We want continue to give desserts worthy of standing ovations.

Right now we are using a commercial kitchen to complete the orders but business is starting to boom and we really need more space. Our  customers deserve more than just a delivery. They want to come in a browse the sweet wonderland of treats. They want to come in and sample and taste and leer in total bliss at the unique designs. We need to be more accessible to the fans and customers. What ever you can donate will help. We need to go forward and right now we are asking for help to get started. 

In March 18, 2012 Kinnie, the owner, was featured on Food Networks Cupcake Wars and came out a finalist. Can you believe it the last two standing? And needless to say,  business is really picking up from the television debut. Customers want to come out and visit everyday and not just select days. Having a boutique bakery bar everyday is just not possible without help. Customers show up at the commercial kitchen, even when we are not there, demanding more accessible pick up hours. We need this building to make you all happy.

 

DESIGNER EARTH DAY CAKE POPS IN WINE GLASSES AND COLORED SUGAR 

 

Where The Money Will Go: 

1.A down payment on rent: We want to rent a building for about $2,100 a month. That is $12,600 for 6 months.

2.City permits: We need $1000 for state and county permits to operate in the city of Moreno Valley.

3.Renovating the inside of the building: It is going to cost around $10,000 to get the inside to be picture perfect just the way we love it. We need refrigerators, freezers, ovens, and mixers oh my.

4.Supplies and Inventory: We only purchase the best ingredients from local vendors and that will cost us $3,000. Included in that will be our packaging. We want something eco friendly and couture.

5.Advertising and Marketing: It’s going to cost us $2,000 

6.Employees: We need 2 part time employees and that will cost us $4,300 for 6 months.

7.Delivery Truck: We need $6,000 on a downpayment for a better delivery truck to bring our goods to your place of business and or house. 

My dream is to build a different kind of bakery for people to come and enjoy. Bakeries are everywhere. I just want to be the different kind of bakery. 

 

 

DESIGNER EDIBLE HANDBAG 

 

Something In Return For Your Help...

And just so you know, anything you support us with we will give you something in return. There are cupcake, cookies and pies that your fantasies will desire. Everyone who helps gets something. You also need to know you are going to be a part of history and whatever you can contribute will be appreciated greatly.  Everyone loves a good cupcake but have you tasted a great one? We have listed what you will receive when you contribute to the project. And you know what? I think you will love it. Also, close to my heart, we want to give back. This business is not just for my benefit but for me to be able to give back to those who need me. Since Kinnie was a child she was diagnosed with juvenile diabetes. She wants to be able to donate proceeds to charities that need her and helped her. Such as the American Diabetic Association. You cannot do something for nothing.

 

 

BEAUTIFUL FAIRY DUST PEACH COBBLER CUPCAKES 

 

About The Family Business... 

Kinnie Haskins is a 31 year young woman who is absolutely in love with what she does. Around 2009, while she was working another job, she decided that she wanted to bring her business plan to life. She already baked all day everyday when she wasn’t working and she thought this would be perfect to open up a business. She just pushed herself into full drive to open Cakes Come True Bakery. On August 1, 2011 she officially opened her online company. And needless to say, she was, and still is, overly excited her business. Cakes Come True Bakery is her baby. And she wants to see it grow just as much as you do. As little as $1 will get you to become a part of history.

Recruited to help was her mother Mary and sister Jennifer. Jennifer was her assistant on the Food Network’s show Cupcake Wars. This family business needs a little help to grow. These women are looking to build a great addition to the community.

This is the passion for the women of Cakes Come True Bakery. Kinnie is completely in love with what she does. She has drain her savings and everything in her bank account to make this possible. We just need some help to get it going. Designing and creating memories for people is the legacy of Cakes Come True Bakery. We need this dream to come true. Kinnie has been baking ever since she was a little girl of the age of 5 with her father and mother Mary. Her sister just loves to dedicate her off time to helping her build the business. The recipes we use belong to the family and we just upgrade them a bit for the new day. At this time Cakes Come True Bakery offer so many varieties of items and over 150 cupcake combinations. WOW I know right.  We get rave reviews from the customers, friends and family about the work we put into this.This is not just a job but a passion. Everyone loves the taste and design presented. When we competed on Food Network’s Cupcake Wars the judges even loved the cupcakes. And that was on camera viewed by millions. So, this project needs to be successful so that everyone can taste a little bit of old southern perfection with a twist. Did I mention we started a groupon with over 700 people who purchased the groupon? We need a place so the customers can have to most rewarding experience ever. We are growing and we need to spread our wings but we need help.

 

THE BEAUTIFUL OWNER KINNIE HASKINS AND HER CUPCAKES 

 

 

as seen on FOOD NETWORK'S CUPCAKE WAR 

Episode air date March 18th 2012 Professional Bull Riders 

However You Help Is Always Appreciated...

We would love to reach the goal we are aiming for but we want you to give however you see fit. As mentioned before, we are greatly appreciative for your support and long to see us move forward and become a force to be reckoned with. If you have any questions at all about what we are doing here please feel free to contact us anytime. Again thank you from the bottom of our hearts.

story:
Say goodbye to Fake Profiles, Online Identity Theft and Catfishing!

In a digital world, where online relationships are prevalent, it is important to protect your online identity. As wonderful as the Internet is, it is unfortunately a breeding ground for FAKERS.


How They Do It.

It only takes a matter of minutes for a person to download all of your photos, start up a new profile under a different name, and begin faking out the entire online world...with an image of your beautiful face as the bait.

The most unfortunate part is that most of these fakers are out to hurt other people. Catfishing has taken the world by storm, even affecting some of the most well-known individuals in society...ahem...ahem...Manti Te'o ;)

Veriphoto To The Rescue.

We are in the process of developing a digital platform which will thwart all attempts to steal your online identity. Veriphoto also doubles as a supercool photoviewing application. It will truly be a brilliant way to view all of your and your friend's photos, from various social platforms, ALL IN ONE PLACE!


What We Need & What You Get

We will be using the funds from this preliminary crowdfunding campaign to apply for a utility patent with the US Patent and Trademark Office. Because of the nature of the technology, we can't yet disclose exactly how it functions until a decision is reached on our patent application, but we can say that it will change the way the World (Wide Web) works.

The funds will help pay patent application, search and attorney’s fees. Our goal is to raise $15,000, but even if our efforts fall short we will stay the course and make certain Veriphoto is a big hit! For your genorosity, we are giving away some really cool rewards, which are listed on the right side of this page.

The Impact

Your contribution will go a long way in helping us reach our goal of putting an end to fakers and provide the online global community with a sense of security, as far as identities are concerned. Plus, you get to be a part of something BIG with an actual purpose.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't provide help monetarily, you can still help:

  • Spread the word about Veriphoto
  • Share this page with any and everyone you know
  • Join Veriphoto when it's released
  • Like us on Facebook (See Below)
  • Follow us on Twitter (See Below)

 

THANKS FOR YOUR TIME AND CONSIDERATION!

 

- The Veriphoto Team

story:
My name is Yothin Amnuayphol. I have been serving coffee and food to the PNCA (Pacific Northwest College of Art) community for the past 12 years. My relationship with PNCA and the Portland art community goes back even further as a former art student. I graduated from PNCA in 1988 with a major in Ceramics. I have kept close ties with the college and when the opportunity arose to work in such a creative neighborhood, I was happy to repond. In the near future, PNCA will be moving to its new home in the North Park Blocks. For me to continue to be a part of PNCA and to continue the strong relation I have with the school community of students, staff, alumni and the neighborhood, I will have to transform from an indoor coffee stand to a mobile van.

My project is to transform a Citroen van, a unique European vechicle I strongly feel would be a great addition to the future of the creative community. We have found the vehicle in France from a reputable dealer and he is ready to go ahead with the project. The proposed funds being raised from the project would primarily be dedicated to purchasing this van which would be transformed into one of the most original espresso vans you would see around town. 

The entire project would cost around $30,000.00. I am planning on using my own savings and some loans to cover what I have proposed..

Thanks for all your support and please help get the word out to your families and friends. Indiegogo also has an easy way to share information. If you want to know more about my project, please contact me at blackdogbkk@yahoo.com or stop by at PNCA and we will talk over coffee.

My project is to transform a Citroen van, a unique European vechicle I strongly feel would be a great addition to the future of the creative community. We have found the vehicle in France from a reputable dealer and he is ready to go ahead with the project. The proposed funds being raised from the project would primarily be dedicated to purchasing this van which would be transformed into one of the most original espresso vans you would see around town. 
The entire project would cost around $30,000.00. I am planning on using my own savings and some loans to cover what I have proposed..


Thanks for all your support and please help get the word out to your families and friends. Indiegogo also has an easy way to share information. If you want to know more about my project, please contact me at blackdogbkk@yahoo.com or stop by at PNCA and we will talk over coffee.

story:
Meet Ed and Eats

My name is Ed and I need your help in bringing Eats to life! 
I've been a chef for seven years and have worked everywhere from meals on wheels and hospital kitchens, to a tapas food cart to fine dining molecular gastronomy based restaurants. While every kitchen and chef has helped shape me as a cook, I've always maintained a deep love for simple, but never boring, meals. I mean those meals that you dive into knowing that not only are they going to taste incredible but that they're also going to nourish you. Those meals that comfort but also inspire you. That, at it's heart, is my vision for Eats. Delectably creative sandwiches and sides made with ingredients sourced from the bounty of California, from Valley to Coast, that will brighten your spirit and make your tastebuds wild with joy! 

 

So, what will the funds go towards?


Excellent question! The cart itself is covered and has been assembled by the fantastic crew at Fresno's Quality Concessions. The cart is a fully functional mobile kitchen complete with range, oven, hood, fridge, freezer, deep fryer, three compartment sink... if you need it to prepare rad meals, it'll be in there. However, high quality equipment didn't leave me with much spare change and this is where you come in!

Donations to this campaign will provide me with:

  • Basic cooking equipment and supplies such as saute pans, stock pots, hotel pans, cutting boards, spatulas, spoons, tongs, etc. 
  • Beautification of the Eats-mobile! Help us turn a lean, clean, cooking machine into a cart that will catch your eye. Plans include the application of the Eats logo plus a complete paint job. 
  • A compost bin or worm box in order to turn food scraps into soil gold!
  • Administration and advertisement costs. Getting the business end of things streamlined and making the business known can rack up some serious cash. Help us get the Eats name out and also help me keep things organized. 

Why Eats matters

My passion is cooking and in sharing those creations with others. When you donate to this campaign, you'll be helping a small business find it's feet. A business that, when it succeeds, will open up employment opportunities to other aspiring cooks, generate more support for local farms, spread the word on whole foods, and educate people about the value of California's agricultre and viticulture communities. The Valley area is, ironically, a food desert. More and more fast food chains go in and less and less meals made with care, joy, and whole foods are consumed. Eats is hoping to help change the tide. 

MFK Fisher succinctly wrote "first we eat, then we do everything else". How can you hope to do good if you don't eat well? As part of my "doing good" long-term goal for Eats, I will put a portion of my profits toward local food banks, supporting school gardens, and other deserving non-profits that work for the good of the people that help grow the food for America's tables and support sustainable agriculture. I'm invested in helping to maintain the health and growth of our agriculture because my wife and in-laws run Couture Farms; a fourth generation, organic, family-owned operation, here in the Central Valley's west side. Seeing the hard work that they and all of their employees put into the continuation of their business, as well as the work of their neighbors and fellow farmers, has made me want to connect consumers with the farmers behind their food and also pass on some education to my future customers. A good meal shouldn't just satisfy hunger. It should inspire, build community, and educate. I also refuse to "greenwash" anything I do. From my business cards (made from recycled paper and printed with low VOC soy ink) to my t-shirts (organic cotton) to the food that I will provide (focus on organic and whole ingredients), I will stand by my commitment to tread as lightly as possible on our planet by always searching for the most conscientious option. 

Eats. Simple name, simple vision, far-reaching effects. 

 

Whether it be 50 cents or 500 bucks, every donation is appreciated! Money tight right now? No problem! Word of mouth via your actual mouth, Facebook, Twitter, snail mail, pony express, whatever, is super valuable too. 

Thank you and remember; eat well, do good.

story:
About Us

So, you are wondering how we got wrapped up in the whole bbq scene with a name like Ranucci? Well, we love to cook, everyone knows Italians love to cook! And when Alex relocated to Charlotte from upstate New York (Binghamton) it was just natural that the local cuisine would begin to influence his cooking. He began experimenting with ribs and then perfecting his sauce until whallah - we knew we were on to something!

After several years of competing in the professional BBQ circuit with our close-knit family team: Alex, his mom and dad, Ed and Cathy, his wife Zoe, and his sister Deana, we have assembled a significant trophy collection… many first place awards along with our most recent conquest - Grand Champions of the 2013 Q-City BBQ Competition in Charlotte.

With momentum from our wins, Alex has been able maintain a lucrative catering business for almost 10 years. Then, after a short stint owning and running a restaurant he was left longing for the creative freedom of experimenting with sandwich concoctions and mingling with his customers... but being in the confines of a stationery kitchen 24/7 just did not serve his passion the way that he had hoped. A true BBQ Pit Master needs to be outside, with smoke billowing through the open air, filling the senses of passerby's with the intoxicating smells of pork slow smoking for hours.

And so, he is now ready to take this to the next level and bring Ranucci's Big Butt BBQ outside, where it belongs, to the streets of NC.  This will allow us to not only serve up our Award Winning BBQ truly prepared as we do for competitions - but we will also be creating unique sandwiches and meals to keep our customers intrigued and coming back for more!
To find out more about our story or see the awards we have received from our bbq, please visit www.ranuccis.com

But all this comes with a price... and that is where YOU come in. Our friends, our family, our fans and loyal customers. In order for us to do this right and be truly successful, we need all the help and support we can get.

What We Need & What You Get

Our personal goal is to raise $10,000 to help fund the truck and the new smoker that will be mounted on the back porch.  This is about 1/3 of the cost and will give us the boost we need.

As a sponsor you will be a large part of our success for launching our truck to bring our love of bbq to the streets of NC.  Please see the many levels of sponsors and great rewards to the right.

Equipment we will be purchasing:
Trailer - $21,000
New Smoker - $9,000
Kitchen Equipment - $6000
Vinyl Wrapping - $2000

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether you contribute to our campaign or not, please take 30 seconds and share this via your social media profiles, or pass it on to someone who is passionate about BBQ.

story:
Our Goal

Located in Minneapolis's Mill City District, Magna is unlike any other health and fitness facility. There are no memberships here, no contracts to sign, and each of our clients has access to our full range of services.

We take an integrated approach to health and fitness, teaching people to be healthy for life. By providing the highest quality fitness training, nutrition coaching, acupuncture, chiropractic and massage therapy, MAGNA's services extend way beyond those of any ordinary gym.

Making It Happen

We have 1400 square feet of raw, open space with an industrial vibe that is just begging to be used for something as kick-ass as indoor cycling. Our goal is to get about 20 bikes in there and offer a range of classes throughout the day.

The bikes we want are repurposed from another facility, allowing us to keep costs down without sacrificing quality. At approximately $500 each, 20 bikes will cost $10,000; add administrative fees for this campaign, and our total comes to $10,750.

Any donation brings us closer to our goal and will go towards as many of these bikes as possible. We're committed to making this happen, and we sincerely appreciate your help.

Don't just take our word for it, though. Check out some of the great perks we have for our contributors! 

The Results

MAGNA is committed to providing accessible, professional service to anyone looking to reduce their healthcare footprint and gain control over their health. With your help, whether in the form of donation or actively sharing and promoting our campaign, we can continue to find the big and small ways people can be healthier everyday.

story:
“Brilliant.  If they rolled this out across the country, it could fix the economy.”  - FOX NEWS

The paintjob above may look like the work of a madman, but the color combo packs a big punch.

If you let us turn your house into a billboard we’ll pay your mortgage. When we’re done we’ll repaint your home back to any colors you choose. Oh yeah ... the repaint is on us. 

Looking better?

Why are we doing this? Because somebody has to do something!!!!

The housing market is a mess. Every three months, 250,000 families lose their homes to foreclosure. Foreclosure stinks!!!  It lowers property values in the entire neighborhood. It increases crime, homelessness, and unemployment.  It causes divorce and suicide. 

Government programs aren’t bailing out homeowners fast enough so rather than sit back and watch, we decided to do something about it.

Introducing the "Billboard Home" Rescue Plan.

We painted our first home a few months ago.  We saved a family from ruin and a neighborhood from depreciating home values. Now were’ ready to help 3000 more families and 3000 more neighborhoods. The $925,000 we’re raising will help us achieve our goal. 

A contribution of $34 from you right now will keep a family in their home for an extra day.  $238 will keep a family in their home for a week.  $1061 will provide relief for a family for a month.  More importantly, the money you provide will help a family save money so they can get back on their feet. Whatever you can contribute please contribute today.

Can you spare $4 to help your neighbor? Please ... let's make a difference. Let's keep a family in their home.

 

Foreclosure Facts

Homeowners Facing Foreclosure

  • 1 out of every 200 homes will be foreclosed upon. 
  • 250,000 new families enter into foreclosure every month. 
  • One child in every classroom in America is at risk of losing his/her home because their parents are unable to pay their mortgage.

 

The Financial and Emotional State of Homeowners Facing Foreclosure

  • Many homeowners already are at the financial edge:
  • 43% of American households spend more than they earn each year.
  • 52% of employees live paycheck to paycheck.
  • Nearly 42% of all American households do not have enough in liquid financial assets to support themselves for at least three months. 
  • 46% of American households have less than $5,000 in liquid assets, including IRAs.

 

The Cost of Foreclosure for Cities and Communities

Homes in foreclosure that become vacant provide sites for crime or other neighborhood problems. One foreclosure can impose up to $34,000 in direct costs on local government agencies, including inspections, court actions, police and fire department efforts, potential demolition, unpaid water and sewage, and trash removal.

One foreclosure can result in as much as an additional $220,000 in reduced property value and home equity for nearby homes. 

 

Benefits of Homeownership

  • Homeowners are more satisfied with their lives and are happier. Homeownership is positively associated with physical, mental and emotional health.
  • Children of homeowners are likely to perform higher on academic achievement test and are more likely to finish high school. They also have fewer behavioral problems in school and are less likely to become pregnant as teenagers.

 

BillboardHome Application

We're looking for houses to paint. In fact, paint is an understatement. We're looking for homes to turn into billboards. In exchange, we'll pay your mortgage every month for as long as your house remains painted. 

Here are a few things we're looking for. You must own your home. It cannot be rented or leased. We'll paint the entire outside of the house, minus the roof, the windows and any awnings. Painting will take approximately 3 - 5 days. Your house must remain painted for at least one month and 
may be extended up to a year. If, for any reason, you decide to cancel after one month or if we cancel the agreement with you, we'll repaint your house back to the original colors.

If you're prepared to splash ads on your home just submit the application form below. You can post home photos on our Facebook page. We review every application. If your home has the 'it' factor a team member will reach out to you.

For as little as $4, you can make a difference. Please contribute to our campaign.  Your generosity will help us save more families.

For a billboard home application please CLICK HERE

story:
Short Summary

I am a mom of 7 kids with a passion for reading.  I heard about the "Little Free Library" project and want to bring ten of these to my community.  I love to read and would like to inspire this in others.  I want to get my children and other children in the community involved in reading and helping others.

What We Need & What You Get

I am aiming to raise $2950 to construct and install freestanding "libraries" that house donated books.  The approximate cost for materials, installation and registration of a library is $275 each.  All of the labor required for construction and installation will be donated by community and family members.  If additional funds are raised, more libraries will be built and installed in surrounding neighborhoods. 

These libraries are essentially small, enclosed bookshelves that hold 25-50 books or more.  They are placed in local neighborhoods where people are able to gather.  Books are donated or borrowed at any time with the theme---"borrow one leave one". The libraries contain books for both children and adults.  Each 'library' is maintained by a volunteer and is located on private property along a walking or biking route.  Advertising is done through local community organizations and by word of mouth.

If we raise less than our goal, we will simply construct fewer libraries and have local fundraisers to complete the project.


The Impact

With all of the technology constantly surrounding us children (and adults) sometimes forget the pleasure to be found in reading a book.  These libraries help return the joy of reading to people who may have forgotten.  They help to increase reading skills in children who might not have access to a variety of books. The libraries also give a place for others to donate their gently used books that otherwise might be thrown away.  A sense of community and social gathering is always a plus.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this idea with others so that we can make a difference in the literacy of a community.

story:
The Goal

The Shoebox Project is a non-profit initiative that collects small gifts, which are packaged in shoeboxes, and distributed to women in shelters just before the holidays. Each shoebox is approximately valued at $50.00 each so we would like to raise money to help purchase enough small gifts to fill over 30 shoeboxes! 

This year the Burlington Shoebox Project would like to surpass our goal of last year and donate 100 shoeboxes in total, to all the shelters in the Halton region. So we are getting started a little bit earlier this year.

My name is Crystal Foster and I heard about the Shoebox Project from a coworker last year during the holiday season. She came to me one morning after she arrived at work to let me know about a great initiative she had heard about on the radio. She had approached myself and some of the other employees in hopes we would be able to help her fill a couple shoeboxes to send to a women's shelter in Toronto. I thought this was a wonderful cause but I knew of a place a lot closer to home that would benefit from these shoeboxes. 

So I signed up to run the Burlington/Milton chapter to donate shoeboxes to two local women's shelters in our very own community. It was three weeks before Christmas when I informed my friends, family, and coworkers that my goal was to donate 20-25 shoeboxes to a local women's shelter. 

5 days before Christmas, the car was loaded up with 30 shoeboxes ready to be delivered! The response by the community was so overwhelming and the joy of being able to make this happen was so amazing that I decided to take part in it again this year.

What We Need

  • Our goal is $1,000 of which it will be divided amongst over 20 shoeboxes (got to love those 5/$10 deals during the holidays!) 
  • No matter how much is donated by the fundraising date, all the funds will go towards filling as many shoeboxes as possible.

The Impact

Putting together a shoebox is simple and this small gesture of kindness is very much appreciated by its recipient. We encourage you to build your own shoebox – either solo or with the help of a friend, your mother, sister, etc. See our suggested items under “Other Ways You Can Help” (below), and then drop-off your decorated shoeboxes at one of our many locations. You can find locations in the 'albums' section on our page!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you would rather donate a shoebox or a newly purchased "small gift" donation to help us reach our goal here are a few ideas of what to include:

- Body or hand lotions
- Makeup (mascara, lipstick, nail polish. etc. Please NO concealer or foundation)
- Toothbrush, toothpaste and floss
- Chocolates, cookies, candies
- Mitts, hats, scarves
- Perfume
- Brushes, combs
- Public transportation tickets/ phone cards
- Gift certificates (ie. McDonald’s, Tim Horton’s, Pharmacies, Wal-Mart) (Please include the receipt!)

Questions?

Feel free to post your questions on our Facebook wall or send them to burlington@shoeboxproject.com and one of our volunteers will get back to you asap!

Details to Come:

1. Drop off locations

2. A "perk" for the person with the largest donation (ie. cash, credit, cheque or shoeboxes)
story_txt:
The Goal
The Shoebox Project is a non-profit initiative that collects small gifts, which are packaged in shoeboxes, and distributed to women in shelters just before the holidays. Each shoebox is approximately valued at $50.00 each so we would like to raise money to help purchase enough small gifts to fill over 30 shoeboxes! 
This year the Burlington Shoebox Project would like to surpass our goal of last year and donate 100 shoeboxes in total, to all the shelters in the Halton region. So we are getting started a little bit earlier this year.
My name is Crystal Foster and I heard about the Shoebox Project from a coworker last year during the holiday season. She came to me one morning after she arrived at work to let me know about a great initiative she had heard about on the radio. She had approached myself and some of the other employees in hopes we would be able to help her fill a couple shoeboxes to send to a women's shelter in Toronto. I thought this was a wonderful cause but I knew of a place a lot closer to home that would benefit from these shoeboxes. 
So I signed up to run the Burlington/Milton chapter to donate shoeboxes to two local women's shelters in our very own community. It was three weeks before Christmas when I informed my friends, family, and coworkers that my goal was to donate 20-25 shoeboxes to a local women's shelter. 
5 days before Christmas, the car was loaded up with 30 shoeboxes ready to be delivered! The response by the community was so overwhelming and the joy of being able to make this happen was so amazing that I decided to take part in it again this year.


What We Need

Our goal is $1,000 of which it will be divided amongst over 20 shoeboxes (got to love those 5/$10 deals during the holidays!) 
No matter how much is donated by the fundraising date, all the funds will go towards filling as many shoeboxes as possible.



The Impact
Putting together a shoebox is simple and this small gesture of kindness is very much appreciated by its recipient. We encourage you to build your own shoebox – either solo or with the help of a friend, your mother, sister, etc. See our suggested items under “Other Ways You Can Help” (below), and then drop-off your decorated shoeboxes at one of our many locations. You can find locations in the 'albums' section on our page!

Other Ways You Can Help
If you would rather donate a shoebox or a newly purchased "small gift" donation to help us reach our goal here are a few ideas of what to include:
- Body or hand lotions- Makeup (mascara, lipstick, nail polish. etc. Please NO concealer or foundation)- Toothbrush, toothpaste and floss- Chocolates, cookies, candies- Mitts, hats, scarves- Perfume- Brushes, combs- Public transportation tickets/ phone cards- Gift certificates (ie. McDonald’s, Tim Horton’s, Pharmacies, Wal-Mart) (Please include the receipt!)

Questions?
Feel free to post your questions on our Facebook wall or send them to burlington@shoeboxproject.com and one of our volunteers will get back to you asap!


Details to Come:
1. Drop off locations
2. A "perk" for the person with the largest donation (ie. cash, credit, cheque or shoeboxes)

story:
Fragrance of the Mind

Concept

Within all of us there is a plethora of emotions, desires and aspirations. Each individual is liable to express each of these and the aspects that make up every one of them in a variety of ways. The ability to take any number of these feelings and transpose them onto paper, canvas or into a melody is called creativity and it is fed by a healthy dose of imagination. Through regularly indulging in their imagination and years of improving their techniques these individuals have become artists. As a writer and award winning poet myself I have had the honor of interacting with and meeting a great many fellow artists. The idea behind Fragrance of the Mind is to provide a platform for artists to showcase and market their creations. These men and women are of entirely different backgrounds and trades, converging to bring you a diversity of talent. We will be bringing you a splendor of paintings, sketches, literature and photography. With our current list of talents we intend to further our selection with time, only enhancing the flavour what we only hope will become your new favourite guilty pleasure.

What We Will Do

When we are funded we will begin by creating our website. This is where we will sell the creations of our artists. It will become our hub from which we will branch out into secondary markets. While our website will be our home base in the long run we also intend to create an app from which we will be able to sell prints and sample works. Locally we will be partnering with a special events hall, where we will be provided space to house our own gallery. This will allow us to draw attention and hopefully local talent, while providing  yet another platform for our artists to sell their work.

How You Can Help?

As we already have our initial set of artists we now require the ability to set up our website; customized to our specifications. We also require the ability to market ourselves appropriately and through channels that will provide us with the optimum amount of coverage. Our goal is to both satisfy our artists and our clients and by funding us you grant us this ability. For us to reach our goal we need you to share our campaign with those that you know and to support us in any way that you can. If you have any questions or comments please contact us at FragranceoftheMind@gmail.com or add and like our group of the same name on Facebook.

Last, But Not Least

Don’t forget to use Indiegogo sharing tools and get the word out to anyone and everyone you know so that we can make this dream a reality!

story:
How Did We Get Here?

Fall down seven times, get up eight.  That has been my motto since 2008 when the housing crash sent my family into a tailspin.  My 10-year career as a bank loan office came skidding to a halt.  My husband's business dried up seemingly overnight.  We went from a comfortable life with no credit card debt and a financial plan on-track for a decent retirement to losing everything.  After a year with nearly no income, our credit cards were maxed out, our savings was nearly depleted and our home was in foreclosure.  What did we do? We started over.  We left the small town where we had lived for 10 years and moved to a larger city. My husband found a job with a decent company and I took the Disney travel business (MMP Travel) I had been working part-time to a full-time endeavor.  I worked as many hours as necessary to grow the business -- even working out of my father's hospital room so I could be with him toward the end of his fight with cancer.  Fast forward five years -- we are finally in a place where we once again pay our own bills with no outside help.  We have recovered from several more financial setbacks and continue to forge ahead.  My little travel business now has 15 agents and is continuing to grow -- but we need just a little more help.  I want to take my business to the next level so my family can be fully back on track, but just can't seem to find a way to make the jump. I've read books, taken classes and am even starting on my MBA but I need an expert to help me brand this business and make it a household name.  That's why I'm here.  I have the opportunity to meet with Shark Tank's Daymond John -- a branding expert.  I'm sure this meeting would help me find the path to reach my goals.  The obstacle?  Millionaires charge hefty fees for their time -- more than my small business can absorb at this juncture.  So, I've come here in the hopes that others will help me to give my business the leg up it needs.  I want to swim with a Shark!

Why Do I Need Help?

Through GameChangerMeetings.com, I have the opportunity to schedule a one-on-one meeting with Daymond John to get his assistance in getting my business where it needs to go.  He can help with branding, marketing,  and, perhaps, even some celebrity endorsements.  He has the skills and experience that I currently lack.  I have no fear of hard work. I just need to know how to work smarter!

As I mentioned, Mr. John's time does not come cheaply.  For a dinner meeting, it is $4,000 plus the cost of the meal.  This sort of meeting is my goal.  If I have only one shot at meeting a man of this caliber, I'd like to make it as long as possible.  I am asking for $5,500 to cover the cost of the meeting, the meal, the Indiegogo fees and the trip to NYC.

If I don't reach my entire goal, I have the option of shorter meetings with Mr. John.  While I am hoping to have several hours of his time to learn as much as possible, if I have to make do with a 30-minute phone call, I will gladly do it!  Even a little of his knowledge would be a boon to me.

What Do You Get?

Knowledge!  I will share what I learn from Daymond John.  If you own a small business, you can get game-changing ideas for pennies.

Clothes!  MMP Travel t-shirts

Savings!  Discounts on travel booked through MMP Travel!

VIP Tours!  Get a personal tour of Walt Disney World!

Would This REALLY Make A Difference?

This meeting would truly be a game-changer for me.  A few months ago, just as things were finally stabilizing, we got the news that my husband will be laid off.  So, I took on additional work to take care of my family, but my business is the most important thing to me.   Now, I work seven days a week -- nights, weekends, early mornings -- and my business continues to grow.  This meeting the Daymond John would give me the skills and knowledge to take my business to the point where it could once again be my only full-time endeavor.  It would let me support my family while still having some time to enjoy life a little more.

Why Fund Me? 

I give back.  I believe in paying it forward.  Recently, I noticed that travel discounts are often available to active and retired military but not to other critical personnel who make sacrifices to make our lives better -- veterans (who didn't retire), police officers, firefighters and medical personnel.  So, I started a special discount to Walt Disney World and Universal Orlando (our agency's area of specialization) just for them.  I fund this out of my own pocket.  It's my way of saying, "Thanks."  The more this company grows, the more I can give.

Can't Donate?  Please Share.


Even if you can't donate (or simply would rather not), please share my story.

story:
Create a home. Change a life.

There are over 400,000 youth in the foster care system across the United States.  At age 18 or 21, a foster youth that was never adopted into a family “ages out” of the foster care system, finding themselves out on their own and having to fend for themselves. Over 3,200 foster youth "age out" each year in LA County alone.  

Without a family or a community to help them make their first home a place that they can truly call their own, many youth struggle with this transition.  Most of these individuals have absolutely no means to furnish their space.Despite the various challenges foster youth face; there remains ambition and determination to reconstruct a stronger future. 

A Sense of Home (ASOH) is building a volunteer movement across the country beginning in Los Angeles. Using social media to request donations, volunteers collect the donated furniture & household items and bring them to the empty apartment of a former foster youth -- creating their first ever home. The ASOH experience not only offers the youth a new beginning, a sense of “home” and belonging — but a community that is invested in them succeeding. 

We need funding to create 300 homes in LA for 2015; cost of $1,000/home, and to develop the digital technology to take it nationwide in 2016.  We are hoping to raise money to start furnishing 40 homes for the holiday season and into the new year at a cost of $40,000.

These foster youth find themselves eating on the floor, sleeping on the floor, and studying on the floor -- yet ASOH is capable of providing what they need. ASOH provides the platform to tap into those who want to give, with those who want to volunteer in a meaningful way and connect this movement with these amazing youth.  
BEFORE


AFTER

A Sense of Home will become fully staffed and eventually run by former foster youth. The overhead costs of setting up the structure, leasing trucks & space, hiring staff and creating homes costs approximately $1,000/home.


How does it work?  

Step 1: Identifying Need.  Through its relationships with nonprofit organizations providing transitional services to foster youth, ASOH identifies youth who are "aging out", are able to secure a section 8 Apt, are enrolled in college course and/or have 30 hours of work/week.

Step 2: Furniture Collection.  Harnessing the power of social media, volunteers gather donated furniture & household items from within their community utilizing a ASOH-sponsored truck.

Step 3: Apartment Furnishing.  Volunteers and the foster youth furnish the youth’s section 8 apartment making the second hand items look and feel like new.

BEFORE


AFTER

Step 4: Housewarming Party.  Volunteers can choose to take the young recipient shopping for groceries, and help them prepare a healthy, simple meal to serve at their housewarming party. Volunteers and donors are invited to warm the "home", and the youth's new chapter is celebrated.

Step 5 : Pay it forward. The youth experiences the power of giving while serving as a volunteer to another foster youth during the creation of their home. They learn that "Everyone can be great, because everyone can serve.” {Martin Luther King Jr.}

Step 6 : Mentorship.  Volunteers who chose to stay connected with a youth are linked with an existing job coaching or mentor programs to acquire parameters & guidelines on coaching a youth towards a successful career path and/or a balanced life.

Step 7: Progress and Engagement. The youth’s progress is tracked on a unique digital platform that keeps the community engaged and connected with their journey.

What is Aging Out?

Federal and state support abruptly ends at age 18 or 21 (depending on the state) and these youth find themselves transitioning into their new lives without anything. Independent Living Programs (ILP) typically terminate when a youth turns 21.  

There are significant social returns and economic savings to be made by simply using what we have (too much stuff & goodness) to outstretch a helping hand to these youth without family and support. The costs of doing nothing effect us all. Conservatively it costs $8 billion to the United States every year.

Foster youth — who’ve experienced an average of seven relocations during their time in care — exit the system with nothing other than the statistics predicting that they will be the least likely to succeed in society.

  • More than 50% of foster youth who "aged out” experience homeless
  • Approximately 56% of foster youth who "aged out” become unemployed
  • 70% of all California State Prison inmates are former foster youth

TOGETHER WE CAN PUT A DENT IN THESE STATISTICS !!

“The ache for home lives in all of us” {Maya Angelou}

The Perks:

story:
Short Summary

Charles "Teddy" Pierre is the victim of a tragic mis-prosecution for a 2002 double homicide. He has already served 12 years in prison. Often we hear the misnomer that every prisoner thinks that he's "innocent." 

 THIS CASE IS DIFFERENT! 

Teddy has already had his guilty verdict vacated in light of new evidence. As you can see from the images of the letter above, the District Attorney acknowledged that they have received information from separate UNRELATED sources about the real perpetrator of these heinous crimes. The judge that presided over Teddy's case to vacate his verdict indicated that he fully expects his exoneration in light of the new evidence that has come to light.

Even the NYS Corrections Department, in light of the evidence, moved Teddy from the maximum security prison at Attica to the Monroe County Jail. 

Teddy has been awarded a new trial. The problem is that Teddy has run out of money to continue his defense the final mile to be released from incarceration. That's where WE NEED YOUR HELP! 

Here from Teddy about his case here:

http://www.democratandchronicle.com/videos/news/2014/08/13/9850117/

What We Need

Teddy needs to raise $25,000. Noted local attorney Van White, has taken up Teddy's legal cost pro-bono, but there are additional cost for the experts, DNA analysis, and the judicial process costs to file appeal documents to get this decision overturned. 

The Impact

Teddy represents an important moment in the struggle for justice and fairness in Rochester. Sometimes, the challenges of the criminal justice seem so overwhelming, but this is a rare instance where a system wrong can be righted. The system has already shown a willingness, but Teddy needs the funds to mount his final defense to be freed from prison. WE CAN DO THIS! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Now maybe you can't contribute, even though every little bit helps. Even if you can't donate, it doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Send out a tweet with our hashtag, #FREETEDDY

story:
Welcome!

First off I'd like to thank you all for taking the time to check out my campaign and read this, it means the world to me! 

My name is Hilary, I’m a 29 year old auto body repair technician from Toronto Canada. I knew since the moment I started working in an auto body shop at the age of 17 that one day I wanted my own shop.  Over the past 12 years I have worked non stop in this industry to build my skills and reputation, and be the best version of myself. I’ve worked for two of the most reputable shops in Canada, Legendary Motorcar and 427 Auto Collision as well as currently teaching auto body at Centennial College. From what started out as me being the sole female in the shop has evolved into 9 of us! Working with so many driven and talented young ladies gave me the idea to start Ink&Iron. We as women CAN succeed in this trade, and we can take it by storm….and  we’re damn good at it!

My goal with this campaign is to fund the start up an ALL FEMALE auto body shop. As well as employing a qualified all female staff, I’d like to focus on recruiting and training other young female apprentices in a nurturing and uplifting environment so that they can be the best they can be. Even if our goal isn’t met, every penny will still be put towards opining the shop, and bringing this dream to life!  

What is INK&IRON all about?

Ink&Iron will be a first of it’s kind! An all female auto body repair shop located in Toronto, Ont. Our services will include everything from general auto body repairs such as minor accident damage, dents and scratches and rust repair, to restorations, custom cars and paint.

What will Ink&Iron have to offer?

•  Complete auto body repair service

•  A friendly, professional, well trained and qualified staff with over 25+ years combined experience in the auto body industry

•  A positive environment for training and educating future female auto body repair technicians

•  A unique, one-of-a-kind business experience 

•  A group of talented young ladies who are very passionate about auto body repair. Whether it’s getting you car looking its best again after an accident, restoring that old muscle car you’ve had sitting around in the garage, or building you a complete custom car you could only dream of, our number one goal is to make YOU the customer happy!

Why do we want to open our own auto body shop?

•  Spending over 10 years working in the auto body industry, I’ve seen a lot of people overcharged for sub par work and this doesn’t sit well with me. I want to offer the Greater Toronto Area top quality work at competitive rates

•  We think the auto body industry could really benefit from a shop that’s completely owned and operated by females. We hope that this will help break the stereotype that auto body is a ‘man’s job’ as well as encourage other young females to pursue careers in the automotive field

•  We love the idea of creating a business where any female will be able to walk in and feel completely at ease. Often as a female with little automotive knowledge, you tend to fall victim of being overcharged for unnecessary work. We pledge to NEVER DO THIS!

•  Simply put we’re girls kicking ass in a male dominated field. We’ve found our niche, and we will stop at nothing to succeed!

 

Why Crowdfunding?

•  Crowdfunding is a great way to get our story out, and really get people excited about our idea! 

•  It’s a great way to test drive our idea, and see how willing people are to invest in it

•  Starting a new business is expensive. While we’ve invested our own money and contributed our own personal tools and equipment, the $20,000 we aim to raise will be used to cover first/last month’s rent of a small auto body shop. As well as purchasing essential materials to get us started, such as sandpapers, body fillers, paints and primers, sheet metal, etc. it will also be used to cover opening expenses such as advertisements, legal fees, utilities hook ups, and any renovations we might need to make 

•  It’s our chance to say thank you by offering some great perks for your generosity

Risks & Challenges

As with any small business start up, there is always a risk of failure. We feel confident that our experience and work ethic will push us towards success. We’ve spent several years working together as a team, so we know how to communicate well with each other and work efficiently. We aim to start small, with just a team of 5 girls so that we keep our overhead low and we always have the options to expand our business in the future. We feel that because our business is truly one-of-a-kind, we will attract a lot of publicity and business. We have a niche that no one else is currently serving, and we intend to use that to our advantage. 

How you can help

Even if you can’t contribute right now, that doesn't mean you can't help us reach our goal!:

•  Get the word out anyway you can!

•  Share this campaign on your Instagram, twitter, Facebook, Blog, Website, etc.

•  Tell your friends! Or anyone else you think might be interested in our story

THANK YOU ALL SO MUCH FOR TAKING THE TIME TO CHECK OUT MY CAMPAIGN, AND FOR YOUR SUPPORT. IT TRULY MEANS THE WORLD TO ME! LOVE YOU ALL!! XOXO

Hilary
story_txt:
Welcome!


First off I'd like to thank you all for taking the time to check out my campaign and read this, it means the world to me! 
My name is Hilary, I’m a 29 year old auto body repair technician from Toronto Canada. I knew since the moment I started working in an auto body shop at the age of 17 that one day I wanted my own shop.  Over the past 12 years I have worked non stop in this industry to build my skills and reputation, and be the best version of myself. I’ve worked for two of the most reputable shops in Canada, Legendary Motorcar and 427 Auto Collision as well as currently teaching auto body at Centennial College. From what started out as me being the sole female in the shop has evolved into 9 of us! Working with so many driven and talented young ladies gave me the idea to start Ink&Iron. We as women CAN succeed in this trade, and we can take it by storm….and  we’re damn good at it!My goal with this campaign is to fund the start up an ALL FEMALE auto body shop. As well as employing a qualified all female staff, I’d like to focus on recruiting and training other young female apprentices in a nurturing and uplifting environment so that they can be the best they can be. Even if our goal isn’t met, every penny will still be put towards opining the shop, and bringing this dream to life!  
What is
INK&IRON all about?
Ink&Iron
will be a first of it’s kind! An all
female auto body repair shop located in Toronto, Ont. Our services will
include everything from general auto body repairs such as minor accident
damage, dents and scratches and rust repair, to restorations, custom cars and
paint.
What will
Ink&Iron have to offer?
• 
Complete auto body repair service 
• 
A friendly, professional, well
trained and qualified staff with over 25+ years combined experience in the auto
body industry
• 
A positive environment for training
and educating future female auto body repair technicians 
• 
A unique, one-of-a-kind business
experience 
• 
A group of talented young ladies who
are very passionate about auto body repair. Whether it’s getting you car
looking its best again after an accident, restoring that old muscle car you’ve
had sitting around in the garage, or building you a complete custom car you
could only dream of, our number one goal is to make YOU the customer happy!
Why do we
want to open our own auto body shop?
• 
Spending over 10 years working in the
auto body industry, I’ve seen a lot of people overcharged for sub par work and
this doesn’t sit well with me. I want to offer the Greater Toronto Area top
quality work at competitive rates

We think the auto body industry could
really benefit from a shop that’s completely owned and operated by females. We
hope that this will help break the stereotype that auto body is a ‘man’s job’
as well as encourage other young females to pursue careers in the automotive
field

We love the idea of creating a
business where any female will be able to walk in and feel completely at ease.

being overcharged for unnecessary work. We pledge to NEVER DO THIS!

Simply put we’re girls kicking ass in
a male dominated field. We’ve found our niche, and we will stop at nothing to
succeed!

our story out, and really get people excited about our idea!

idea, and see how willing people are to invest in it
• 
Starting a new business is expensive.
While we’ve invested our own money and contributed our own personal tools and

raise will be used to cover first/last month’s rent of a small auto body shop.

story:
Pattaya, Thailand is a word-renowned location for human trafficking and global destination for pediphiles.

Who are WE?

The Bridge Center is a project of the 'Bridges to the Nations' ministry under 'The Haven Foundation', working to combat human trafficking in Thailand through:

  • A preventative Children's Center in an area infested with pediphiles
  • Prevention through Testimonial Camps in the Northeast of Thailand from where many trafficking victims come
  • Intervention through English classes to men and women currently in trafficking
  • Intervention through outreach and aid to a homeless beach where many have been subject to trafficking

We Need a Truck & You get Thai Jewelry!

  • Merry Christmas and Happy Holidays!  Are you still in need of a gift for that female in your life?  Mom, sister, wife, a new girlfriend with picky taste, friend, teenage daughter?  No gift could mean more than one that truly makes a difference, will make all of her girlfriends jealous with its beauty, and reminds you of the Thai culture where you are making a difference. 
  • With a gift of just $5 or more, you will receive a pair of beautiful Thai earrings or a broach/ hairpin.

  • With a gift of $25 or more, you will receive a cool T-shirt from the heart of Thailand!
  • With a gift of $100 or more, you will receive an exclusive Thai painting to hang on your wall or frame in your office!
  • If you go above and beyond and give $4,500, you will receive a TRIP TO THAILAND!  (see perks for details).
  • If the entire fundraising goal is not met within the time limit, we will keep the funds in account where we will continue to raise the funds through other means until we can buy a truck.

How can a TRUCK combat human trafficking?

We need a truck to:

  • Visit the families of the children (many who already want their children to work in the bars when they are older) in the center to build relationships that will impact their futures.
  • Bring children in greatest need to the center (they have to walk home from school far distances on Pedaphile-filled streets)
  • Transport teams to prevention camps in the Northeast of Thailand to build relationships with families, schools, and students to expose the truth of Pattaya city and offer them opportunities for a better future.
  • Bring homeless men and women with AIDS to a hospital for care.

Overcoming Challenges

We realize that a truck is a large investment, and that vehicles also cost gas money and will most likely have other necessary repairs.

  • Since this truck will be crucial to deepening the impact against human trafficking, we plan to take special care of the truck and have money set aside for immediate repairs before a problem worsens.
  • A friend of the organization cares for vehicles and will help us do frequent check-ups on its health.
  • We only want to get a truck in very good or new condition so that it will be long-lasting and worth the investment.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you are financially unable to contribute at this time:

  • Post this on your FB page or blog--YOU really can help fight human trafficking today!
  • Follow our FB page to learn more about how The Bridge Center is combatting human trafficking.

And that's all there is to it.  God bless you! :)

story:
Welcome to BEHAPPY2:

BEHAPPY2 is an international online shopping platform that promotes the shops and businesses within your local neighbourhood.

Choosing between the option of making a purchase from a business that you  know nothing about, or from the shop on the corner that supports your club or favourite association, without losing any of the advantages that go with buying online, it’s a sure bet that you’d choose the latter option each time.

By using BEHAPPY2, you can shop in all the shops and businesses from your neighbourhood and take advantage of all the offers and discounts usually associated with buying on the Internet as well.

How BEHAPPY2 works:

The real motor behind BEHAPPY2 is you and your community’s neighbourhood!

BEHAPPY2 provides you with the necessary technology to set up your own virtual commercial centre. In this commercial centre, the members within your community can purchase from the suppliers that support them and who also share your same passion, emotions and philosophy.

In that way, your community’s commercial centre is supportive and sustainable; this enables it to generate money in order to be able to develop activities for the community and reward members for their participation. The buyer is rewarded for his loyalty. The supplier, on merging with the dynamics of his community, will make a name for himself as being involved and supportive, more than before. And as a board member of a club or association, he will establish the groundwork and basis of a new source of structured and sustainable income.

In this masterly cycle, where economy and culture are intertwined, fair business practices also have their place.

Our masterful circle of economy, culture, Internet and physical market:


Communities that are identified by sectors:

SPORT (Federations, clubs, events, fan clubs …)

SOCIAL (Charities, education, environment …)

CULTURE (Art, music, books, science, tourism, philosophy, hobbies, movements …)

ETHNIC (Nationalities, origin-related or traditions …)

LOCAL (Village,city, region, exhibitions, etc.)

Each community can create its own personalised shopping centre on the BEHAPPY2 platform, so that it can generate a structured and repeated additional income. They will offer their products and services in line with the needs of the members of their community. This income will also benefit all community members.

Soon it will be possible for BEHAPPY2 members to also make their purchases in the actual physical shop of the supplier (instore). By using a special app, it will not only be possible to locate thousands of distributors/products, but members will also be able to buy any product or service using their accumulated discount vouchers or Happys.

This is a new system of payment linked to loyalty programmes and supporting the community through proactive commercial centres. And, this is all within the context of a new philosophy: to give thanks and be happy as well.

The philosophy of BEHAPPY2:

With BEHAPPY2 it is possible to create a solid and fair commercial activity in which each party that is a part of it feels really involved.

What’s the point of doing your shopping in businesses that you don’t share any links or infinity with? A better bet is to opt for local businesses, showing your support by making your purchases in their shops.

We can make a conscious decision to adopt a shopping habit that doesn’t harm small and local businesses that are located in our neighbourhood.

We can’t keep squeezing the same lemon until there is no more juice left, yet at the same time hope for a more supportive and just world.

You won’t have to run from one place to another just to save ten cents. Support your local shops, who make a daily effort to greet their loyal customers with a friendly smile. And then, by boosting your local community, you too will begin to feel happier.

And, if one day you can’t find what you are looking for in your local shops, you’ll always be able to find it by using BEHAPPY2’s search engine. Using this search engine, you’ll always be able to locate that shop or restaurant that you were looking for amongst thousands of other businesses that believe in the same philosophy.

A new philosophy requires an alternative plan

BEHAPPY2 = be happy too = you can be happy as well

-  We choose to not invest too much money in the traditional Above The Line method of marketing, and prefer more conventional strategies.

-  We invest money into making a more efficient system for everyone; businesses, communities and clients.

-  The profits generated go to everyone to ensure that everyone is happy.

-  Our efficiency is based on making things viral (on the Internet). Form a part of this and get involved.

-  Your communication is also our communication.

-  BEHAPPY2 is what unites us all.

-  If you talk to one or some, you’re talking to us all.

-  We think big, globally, but we act locally.

-  We use names and surnames.

Positive, humane, enthusiastic … happy

-  Creating a new way of consumption, which is more responsible, more sustainable, more supportive and by using common sense.

-  What sense is there in shopping in businesses that are not only remote physically, but also politically?

-  Express your preferences and your commitment.

-  Don’t be a Hopper, be loyal and buy locally.

Support your community and you’ll be happy as well.

Description of the advantages for:

Members:

-  They can buy all the products and services they want or need on a daily basis either online or instore, applying discounts on each purchase.

-  For each purchase they or a friend on their social network makes, they will receive a discount cheque (real euros, not just a voucher) and Happys (points changeable for cash in euro), which they can use to apply discounts to future purchases. (*)

-  With each purchase made they are supporting the community that they belong to.

-  The more they recommend their community’s commercial centre, the more discount vouchers and Happys they will receive, and the more they will support their community.

(*) Algorithms, BEHAPPY2’s own (patented), calculate how many discount vouchers and Happys correspond to each member based on his or her purchases and those of their friends within their social network.

These discount vouchers can be used in any of the shops within his community, giving him a generous discount off his next purchase, or even reducing the price of his purchase to 0€ by using his Happys too.

And with each purchase made, discount vouchers and Happys will be generated for lots more people as well.

Shops/businesses:

-  They will have their own online area for their online shop, with a practical and simple control panel.

-  Their database of loyal clients and potential ones will grow exponentially as the commercial centre grows (and the business).

-  Clients will be able to apply extra discounts in the shop of their choice thanks to the discount vouchers and Happys accumulated in previous purchases.

-  Thanks to the clients’ loyalty and the possibility of gaining discounts on their purchases, the small businesses will be able to compete with the bigger stores.

-  Each shop will appear not only in the commercial centre of his choice, but also in ALL of the commercial centres in every single community.

-  Each shop has the possibility, through its profile, to advertise in any commercial centre of his choice in an easy and economical way.

-  The shop will be able to enjoy the same benefits as its clients, because by being a member, he too will gain discount vouchers and Happys thanks to his extensive network.

-  The businesses that have their shop online already will be able to use our BEHAPPY2 API with the client, who, from the external page, will be able to pay for their purchase on BEHAPPY2 using the same payment methods and applying the same discounts.

[API = Application Programming Interface.]

-  If a client pays through the BEHAPPY2 API, it means that the business will not have to foot the bill for the additional charges associated with other forms of payment methods (Visa, Paypal, etc.)

-  The business or shop will be receive his commission immediately after the meal, collection or payment of the products or services sold. (**)

-  The business will always be paid in euro (or local currency) and never in discount vouchers or Happys!

-  The business will not have to offer any discounts, nor will he notice the discounts applied by the client with his vouchers and Happys in his earnings.

-  For products that have to be sent by post, the business will be able to take advantage of the competitive postage rates offered by BEHAPPY2.

(**) The business will receive 90% of the retail price, unless the purchase has been made with Happys, in which case he will receive 100%, and always in euros. The extra 10% is the usual commercial margin associated with forming part of a cashback platform.

Communities:

-  A community that has been recognised by BEHAPPY2 will have its own personalised online shopping centre.

-  Each community can bring new businesses or shops to it and receive a commission for doing so.

-  For each purchase made in his commercial centre, the community will receive a commission.

-  A community can fit his social network into his commercial centre and as a result receive many discount vouchers and Happys.

-  The discount vouchers and Happys can be converted into euro (or local currency).

-  Additional optimised visibility by his own partners-sponsors.

-  Each commercial centre will receive commission for the advertising and publicity (views and clicks) that is made within his platform.

-  Through BEHAPPY2, for the first time, a community will be able to give his sponsor the possibility to recuperate the money invested as a sponsor, using the community commercial centre as an additional sales channel.

BEHAPPY2 is an online cashback platform that engulfs the whole buying-selling process, and all its participating members. The client or individual, the suppliers or small businesses and the community with its own commercial centre of which they are all a part of. And these are communities that move in different circles such as culture, sport, social themes, etc. but who share the same common ideal with its members and distributors.

Description of the funding:

The funding of the discount vouchers and Happys is completely covered with the 10% of the commercial margin. The breakages of vouchers that have expired or that haven’t been used will be wholly reinvested in order to promote the growth of the social network.

But how does BEHAPPY2 generate its income?

a.  The shops and businesses will pay an annual fee of 100€ for which they will receive a space in the online shop that we will maintain, the use of our loyalty system and the app, and the API.

b.  The community as a whole will pay a unique fee of 500€ for registering the commercial centre. We will take care of everything related to maintaining the online space and all the administration concerned with calculating commissions and discounts for all its members.

c.  The commercial centre will pay a monthly rate of 2.5% from all the commissions gained, with a minimum of 25€.

d.  A percentage of the advertising (views and clicks) will go to the respective community, while another percentage will go to BEHAPPY2.

Description of our exclusive Perks (see also "Perks"):

E-Commerce Plot. Exclusive BEHAPPY2-product. You will lease and have usufruct rights for 10 years on an E-Commerce Plot.

Just like a real plot of land, E-Commerce Plots can be hired out, and in this way generate returns. But the E-Commerce have only conveniences, unlike a real plot of land, for which you would have to pay all kind of taxes. And we guarantee your plot will always have a tenant; you won’t have to search one, neither be concerned whether he pays the rent.

purchases.
